loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam T. is fifty three years old. He is married and has two children.  One of his children is working and the other is still in school. Sam enjoys operating his business and is motivated to work hard because he dreams of a better future for his kids. He owns and operates a "drinking spot" and sells items such as canned drinks, alcoholic beverages etc. However, he is constrained by the lack of capital and is unable to make meaningful progress. He requests the loan to buy more crates of beer, canned malt, Pepsi and Coke so that he can earn increased profits. He also believes in maintaining good customer relations.  The loan will enable him to materialize his dream. 

He is a member of the community group named "Hyebenehi" Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repaying their loans. His picture was taken after one of the group meetings.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for his business

loans.name: Shamo

texts.en:
Shamo Y. is 25 years old. Shamo sells men’s and women’s shoes in the central market of Sabirabad city. With over six years of working at the market, Shamo has enough experience to do his work successfully, and he has clients who always come back to him. 

Shamo is trying to satisfy the needs of all his customers, whatever their tastes and income levels. Shamo wants to increase his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Shamo promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks you for supporting him. Be an important part of the growth of Shamo’s business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka M. is 43 years old. She is married and has three daughters. Her husband has no fixed job, so Maleyka must work to support her family's needs. For 12 years she has rented a place in the local bazaar where she sells women's clothes, underwear, and socks. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon. Thanks to her hard work, her customers have increased. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 USD, which she will use to buy new clothing for the winter season. Maleyka is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To buy new clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward B. is 46 years old. He is married and the father of two children who are currently in school. He has been operating a corn mill machine for three years. Customers come to the mill to grind their maize, which they use to prepare local dishes like banku, corn dough, and kenkey. 

His production is on a small scale because he doesn't have enough money to buy a machine for processing. Edward wants to use the loan to buy more electric milling machines to improve production. He believes the loan would help him earn enough income to finance his children's education. 

Edward belongs to the Hyebenehi Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. His picture was taken after his group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more maize and an electric milling machine

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham H. is 44 years old. His wife is a housekeeper, and they have two sons. Ilham’s children are small now, but already he is working hard to ensure a good future for them. Ilham sells pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, canned meat, mayonnaise, and other foodstuffs in his store. He has been in the business for more that 15 years and has many loyal customers. His business is his family's main source of income. He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD for the term of 15 months. He will use the loan to upgrade and enlarge his stock, which will enable him to increase his income. Ilham thanks you for your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To upgrade and enlarge his stock

loans.name: Ashkabur

texts.en:
Ashkabur M., age 65, is a cattle breeder and a responsible father of six children who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. Ashkabur has more than 20 years of experience. 

He has high hopes for the present season. He wants to provide a secure environment for his family and save the money needed for the marriage of his adult sons. For this purpose, Ashkabul has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves. 

Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan B. is the father of three kids who are currently in school. He is a 48 year old businessman. He owns a rubber products shop and sells items such as rubber barrels, plates and gallons containers. He has been in business for the past twenty years. He says the rubber products are in demand because households use his items to store water during water shortages.  He will use the loan to re-stock his shop to improve sales. He believes that the loan will allow his business to grow. 

He belongs to the community group named "Hyebenehi" Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee each other, providing social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic containers and barrels.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub A. is a livestock farmer who sells meat in the local market. This work is his only source of income for supporting his wife, their two children. and his parents who all live together. He is 35 years old and carries an immense responsibility on his shoulders. He knows that he cannot give himself the luxury of rest because each moment counts toward increasing his productivity. In spite of leading a young family with lots of enthusiasm, he understands that to grow his business he needs additional money for investment capital. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $1200 USD. He will invest this money in his farm and purchase small animals so that, over time, he will increase his income and improve the quality of life for his family. If you are able to help Teyyub, please do so. He needs people like you to help him.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua K., who is 37 and has four children currently in school, trades in maize in the local market of Odumase in Koforidua, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana. She belongs to the community group called Hyebenehi Trust Group, whose members support one another both in their requests for and repayments of loans.

She is seeking a loan to buy a larger stock of maize to grow her business and increase sales. Afua says her major challenge is the children’s school fees, which she works hard to provide. She hopes to increase her savings to further support the children’s education in order to give them better future career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy a larger stock of maize

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is 36-year-old mother with one child who is currently in school.  Because beef is a popular source of protein in almost all Ghanaian homes, Rose obtains meat from Tema Harbour in the Greater Accra region of Ghana and sells it to customers in her area.  Rose wants to increase her profit by buying beef in bulk and selling it to customers in larger quantities.  There, she has joined the Hyebenehi Trust Group, which arranges for loans by having members guarantee loans for one another.  Rose is now requesting a loan of $450, which will allow her to purchase larger quantities of beef and also help pay for her child's education.

loans.use: To buy bulk quantities of beef.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen K. is 32 years old and owns a small grocery shop that sells rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and skins creams, powdered milk, and other standard products.  He wants to increase the number of products in his shop in order to make more profit and thereby support his niece's schooling.  Stephen joined Diligence Hands Trust Group, which secures loans by having members guarantee loans for one another and support each others' efforts.  Stephen is now requesting a loan of $875, which will allow him to purchase a greater variety and quantity of products for his grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of grocery products.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph K. is 32 years old and is single with no children, although he lives with his family. He has worked as a barber shop operator for eight years  in his community. Because of his technical and personal skills, he has attracted a lot of customers to his shop and has therefore employed additional hands to him serve the surplus of customers.  In order to further improve the services of his shop, Joseph wants to purchase additional machines, sterilizers, hair creams, spray bottles, and other devices that will facilitate the cutting of hair.  Joseph also plans to expand his shop to include the sale of videos and CDs, which will increase his earnings.  In order to secure a loan, Joseph joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to guarantee loans for each other and support the repayment of existing loans.  As a member of the group, Joseph is requesting a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools, like shavers, creams, chairs, and sprayers.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is 25 years old, unmarried, and has one child.  As a dealer of electrical goods, Samuel purchases electrical cables, extension plugs, lamps, speakers, transistors, and other devices at wholesale prices and resells them at retail prices to people in his area.  Samuel wishes to increase his savings in order to eventually purchase a refrigerator and telephone for his shop.  He has joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to guarantee each others' loans, in order to secure a loan.  Samuel has subsequently requested a loan of $875, which he will use to buy larger quantities of electrical goods at low prices for resale.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of electrical goods.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fedrick A. is 30 years old and is married with one child, who is currently studying in school.  As a food vendor, Fredrick sells fried rice with a special maggi sauce, chopped vegetables, and shredded meat.  Although most of his business is done in the evening, Fredrick enjoys great success because fried rice is something every tribe in Ghana enjoys.  In order to increase the amount of fried rice he can cook and sell each day, Fredrick wants to purchase greater quantities of rice, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat.  He has subsequently joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to guarantee loans for one another, and is requesting a loan of $875 to purchase more ingredients for fried rice.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetable oil, vegetables, and meat for making fried rice.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience M. is 31 years old, single, and has no children.  For several years, she has managed a business selling fresh eggs, which she purchases in the southeastern regions of Ghana and resells at retail prices in villages in her area.  Recently spikes in commodity and fuel prices have hurt her business by limiting the quantities of eggs that she can purchase at a time.  In order to purchase greater quantities of eggs at wholesale prices, which she hopes to sell at a profit in her area, Patience has requested a loan of $875 and has joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to support each other by guaranteeing their colleagues' loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fresh eggs at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 38 years old, divorced, and has three children, all of whom are in school.  As a dealer of hardware tools and goods, such as paint, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, and pipes, Rose purchases supplies in bulk at wholesale prices in Accra and resells them at retail price in her area.  She hopes to increase her profits and income so that she can expand her shop to also include the sale of cement.  Therefore, Rose has joined the Swoni Se Trust Group, which allows its members to support each other, and has requested a loan of $875, which she will use to purchase greater quantities of hardware goods at low prices for resale.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of hardware goods at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel Q. is a 38-year-old married man with three children. Azel is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business eight years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales, and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business. 

Therefore, Azel is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves.; He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Qudrat

texts.en:
Qudrat S. is 41 years old. He is married and has three children. Qudrat is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income. 

Qudrat works as tractor driver, but his profession brings him money only once a year, in the autumn when it is harvest season. At all other times, he is unemployed, and this cycle motivated him to start his cattle breeding business in 2001. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance for investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. 

Qudrat applied for a loan of $1200 USD to buy four calves. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace T. is married with eight children, two of whom are working while the others are either studying or recent graduates of high school.  For over 20 years, Peace has worked as a trader of clothes and clothing materials to support her family, but has been unable to develop her business due to a lack of funds.  In order to increase her inventory of clothes and attract more customers, Peace recently joined the Good Mind Trust Group, which allows it members to support one another as they repay loans, and has subsequently requested a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Famil

texts.en:
Famil H. is 54 years old and has three daughters. In spite of his age, he continues to work hard to support his family. In 1995, Famil started his own livestock breeding and sales business, since working as an accountant did not allow him to earn enough to cover his family needs. The cattle purchase and sales business, on the other hand, has helped Famil gain valuable professional experience and has improved his family's financial stability. 

At present, Famil would like to take out a loan of US$1,200 to be able to purchase more cattle for sale. In turn, he hopes to generate additional income for his family and improve the quality of life for his children who have always supported him in his work.

loans.use: Purchase of four calves

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa L. is 32 years old and married with one child.  She has owned and operated a grocery shop in her area for nine years, where she sells rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, and other necessities.  Theresa wanrts to expand her business and also hopes to increase her personal savings and thereby put her child through school.  Therefore, she has recently joined the Good Mind Trust Group, which allows its members to support each other as they apply for and repay loans.  Theresa has also requested a loan of $875, which will be used to buy a larger inventory of products for her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy a greater inventory of grocery products to resell.

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan A. is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 sons. Since 2002, he has been involved in the livestock business started by his father. Elkhan has been educated in agronomy, and this experience has helped him in business, allowing him to open a dispensary in his house and to successfully raise and sell cattle. Elkhan hopes to continue expanding his business to be able to offer a better future for his children, and to raise them as professional, ethical and hardworking adults. Therefore, he is now asking for a loan of US$1,200 that will be used for buying four additional calves. In turn, Elkhan hopes to generate substantial profit by raising and selling them later on.

loans.use: Purchase of four calves

loans.name: Pambiq

texts.en: Pambiq M. is 47 years old. She is married and has three children. With persistence, dedication, and help from her husband, she has been able to make a living by cultivating land. Pampiq specializes in the cultivation of vegetables, such as pomegranates, potatoes, cabbage, and carrots, having learned the necessary skills from her parents. However, Pambiq would like to manage her land even more efficiently in order to make it more productive and to be able to grow different varieties of crops. In order to do so, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000 for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the additional income that Pambiq plans to generate, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A., a 58-year-old trader, is a wife and mother of four children, two of whom who are currently in school. 

She treks to buy foods, such as groundnuts, yams, onions, beans, and maize, and sells them in the local market. She also supplies larger portions to her customers who need to buy wholesale quantities. Cecilia says that, through this business, she has managed to support her first child, who has just completed senior high school. 

She is requesting a loan to buy increased stock of yams, groundnuts, onions, maize and beans to expand her business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school and to give them hope for the future. 

She belongs to the Good Mind Trust Group. In this community group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts, onions, maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Nurkhanim

texts.en: Nurkhanim F. is 54 years old. She is married and has two children. Nurkhanim’s husband is unemployed, and her business is the only source of income for the family. She has been running a store for more than 15 years, selling a variety of foodstuffs as well as accessories for girls and women's socks. Nurkhanim is very dynamic and takes good care of her family. As much as possible, she tries to cover the school expenses of her children, because she hopes for both of them to become well-educated. Currently, Nurkhanim wants to expand her business by purchasing new goods for sale. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of US$1,000. With the help of the loan, Nurkhanim hopes to generate additional income and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina N. is 60 years old, married, and the mother of six children, two of whom have completed high school.  She is a manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is a by-product of the production of palm oil and is commonly used in fried dishes with fish and pastries.  Although Faustina's palm kernel oil is in high demand by local food vendors, her productivity is low but she has been unable to mechanize her production due to her poverty.  To overcome this problem, and to increase her profits so that she can put her other children through school, Faustina has joined the Mawulehand Trust Group, which helps its members secure financing by having them guaranteeing one another's loans.  Faustina is subsequently requesting a loan of $525, which she will use to purchase a machine for electronically milling the palm kernels.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that effeciently produces palm kernel oil.

loans.name: Beytulla

texts.en: Beytulla Q. is 53 years old, married, and has three children of school age. Beytulla’s wife is unemployed - she takes care of the household and the children. Aside from his wife and kids, Beytulla is also supporting his parents and sister. He earns income running his own business - a store where he sells perfume for women and men, deodorants, air fresheners, shaving cream, shampoo, washing powder, and other items. Beytulla is an accountant by profession, and this education has helped him run his business properly. At present, Beytulla needs a loan of US$1,200 that he will use to expand his business.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en: Gertrude D. is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still studying while the other has completed high school.  Gertrude supports her husband's efforts to put their children through school by selling used clothes.  Used clothes are popular in Ghana because new clothes are too expensive for most people; therefore, Gertrude enjoys many profitable sales among people in her community.  In order to increase her inventory by purchasing several more bales of used clothes and also in order to attract more customers, Gertrude has requested a loan of $525, and has joined the Mawulehand Trust Group, which allows its members to guarantee one another's loans.

loans.use: To purchase a greater inventory of clothes.

loans.name: Sadareddin

texts.en: Sadareddin H. is 32 years old, married, and has two small children. Sadareddin is the only breadwinner in the family, and he is very hard-working. He earns income running a shop in the village of Saatli. For the last eight years, he has been selling sugar and soft drinks at attractive prices. Therefore, Sadareddin's store has been very popular in the neighborhood and has assured a steady income for his family. However, Sadareddin currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to expand the amount of inventory in the store. He is thankful for everyone's support and promises to repay the loan within 15 months.

loans.use: Store inventory expansion

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita T. is 35 years old, single, and the mother of three children, all of whom are currently studying.  For four years, Rita has primarily been a trader of charcoal, which is a lucrative business in Ghana because charcoal is the most popular source of energy for cooking.  While she is able to acquire most of her charcoal from villages in her area, Rita is hoping to expand her business in order to increase her savings and provide for the educational needs of her children.  Therefore, she has joined the Mawulehand Trust Group, which supports its members, and has requested a loan of $525, which will be used to purchase greater quantities of charcoal at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of charcoal at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin A. is 40 years old, married, and has two sons. Shahin earns income selling foodstuffs, such as cookies, candy, tea, and soft drinks, in a store which he opened only recently and which has become the main income source for the family. Until he opened his own store, Shahin was selling goods from a stand in the market. Altogether, he has been in this business for six years, and, because of his polite attitude, he has managed to establish a large group of loyal customers. Shahin would like to further expand his business and to increase the variety of products that he offers. Therefore, he needs a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months to be able to purchase a variety of additional foodstuffs for sale. This purchase will enable him to increase his sales, earn more, and thus better meet the needs of his family. Shahin thanks everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel T. is 32 years old and is married with three children, all of whom are currently studying.  Having managed a pharmacy for seven years, Samuel is experienced at giving customers medical advice and selling them the necessary drugs.  While selling medicine is a lucrative business in Ghana, it is also very expensive because drugs must be purchased from importers.  In order to purchase drugs in larger quantities at wholesale prices, Samuel has joined the Onyemi Yim Trust Group, which supports its members when they apply for loans, and has also requested a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of medicines for resale.

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en: Alaga H. is 31 years old. He lives with his parents who are now retired, and his business in the only source of income for the family. Alaga sells foodstuffs, including cookies, candy, condensed milk, tea, and canned mayonnaise, in a store that he rents. Altogether, he has been in this business for five years. He is very polite, and his store is very popular in the local community. Currently, Alaga needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase a larger variety of additional foodstuffs for sale. He hopes to thereby increase his sales, to earn more, and to better meet the needs of his family. Alaga thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food items for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter T. N. is 35 years old and is married with one child, who is currently in school.  As a dealer of hardware goods like paint, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, and cement, Peter purchases supplies from importers in Accra at wholesale prices and resells them in his hometown at retail prices.  He hopes to expand his hardware shop to eventually sell flooring materials as well, and has therefore joined the Onyemi Yim Trust Group, which will help him secure financing by having the backing of other group members.  Peter has subsequently requested a loan of $875, which will be used to purchase greater quantities of paint, nails, roofing sheets, and other supplies, for resale.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of hardware materials for resale.

loans.name: Elmir

texts.en: Elmir A., 20 years old, is the only bread-winner in his family. Since 2005, Elmir has been running his own office supply and slipper sales business, based in a rented place next to his house. He competes effectively with the big stores in the vicinity by offering prices that are more attractive. As a result, Elmir's business so far has been very successful. At present, he needs a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months to be able to expand the business by purchasing additional office supplies for sale.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis T. K. is 33 years old and has managed a pharmacy shop for three years.  Although selling medicine and providing medical advice to many customers is a lucrative business in Ghana, it is also very expensive from a business perspective because all drugs must be purchased from importers.  By buying large quantities of medicine at wholesale prices, however, Francis hopes to increase profitability and provide his customers with better services by expanding his shop.  Therefore, he has joined the Oneymi YIm Trust Group, which allows members to secure financing by guaranteeing loans for one another, and is requesting a loan of $875.

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of drugs at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Agash

texts.en: Agash A. is 51 years old, married, and has four sons. His wife is a housekeeper, while Agash earns income as a market vendor. For the past 15 years, he has been selling men's shoes in the local market. By now, Agash has gained a lot of experience, and his business has been doing well. He has many loyal customers, since Agash makes an effort to satisfy the needs of people with different tastes and income levels. Agash works very hard to be able to give his children a good education. Currently, he would like to increase his working capital in order to purchase new winter shoes for sale. Therefore, Agash is requesting a loan of US$1,200 for a term of 15 months. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase of new winter shoes for sale

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
Yagub M. is 32 years old and lives in a small village in the Saatli region. He has a retail shop and supports his family with this business. Yagub sells spare parts for foreign cars, like Mercedes-Benz and Opel, and also sells food, such as pasta and some fruits. He has been involved in this business from 2000. 

Yagub has a great demand for his spare parts, so he wants to buy more spare parts to sell to clients. He also would like to purchase more goods to sell, such as cookies and candies. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more spare parts and goods and t enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and increase the income for his family. Yagub would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and goods

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel T. is 48 years old and married with three kids who are currently in school. Emmanuel is a taxi driver and he also provides repairs and service work for other taxi drivers. Emmanuel has being using the taxi cab for the past three years without any proper maintenance. He requests a loan to enable him to procure a brand new engine. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings. He belongs to the community group called "Le Onyemi Yim" (what is in your brother's mind) Trust Group. In this group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. His picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: Emmanuel would like to procure a brand new car engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Alimdar

texts.en: Alimdar M. is 46 years old, married, and has five children. He earns income selling foodstuffs like tea, soft drinks, bread, chocolate, and a variety of sweets. Alimdar's store is located in a rented place in the center of the village in the Saatli region. He has been running his small business for more than 20 years, while his wife has been taking care of the household and the children. Alimdar's sales business is the main source of income for the family, and it also requires considerable investment. Alimdar works very hard to give his children a good education - in order to cover the higher education expenses of his elder son, Alimdar needs a loan of US$1,200 to be able to increase his working capital and the range of goods sold in his store. Alimdar thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of additional goods for sale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is a 38-year-old mother of four children who are currently in school. She is very supportive of her husband by taking care of their school-aged children. 

Beatrice has been operating a seamstress shop for the past seven years. She trains seven young ladies in sewing to equip them with her skills and experience for their future careers. She sews all types of female clothing in various styles, such as kaba and slit, wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. 

She wants to use this loan to buy more sewing material and supplies, such as linen, thread, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children. 

Beatrice belongs to the Somui Se Trust Group. In this community group, members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material and supplies

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris M. is a 30-year-old married woman who has two children attending school. According to Doris, she works very hard because most of the responsibility for the children rests on her shoulders. 

Doris sells home products, such as cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by "'hawking," that is, by selling door-to-door. 

Doris is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for your support.

Doris belongs to the Good Mind Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more plastic materials and kitchen sets to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose K. is 55 years old, a wife and the mother of two kids. Currently both of her kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been selling dried fish for fifteen years to support her family. She treks to fishing communities to buy her fish from the farmers and fish mongers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the fishermen and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy dried fish in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Rose is a member of a community group called "Hyebenehi" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Rose picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: Rose would like to buy dried fish in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her business 19 years ago. She is a 51-year-old mother of one child who is currently in school. She sells groceries, such as rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. 

With the loan, Elizabeth wants to buy more food to increase her stock of goods. She also hopes to increase her savings to provide her child with a quality education. She would appreciate your assistance very much. 

Elizabeth is a member of the Hyebenehi Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys K. is a 40-year-old business woman and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She trades in funeral clothes, lace materials and textile cloths. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to expand the sale of her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. She wants to use the loan to purchase funeral clothes, lace materials, and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality educations. Gladys belongs to the community group called 'Mangor' (God is sweet) Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay – if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount. Her picture was taken when she was at her meeting.

loans.use: Gladys would like to buy more supplies of cloth, textiles etc. for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a business woman in Odumase-Krobo. She trades in Dumas clothes, lace and clothing materials. She is married and blessed with one child, who is in school. Grace is provides a lot of support for her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past nine years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make it more viable. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory and also increase the stock of clothing materials with the loan. This will enable her to save more, and provide her child with a good quality education. She belongs to the group called Be Serious Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan. This photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: Grace would like to purchase Dumas clothes, lace and clothing materials in bulk.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily N. is a widow with three children. Currently, two of them are in school and the other has completed high school. She lost her husband through a prolonged illness. According to Emily, she works very hard because the total responsibility of the kids rests on her shoulders as a single parent. She is now 62 years old. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates, and bottle of drinks. She makes her sales by 'hawking', which is door-to-door sales. Emily is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to support her kids in school. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets and assorted drinks to serve her customers. She would be very grateful for the support. She belongs to the group called Be Serious Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan. She is in a photograph during her group meeting.

loans.use: Emily would like to increase her stock of plastic materials, kitchen sets, drinks etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 41 years old, and is a wife and the mother of two children. She sells charcoal, gari, groundnut, etc. in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in most traditional Ghanaian homes. Victoria buys her supply of charcoal, bags of gari and groundnuts etc. from the villages and sells them to her customers. She has supported one of her children to the university level with income from her business. With the loan, she wants to buy more supplies of charcoal, gari and groundnuts to serve her customers. She hopes the loan will enable her to save more to support the other one to finish senior high school. She would be very grateful for that support. She belongs to the group called Be Serious Trust Group. The group provides assistance and support to one another to repay the loan. She is in a photograph during her group meeting.

loans.use: Victoria would like to buy more supplies of charcoal, gari, groundnut etc. to resell so she can provide schooling for her children.

loans.name: Sunnary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunnary K. is 46-years-old and sells used clothing door-to-door in her village by using a cart. She earns approximately US$2.80 per day. Sunnary has five children, two of whom are married. Her eldest daughter sells souvenirs and a son works as a blacksmith. She is married to Mr. Rom Kong, 49, who repairs motorcycles as his occupation.

Sunnary is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase more used clothing for resale. She is a small group leader with two members who will jointly use this loan. Mrs. Sinoun C., 44, is a tailor and is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase a sewing machine for expanding her business. Mrs. Leap S., 46, sells roasted beef. She is requesting a loan of US$250 to add more capital for her roast beef business. All three members live in the Ratanak Commune of the Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Pich Mach Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this four-member group is Mrs. Pich M.. All the members in this group live in Trapeang Anchan Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Pich M. is a grocer in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to her customers. Mrs. Pich M. is a 49-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one is attending the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly-payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ret L., 29, is a vegetable seller. She grows vegetables and sells them to the market, earning approximately US$2.16 per day. She is married with four children, all of whom are students. Ret faces difficulty with insects that ravage her vegetable crop. With this problem, Ret asks for a loan of US$250 to buy insecticide to protect her vegetable crop and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing. The loan will allow her to increase her family's income. Ret is the leader of the small group of three members, joined below:

1. Mrs. Leab M., 51, widowed, grows and sells vegetable. Leab requests a loan of US$200 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

2. Mr. Sary V., 28, makes and sells charcoal from his house. Sary requests a loan of US$200 to pay for farmland plowing of growing rice.

3. Mrs. Sophal Say, 38, widowed, is a vegetable grower. Sophal requests a loan of US$250 to purchase insecticide to use for her vegetable crop.

The group members live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy insecticide to protect vegetable crops and to buy more seeds to use for cyclic growing

loans.name: Mrs. Doeur Sina's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fourteen members who live in Trapeang AnC. Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

Mrs. Doeur S. is the village bank president. She owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory in order to meet her customers' demands. 

Her husband, Mr. Tuy Phearun, is a motorbike taxi-driver who makes a small income to support his family. Mrs. Doeur S. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The youngest one, age four, is too young to work or study. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly-payment loans. Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Yin's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people in Trapeang Anchan Village in Kampong Chhnang Province have formed a village bank loan group. Each member plans to use the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. S. Y., the village bank president, owns a small store where she sells rice soup to villagers and passers-by. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice and other ingredients used to cook delicious rice soup for her customers. 

Her husband, Mr. Phin Veoun, has a plot of land where he cultivates rice for a living. Mrs. S. Y. is 43 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others are attending the local school. 

One of the members of this village loan group has an end-of-term loan. The rest have monthly payment loans. The member with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. 

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The terms allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice and other ingredients for her delicious rice soup

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chann L., 26, is a single man and sells wooden cutting boards. The boards are used widely to chop meat during meal preparation. Chann lives with his 51-year-old mother who has been a farmer since 1990, earning approximately US$1.00 per day.

Chann has a gasoline-powered machine that he uses to make the cutting boards. Because of growing customer demand, he needs to increase his inventory of boards. A loan of US$50 will allow him to purchase more gasoline to use in his machine to increase his productivity. Chann hopes that the loan will increase his income to sustain his family's daily living expenses.

Mr. Chann is the group leader that includes two members who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. Dy P., 46, is a farmer. Dy is requesting a loan of US$50 to buy an oxen cart for transportation to the market. Mr. Nhon N., 23, sells chopped wood. He has an old oxen cart and now needs a loan of US$50 to purchase a new cart to transport wood to the market. Included in the photo is Mrs. Dy P.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline to increase productivity of a machine used for making cutting boards

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of new ingredients to add new dishes to her cafe menu.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase slippers, shoes and sneakers for a small business.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji is a wife of A. L. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 10 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son has a garments business. Her daughter reads in the 7th standard grade. Zubaida baji's husband works in agriculture. Zubaida baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her son's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Zahida baji wants a loan to buy flour to make breads (Nan). Maryam baji wants a loan to buy garments to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy materials such ascooking oil, flour, and lentils for her food business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies for her sanitary business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more garments to resell

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad H. is 42 years old, married, and has three children. He earns income selling children's clothing, jeans, and shoes in a rented place in the central bazaar of Sabirabad. Elshad has been in this business since 1985, and it is the only source of income for his family. Every day, he starts work very early, and his politeness and good communication skills have helped him establish a permanent clientele. However, Elshad would like to further expand his business by purchasing additional merchandise for the winter season. Therefore, he needs a loan of US$1,200.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise for the winter season

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 17 years. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a driver by profession and has been for 4 years. He drives a 32-seater bus. Her younger son is a ticket checker. Her daughter is in the 11th standard grade. Yasmeen baji's husband drives a donkey cart. Yasmeen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to repair a vehicle of her elder son.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Rashida baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Asia baji wants a loan to buy chickens to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Sattar baji wants a loan to buy flower for her flower bouquet selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair a vehicle

loans.name: Shabnam's Group

texts.en:
Shabnam baji is a wife of A. H. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 6 years. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons are involved in an embroidery business and make embroidered dresses. Her other sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shabnam baji's husband makes artificial jewelry and sells the sets he makes in different markets. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Shabnam baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy jewelry material such as beads, wires and tools to support her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Iram baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Safina baji wants a loan to buy paints for her paint shop. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy polish, which is used specifically to clean steel utensils and jewelry. Asia baji wants a loan so she can purcahse her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) in installments.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for jewelry making

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif Q. is a 41 year old vendor who sells food products such as butter, candies, and a variety of conserves, as well as garden gloves, light bulbs, hair color and other provisions.  He is married and has four children, and also cares for his elderly parent who lives with the family.

When he became unemployed in 1998, Arif started his own business to cover his family's needs.  Since then he has earned a very good reputation with his clients.  He has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase additional food products to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more products and expand his grocery business

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: Mr. G. Shavkat is 36 years old and lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan.  He is married and has 3 children. He started working as the cook's assistant in the bazaar cafeteria and attended a special technical secondary school. Today he is a professional cook and has a small cafeteria, where he has worked for 6 years.  He makes national foods such as "plov", "sambusa", "kurutob", "manty" and many others. He has a good reputation and he is a very hard-working man. Mr. G. Shavkat applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2200 STJ (USD $650) for 4 months, to widen his trading area.

loans.use: To widen his trading area.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last three years. Rashida baji's husband is a plumber by profession. He has been a plumber for 10 years. Rashida baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy sanitary tools for her husband's business

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Ashran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shazia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy animal food to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy sanitary tools

loans.name: Egam

texts.en: J. Egam has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he is serious and reliable. Thanks to the previous loans, he improved his business and increased his sales.  He started out selling small household goods, and now he has a wood material trading outlet. He has 20 years of experience in this business and has the appropriate skills. Mr. J. Egam applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ (USD $1200) for 4 months to import big lots. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: business development loan

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji is a wife of L. M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 15 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Sakina baji's husband is a contractor and provides construction supplies to builders. Sakina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more construction supplies like sand and cement to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Nabeela baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kosar baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Asma baji wants a loan to buy welding tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar Z. is 54 years old, married and has three children.  He runs his wholesale drink business in a store that he has rented for more than 20 years in the center of Sabirabad City.

Eldar sells soft drinks and the majority of his clients are wedding organizers.  He has very flexible rates and this attracts many customers to his business.  He has applied for a loan of US$1200 to purchase natural juices which will expand his product line and enhance his business.

loans.use: to purchase natural juices and expand his business

loans.name: Allah Rakhi M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is a widow of M. R. and lives in Bund Road, a small town near Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 22 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son has a food business, the son next to him has a fruit business, and her youngest son runs a barber saloon. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She ha successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruit for her son's fruit selling business.

This is a group loan. Allah Rakhi baji is joined by a few more members. Bashrian baji wants a loan to buy paper rim to resell. Kosar baji, Safia baji, and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy more garments to resell. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruit to resell.

loans.name: Geck Taing Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Geck T., 42, sells food. She sells rice and and other food products to students at a secondary school in her village, earning approximately around US$3.00 a day. She has been selling since 2005. Her husband, Mr. Chanbo Chring, 43, is motorcycle-taxi-driver. They have two children, all of whom attend school. Geck lacks capital to cover her business operation. Hence, she decided to ask for a loan of US$250 to buy food ingredients to improve her business. The loan will help increase their income to support the daily expenses.

Geck is group leader with three members who will use the KIVA loan and are responsible to pay it back. Mrs. Sophorn C., 41, also sells food products and is requesting US$250 to purchase additional food products for resale. Mrs. Rin Heng, 43, sells food and rice at the secondary school in her village. Rin is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase food ingredients to stock her shelves for resale.
     
They all live in the Rattanak Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients for resale

loans.name: Gainazar

texts.en: Mr. K. Gainazar was born in 1962 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. K. Gainazar has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. He trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure so he works well with us. Mr. K. Gainazar trades tubing, reinforcement rods and angle bars in the local bazaar. He works hard to ensure a good future for his children. Mr. K. Gainazar applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 3800 STJ (USD $1125) for 5 months.  With this loan, he can open a trade outlet in the central bazaar, which will permit him to trade independently and to increase his sales.

loans.use: To increase his sales

loans.name: Nighat's Group

texts.en:
Nighat baji is the daughter of M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 27 years. She got divorced four years ago. She is the mother of two sons. Her elder son has a CD shop. Her younger son is in kindergarten. Nighat baji herself has an oil (lubricants) selling business. She collects oil from different factories and sells the oil to different workshops. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She has successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more oil to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy a molding machine. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy artificial jewelry to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy oil to resell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Razia baji's husband is a mason by profession. He has been a mason for 2 years. Razaia baji herself has a garments business. She has been involved in this business for the last 15 years. She is applying for a loan to buy more garments to expand her business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Azra baji wants a loan to buy material such as lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Saima baji wants a loan to buy fresh flowers to make flower bouquets to resell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy more shoes for her shoe selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more garments to resell

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina Mulajusufović is a 30-year-old woman who comes from Soko, a pretty village near Gračanica. She is the mother of two small children; one is only two months old.

Sabina sells clothes at home now, because she has a little baby, but she usually sells them at the market. She was not so active the last few months because of her pregnancy and she wants to be prepared for the winter season. She is requesting a loan through WWI in the amount of 1000 KM to buy winter clothes for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy  clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji is a wife of M. B. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this city for the last 32 years and is the mother of two sons, the older of which is in kindergarten. Rukhsana baji's husband makes a living selling cloth, and has been in this business for the last four years. Rukhsana baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She is applying for this loan to buy more clothes for her husband's cloth selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by several members. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy materials for her business selling bangles. Rabia baji wants a loan to buy supplies for her grocery shop. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (such as beads, colored thread and sketches) for her embroidery business. Suraiya baji, Shama baji and Asmat baji each want a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly K., 48, is a true entrepreneur who sells fish in the village market. Living in Kampong Cham, she is able to make around US$4 each day of profit. Her fish come from her husband who is a fisherman. Even though her husband is a fisherman, they need to purchase fish from other fisherman because her husband may not catch enough for resale at the market. The couple has one son who is employed as a car driver with a salary of US$150 each month.

Inflation has played a huge role in the society. The domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the government report. This factor was caused by inflation. Most of the employed people get the same pay, while prices keep increasing.

Ly K. is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase a wooden boat, a motor and other fishing nets for her husband to catch more fish for resale. These items will cost around US$600. The remaining funds will be used to open another business and help double the family income.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, motor and fishing nets.

loans.name: Some

texts.en:
Some P., 27, is married and lives about 124 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Living in Kampong Cham, she typically makes US$3 each day selling many kinds of vegetables from house to house in the village. Her husband, Sam Mao, 26, earns around US$3 from a recycling business.

Even though the couple has an income, it is still hard as the current inflation figure hit a record of 24 percent. Most of the employed workers still get the same pay as before except for a few workers, but now have higher costs. Some said inflation has the worst effect on farmers and poor people. The domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the government report.

Some P. is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to easily transport his recycling items. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.en: S. Mehrinisso has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005. She was able to improve her business thanks to the previous loans. She works with MicroInvest so she trusts its loan procedure. She started working from a small trade outlet, but now she has a better, larger trade outlet in the central bazaar, where she sells a good assortment of  meat and milk-sour products, cheese, sweets and confectionery. Mrs. S. Mehrinisso applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2800 STJ (USD $825)  for 4 months, to purchase a large refrigerator.  Mrs. S. Mehrinisso thanks KIVA for its support and wishes you all the best.

loans.use: To purchase a large refrigerator

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan P., 36, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham, about 130 miles from the capital of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Since 2003, she has been selling porridge to earn a living and is able to make about US$7 each day, while her husband trades pigs, earning approximately US$1.50 per day. This couple also grows rice but their plantation makes only enough money to support their family.

The weather conditions have been difficult over the past year and inflation has also had bad effects on the people. The domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the ADB report. Farmers grow rice twice a year, once in the dry season which take about 3-4 months until harvest and the other in the rainy season, taking spending 6-7 months until maturity.

Kan P. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase a cow to plow the land and use the rest of the money to improve her current business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow the fields

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem N. is a widow who lives with her two children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She sells groceries, making about US$5 of profit each day. Selling groceries has been hard since inflation keeps increasing. It brings the price of goods to unreasonable levels. The report from ADB to the government says that the domestic price of rice and fertilizer has doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent. It is a huge concern to every class of people, especially farmers and poor people.

Tem said that since her husband's death, she faces difficulties meeting daily expenses and she needs to take care her two school-aged children. Her education costs for her children are less than they will be in the future and she must work hard and save money for them to continue with their education.

Tem N. has requested a loan of US$500 to plant yams to help increase the family's income. (She is pictured with her son, wearing a black shirt.)

loans.use: To purchase starter bulbs and begin growing yams for resale

loans.name: Yorm

texts.en:
Yorm Y., 37, is a poor entrepreneur living in the Kampong Cham with her husband and one young child. She grows rice to earn a living and is able to make one dollar each day.

Farming is hard as the weather conditions have been difficult this past year. It is hard for farmers to depend on precipitation and they have to own a water pump in case their fields go without rain water. Normally, people grow rice two times a year. Certain kinds of rice seeds grow during the dry season and it takes 3-4 months until harvest time. The other kinds of rice seeds grow in the rainy season and take about 6-7 months until harvest. Rice farmers prefer rice that grows in the rainy season because it has a better flavor.

Her husband, Hoeun Chet, 37, sells palm leaves. Everyday he collects the palm leaves for sale. Many products are made from palm leaves such as roofs, baskets and other things. Yorm Y. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a horse for her husband to transport palm leaves.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Emina

texts.en:
Emina Omerović was born in 1951 and comes from a suburb of Živinice. She is a widow and lives alone. Emina has a sewing machine and she works hard at tailoring. She has her faithful customers, mostly her neighbors and relatives.

Emina makes traditional clothing and she needs materials for that. She has decided to request her first loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM to buy needed materials. She will increase her income by selling her creations and manage to pay her expenses by herself.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothing

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She grows many kinds of vegetables and sells them at the market. She is able to make US$2.50 each day. Her husband is a dealer and purchases coconuts from a farm and then distributes them to small sellers in the village market. On average, he makes US$12.50 in revenue each day. He been in this business since 1998. His business was doing better in the past and now he makes less profit because he pays more for transportation.

The couple said they currently have no financial problems because they spend less on their children's education, but once the children are older, they will have to pay more for their schooling.

Mrs. Im S. is requesting a loan of US$1000 to breed a cow to helps with family expenses and use the leftover funds to repair their house. (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To breed cow and make home repairs

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira Karić is a 34-year-old woman, the mother of one child. She is married and her husband is employed. His salary is low and they have to work at home, doing a lot of things to earn more. They are busy with poultry as a seasonal job. Beside that, Samira has a sewing machine and she does tailoring.

Unfortunately, Samira's sewing machine is broken and she has to fix it. She has no money to do that, so she has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 600 KM. She hopes to earn enough to help support her family.

loans.use: To repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Nihada

texts.en:
Nihada Kamberović was born in 1981. She is married and the mother of one child. She comes from a village called Ciljuge near Živinice. Her husband has full-time work but he also works with Nihada at home. They have sheep and chickens. They buy a young sheep and some poultry every few months to feed them and re-sell them. It is their little farm which provides them with a better life.

Nihada has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 800 KM to buy a sheep to fatten and re-sell.

loans.use: To buy a sheep to fatten and re-sell

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul S., 51, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Currently, she is employed as a marketing officer and makes US$1 each day, while her husband is a traditional musician, earning US$1.50 each day. The couple has three children, two of whom are not living at home.

Hul S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to breed a cow. Leftover funds will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice N. is a very hardworking lady with a business selling women's, men's, and children's clothing in her locality. She is so grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinance because she has been able to increase and build her capital as a result. Now school fees are no longer a burden because of the profits she makes selling a variety of high quality skirts, blouses, shirts, trousers and dresses.

She is seeking a loan to be able to buy more clothes to sell. She believes this will fetch her more income in preparation for restocking for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cathy's Group

texts.en:
Cathy N. is a 38 year old married lady with eight children, who are all still in school. She also takes care of two orphans that belong to her late brother.

Cathy has had a shop for four years in which she sells new clothes. She sells a variety of women's, men's, and children's clothing of different styles and makes. In addition to the clothes business, she has had a poultry business for the last five years. She keeps 150 broilers in her garage and she would like to increase the number once she constructs more housing for them.

Cathy and the other lending group members seek to improve their businesses in order to provide for their families and dependents, especially with school fees. Cathy has booked more broilers and the loan she is asking is partly for buying the feeds that she'll need for the two months of keeping them. She will repay the loan using part of her shop profits.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell and feed for her chickens.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng M. L. is a villager in Kor Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She owns a small farm where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She now faces a small problem, because her field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Seng M. L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and to produce a better crop. 

Her husband, Mr. Phuong Phan, also helps his wife in the business. Mrs. Seng M. L. is 61 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. Mrs. Seng M. L. hopes to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Maria

texts.fr:
Madame K. Maria est née le 09 mars 1971 à Agoudédé dans la préfecture d’Assoli au nord du Togo. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle est revendeuse de potasse et de poivre dans le grand marché de Lomé. Elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille avec le revenu de son activité. Son lieu d’approvisionnement est le niger. 
Actuellement, elle veut encore effectuer un voyage pour faire l’achat des marchandises et désire compléter son fonds de roulement par ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite.
A cet effet, avec ce crédit, elle achètera 10 sacs de potasse et 6 sacs de poivre.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria K. was born on March 9, 1971 in Agoudédé, in Assoli Prefecture, in the north of Togo. She is married, the mother of four, and a retailer of potash and pepper in the grand marketplace of Lomé. With the income from her work, she help her husband a lot with family expenses. Niger is where she gets her supplies. Currently, she still wants to take a trip there to purchase goods and would like to round out her operating fund through this first loan she is requesting. To this end, she will use this loan to buy 10 sacks of potash and 6 sacks of pepper.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potash and spices

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Mrs. Ke T. is a farmer in Kor Village in Kandal Province. She cultivates rice and vegetables. She now faces an obstacle, because her field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Ke T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and to make her crops more productive.  Her husband, Hay Nget, helps his wife in the plantation. Mrs. Ke T. is 25-year-old and does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
M. Ronald is a married man with two children; he cares for one orphaned child. All of the children attend the same primary school. He has been a motorcycle mechanic in Lugazi for 7 years.

M. has had several loans from Pearl Microfinance. He used the loans to buy the spare parts he needed to repair motorcycles. As a result, he now owns two motorbikes and has a boda-boda (motorbike taxi) business. He is now able to pay his children's school fees properly and on time. He is happy that through borrowing, he has learned to save. He has also picked up the spirit of working hard from fellow borrowers; after all, how can one pay back loans without putting in a lot of effort?

loans.use: To buy spare parts for repairing motorcycles.

loans.name: Loth

texts.en:
Mrs. Loth S. is 39 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are fishermen. The remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Loth S. is a villager in Kor Village in Kandal Province. Cambodia. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for the family. 

Her husband, Mr. Yan Thy, is a fisherman who can catch only a little fish, because he does not have enough equipment to catch fish. To solve this problem, Mrs. Loth S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat and machinery, especially fishing nets.

loans.use: To buy a boat and machinery, especially fishing nets.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina baji is a wife of J. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last six years and is the mother of four sons. Her elder son works in a factory. His younger brothers are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Samina baji's husband sells wheels for different types of vehicles. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Samina baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more wheels for her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several members. Samina baji wants a loan to buy animals for her meat-selling business. Bashiran baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy various items to sell

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam Y. is a poor entrepreneur living in Kampong Cham with five of her seven children and her husband. Since 1979, she has been growing rice but her output is just to enough to pay her family's living expenses. Her husband works in construction, making around US$2.5 each per day.

Her rice crops have been less than adequate due to various reasons. The weather conditions are difficult and farmers that cannot afford a water pump or have no ability to access water, will face crop damage.
