Inflation has skyrocketed the price of goods-- domestic prices of rice and fertilizers have doubled and the price of meat and fish have increased 30-60 percent. Inflation has hit a record of 23 percent.

Mrs. Eam Y. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase palm leaves for resale. She will buy the leaves from the palm climber and continue to sell at the market. (She is pictured with her children.)

loans.use: To purchase palm leaves for resale.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 39, is a rice farmer and makes less than one dollar each day. She plants a rice crop twice a year. In the dry season, it takes about 3-4 months for rice to grow enough for harvesting and in the rainy season, it takes 6-7 months until harvest time. The price of rice has doubled over the past year as have the fertilizers for the fields. When the weather is reliable, Sem can count on a good inventory. Her husband, Dong Ban, 41, works at collecting palm juice and refines it to sugar palm for sale. He is able to make US$3 each day. The couple has five children; two are construction workers; one is a student and the others are of pre-school age.

Sem S. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike for her children for commute to work and use the leftover money to buy firewood for her husband for refining palm juice.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and firewood.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn N., 32, sells vegetables and lives in Archarleak Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She sells her goods at the market and earns around US$3.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thin Pak, is a motorcycle driver, earning around US$2.50 per day. The couple has four children, all of whom live at home and are students. Thoeurn and her husband work hard every day to support their family.

Vegetable sales is the main income for the family and Thoeurn needs to increase her business by improving and offering more vegetables to sell. She would like a loan of US$500 to purchase a larger variety of vegetables to sell. The remainder of the loan will be used to pay for transporting her goods from land she bought to the village. Her future goal is to purchase a store in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell at the market and to pay for transporting the goods to the market

loans.name: Mastula Ndagire 's Group

texts.en:
Mastula is a 48-year-old widow with seven children ranging in age from 15 to 36 years old. Three of her children go to school and the rest are working. Her elder brother helps her pay school fees for the younger children. She rents a one-room house in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, where she lives with three people. The house has no electricity or piped water. The family gets three meals a day.

Mastula rents a stall in Kalerwe, one of the city suburbs, where she sells vegetables like avocadoes, tomatoes, and onions two days a week. She sells to an average of 30 people a day. Mastula's major expenses include rent for the home and the business premises, school fees, and medication She also incurs transportation costs getting to and from villages to collect her produce. She has been in this business for the last twenty years. One of Mastula's main challenges is the rainy season, when the village roads become impassable.

Mastula is the leader of a group of 5 members. She has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working all six years with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock in her business. Mastula is aspiring to build rental rooms on the plot of land she bought using her previous loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock in her business

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Uch S., 43, is married and lives with her husband and one of her three children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1998, she has been making small grinding mills from her home and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband is a worker and makes US$5 per day.

Uch S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more stone to increase the number of grinding mills she has available for resale. (She is pictured with her family.)

loans.use: To purchase more stone for making grinding mills.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K., 56, is married and lives with three of her five children in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$2 each day and are supported by two children working in the casino building. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chan K. included. She is asking for a loan of US$800 to make two investments. First, she will spend US$300 to purchase a water pump, and second, she will spend the rest of the money to purchase another plot of farmland to expand her plantation. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and land.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar A. is 35 years old, and a widow raising her three children alone. They are her inspiration to work hard every day and continue with her business. When her husband passed away, Dilbar was left without steady income. Supporting her children practically on her own was very difficult. After a long suffering she decided to open a grocery store near her house. Considering that Dilbar is the only owner of the grocery store in her community her business went well after it started. Dilbar is trying to generate income not only for her family's consumption but also to be able to create savings for the dowries of her daughters and future weddings of all of her children. Today Dilbar is planning to increase the range of her selling goods. With this purpose she requests 2800 Somoni ($825 USD) for the term of 12 months. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working. Your generosity can change her and her familyl's lives.

loans.use: Dilbar would like to purchase foodstuff like sweets, tea, sugar, juices, soft drinks, preserved food for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en: Sadriddin C. is 30 years old and he is married with two children. Sadriddin has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering. But he went to agrobusiness because his salary was low. And with the low salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Sadriddin works hard to cultivate his products such as grapes, potatoes, onions and carrots. He works from early morning 'til late night hoping to have a rich harvest. Sadriddin sells his produce in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Sadriddin is requesting a loan of $1000 USD for the term of 12 months to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer, in order to better meet the demands of his customers who wait for him every Saturday at the market. Let's help Sadriddin as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Sadriddin would like to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers to grow seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Nang C., 28, is a mother of two young children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and typically makes US$2 each day, while her husband, Nith Sean, 27, is a motor-taxi driver, earning around US$2.50 each day as well. He sometimes also acts as a construction worker building houses. Inflation has put the motor-taxi driver off the road; right now everyone make less because of the high price of gas. The government recently issued a report saying that the domestic prices of rice and fertilizer have doubled over the past year, while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent. Nang C. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to breed two cows to have a calf.

loans.use: To breed two cows to have a calf

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
Mahmud G. is 46 years old and is married with three children. Mahmud has always opted to make his life in his land, and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to rear cows and dedicate himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time, as he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background, and now he is in charge of handing down all that experience to his children.

Today, he wishes to increase the number of his cattle and he would like to buy cows with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni (US$1050) for the term of 12 months. Extend your solidarity to Mahmud so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Joshqun

texts.en:
Joshqun H. is 21 years old, unmarried, and the only son in his family.  He is responsible for the care of his elderly parents who are now receiving pensions.

Joshqun is an industrious person and has worked as an apprentice in the house construction business.  Now after two years, he is an experienced builder, and has constructed a number of different building types which have sold in the region.

His business provides for the needs of his family and he wishes to improve their quality of life. Joshqun is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase the necessary construction materials to repair houses, thus completing his current orders and pending jobs on time for his clients.

He and his family are very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for repairing houses

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en:
Mrs. Zebo F. first applied to MicroInvest in 2008. She is a reliable client and had no problems with the repayment of a previous loan. Mrs. Zebo F. is engaged in trade of children’s wear. She has the same problem as many traders today: she meets strong competition, so she has to attract customers. She has repeat customers as she is very polite and people reach for her. 

Mrs. Zebo F. is applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 2200 STJ for 3 months to import seasonal wear to have a good assortment. She thanks Kiva for its support and wishes “all the best”.

loans.use: To import seasonal children's wear

loans.name: Melahet

texts.en:
Melahet A. is 36 years old, married and has two adorable children. She has been breeding cattle since she was a young girl.  She likes animals and with her husband's help, she enjoys looking after them. She is a purposeful person, and each day they spend with their herd, they watch with satisfaction as the fruits of their investment grow.

In order to house the four new calves as additions to this small business, she plans to improve the facilities on her farm and become more efficient and lucrative.  She is applying for a loan of US$1200, which she is planning to repay within 15 months.  Let's support this friendly woman and her family who are a fine example of  family strength.  Your contribution is very important to Melahet and her family.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Abduzoir

texts.en:
S. Abduzoir is an entrepreneurial cattleman who is married and has four children. He yearns to make his small business into a big family business so that he can improve the quality of life for his wife and children. He currently has three cows and a calf. He grows his own feed for them in order to improve the quality of the milk they produce. His desire to grow his business has led him to improve his production techniques, so that he can distribute the milk to his clients in a timely manner.  

Abduzoir wants to buy additional cows to increase the amount of milk and gradually establish a store in his house where he will sell high-quality dairy products. To do this, Abduzoir is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD), which he is committed to repaying over a period of 12 months. With your help, Abduzoir will be able to buy additonal cows and improve the cattle’s feed. Let’s work together so that Abduzoir can make his dream a reality.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house that she has lived in for the last 20 years. She is the mother of seven children: six sons and one daughter. Her two younger sons and a daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her other children and her husband work in a furniture-making business. Naziran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy material (such as wood and wood polish) to expand her family's business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy meat for her meat-selling business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to resell. Shumaila baji wants a loan to buy furniture polisher for her furniture-polishing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for furniture making and other businesses

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en: Gulnoza U. lives in the Spitamen region. She is married and has two children. She is engaged in the livestock business; she purchases and sells the livestock. It is the general income besides growing wheat and rice. Her husband is in the Russian Federation so she has to earn money for herself. She has a good flock and now she wants to buy one more milk cow to start making and selling sour-milk products. Mrs. U. asks KIVA to ask for financial support through a business development loan of 3200 STJ for 4 months. She is a very experienced livestock holder and has the appropriate skills to increase her revenue and repay the loan quickly.

loans.use: Gulnoza would like to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira N. is 25 years old and is married with two children. She and her dear husband have been dedicated to the business of herding cattle for the past 12 years.  She carries out her daily work surrounded by beautiful and tame grazing cattle.

Samira and her husband are otherwise unemployed and this business is the only source of income for their family.  They both wish to provide the opportunity for a superior education for each of their children.  

Samira wishes to buy four calves for breeding and reproduction so she can have a business of her own. She is seeking a loan of US$1200, which will be repaid in a period of 15 months. Let us help this industrious mother make her dreams come true. She wants to see her beloved children educated as professionals who will have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase four calves

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz  N. is the responsible father of two children who has always watched over his family's financial security. He accomplishes this by means of caring for his animals on a daily basis. 

He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. When he got married, he only owned a few number of cattle, and now, thanks to his efforts and dedication, he owns two cows to fatten and sell at the local market. 

He holds great hopes for the present time of year because it is high season for wedding parties and meat is a very popular item for the celebrations. For this purpose, Mubariz has applied for a loan of US$1200 in order to purchase one cow and two calves. Your generosity can change this family's lives.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and two calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more inventory and expand his shop

loans.name: Asad

texts.en:
Asad A. is 68 years old, and a very hard working, enthusiastic man who is married and wishes to give the best support to his 3 sons. Because the small pension he received was not sufficient to cover the family's basic expenses, he decided to start his own business selling office supplies, beverages, snacks and candies. He made a wise decision when he rented a place near one of the local schools and now the majority of his clients are school children, teachers and sometimes parents. 
 
Asad tries to give his family as much money as possible in order to cover the expenses of schooling his grandchildren. His sons are married but it is still very hard to cover family needs and Asad`s business is an additional source of income.  

Today Asad wants to expand his business and to increase his working capital in order to purchase new goods to sell. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of US$1200. He hopes you will choose to play an important role in his business' growth and in the life of his family, and he thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida baji is a wife of M. A. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last 25 years, and is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Zahida baji's husband is a mechanic and runs a motor repair shop. He has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Zahida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy spare parts for her husband's workshop.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Riffat baji wants a loan to buy material (such as colored thread) for her embroidery business. Irshad baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making business. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy scrap (such as plastic bottles and paper) for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for motor workshop

loans.name: Genjeli

texts.en:
Genjeli A. is 27 years old. He and his wife, a housekeeper, are raising two children. They are young now, but he is already working hard to ensure the best possible future for their children. 

Genjeli makes his living selling food products such as pastries, cookies, candies, condensed milk, tea, canned meat, mayonnaise, tea, sugar, salt and other items in his rented store. He has been in this business since his childhood, as this store was opened by his father. 

He is very polite and his store is very popular with local residents whose patronage allows him to earn a good income for his family. Genjeli has applied for a loan of US$1200 to buy more items to sell. This will allow him to earn more and meet the needs of his family. 

Genjeli thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira K. lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and she is married. She has been an executive and reliable client of MicroInvest since the end of 2007. She recommended herself as a non-problem client who has not had a problem with the previous loan repayment and trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial services and trade. She has a business in selling food products (sweets, sugar and jams, etc). Mrs. K. works in a bazaar where she has a wide assortment of goods and many permanent clients. Being the straight supplier she has the opportunity to work with clients of different income levels and she is very experienced in the business. But working in bazaar she meets strong completion which is why she wants to widen her existing assortment. Now she is requesting a loan of 4000 STJ to support her business by growing her existing assortment.

loans.use: Zamira would like to widen her existing assortment of goods for her shop.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is a wife of M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has lived there for the last 15 years. She is the mother of two sons. Mumtaz baji's husband is a driver by profession and operates an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this line of work for the last 20 years. Mumtaz baji is a housewife and also makes clothing for her neighbors. She is applying for a loan to make payments on her husband's auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Meeran baji wants a loan to buy coconuts to resell. Sobia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy material (such as beads and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Seema baji wants a loan to buy goats for her meat business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay installments on an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Nayil

texts.en:
Nayil M. is 22 years old. He sells confections such as candies, cookies, pastries, and fruit jelly, as well as products such as soap, hair color, deodorant, underwear, and clothes. He has been in this business for 3 years. He lives with his aging parents who are on pensions now and responsible for his older brothers and sisters.

Nayil requests a loan of US$1200 for the term of 15 months. He is going to use the loan to purchase more items to expand his range of goods. He plans to use his income to purchase a private store, as well as to educate his children. Nayil thanks you for all of your support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase more items to expand his range of goods

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal M. is 33 years old and has a small restaurant where he serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade. When he first opened his cafe he served only lunch, and being right next to the local business center, this attracted many people. Once his place became popular, he was able to add breakfast and dinner menus. 

Jamal would like a loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils. He is asking for US$1200. With this money, Jamal will be able to expand his business, earn more profit and in turn, help his two children complete their school studies and continue on to university. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful.

loans.use: to purchase tables, chairs and utensils

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is a wife of Mr. S. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived in this town for the last 20 years and is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her younger son and a daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Bashiran baji's husband makes plastic shopping bags. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Bashiran baji's oldest three sons all help their father. Bashiran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy materials so that her husband can make more plastic bags and earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Musarat baji wants a loan to buy goats for her meat-selling business. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy another game for her video game shop. Mairaj baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans to make shopping bags

loans.name: Margaret Namatovu 's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, who is 49 years old, is married and has six children ranging in age from 18 to 30 years. Three of her children go to school and the rest are working. She owns a four-room house where she lives with five people. There is electricity and piped water at her home, and the family gets two meals a day.

Margaret lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a retail shop, selling to an average of 30 people a day. She works six days a week and has been in this business for over ten years. She takes public transportation to and from Kampala to shop. Margaret also works as a tailor on the veranda of her shop. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, school fees, and medication. Margaret's main challenges include the condition of the village roads during the rainy season and transporting her merchandise.

Margaret is the leader of a group of 5 members. She has been with MCDT for over six years, working the whole time with the same group mates. She is servicing her eighteenth loan. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock in her business. Margaret aspires to build another home so that she can move her family away from the slum area. .

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Gulam Mohammad

texts.en:
Gulam M. is a hard-working businessman and father who has run a furniture-making shop for the past 15 years. He now employs five workers. His business is doing well and he has the opportunity to sell his furniture in distant locations such as other cities, as well as China and Iran.

To make this possible, he is applying for an 18-month loan which he will use to expand his business and begin selling his products in new markets.

Gulam M. wants to thank Kiva and all his lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Alem

texts.en:
Alem S. is 33 year old and has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is a widower with one son. He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of food products such as sweets, soft drinks, juices, and other items. 

He began running his food store nine years ago in order to support his parents, and he is their only support. Today he needs to buy additional products to increase the range of goods he sells. 

With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of US$1200.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of goods he sells

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi baji is a widow of M.Rafiq and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house she has lived in for the last 22 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her oldest son has a food business. Her second son has a fruit-selling business. Her youngest son runs a barber saloon. Allah Rakhi baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid three loans to Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more seasonal fruits for her son's fruit selling business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other people. Bashrian baji wants a loan to buy paper to resell. Kosar baji, Safia baji and Shahnaz baji each want a loan to buy more garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for five small businesses

loans.name: Sulaymonkul

texts.en: Sulaymonkul H. is a loving and self-sacrificing father. He is 67 years old with four children, all of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very young, Sulaymonkul has raised and sold cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sales of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family. The desire that Sulaymonkul harbors in his heart is to aquire more animals so he can increase his income. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved grandchildren, who always support him unconditionally in his daily work. He requests a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for the term of 12 months. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father and grandfather.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en:
This is Vilayet Q., who is married with four children. He is 54 years old and lives in Imishli city. He has a retail shop and supports his family with this business. Vilayet sells spare parts for foreign and Russian cars and has been involved in this business for more than 15 years. 

Vilayet's merchandise is in great demand. He is requesting a loan of US$1200 to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and increase the income for his family. Vilayet would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop to meet his clients' needs

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira I. has worked in the Joint-Stock Company "Navbakhor" for a long time. She recommends herself as an executive and a strong-motivated worker. She works in the spheres of making both euro-styled and national-styled women's wear. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She shows loyalty and is a serious client. Working in making clothing requires special furniture that produces goods of a higher quality that are more engaging. Now Nazira requests a loan of 3100 STJ for 4 months to purchase the special furniture that is necessary. Nazira also trades women's wear in the local bazaar. This additional business will bring the family more income.

loans.use: Nazira would like to purchase special furniture to make women's wear.

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
Sefer I. is 37 years old, single, and has been in business for the past 6 years selling cell phone accessories such as chargers, earphones and cases. His business is located in the central market of Imishli city. Sefer runs his business very skillfully and has great prospects for growing it in the future. 

This year is crucial for Sefer because he plans to be married soon. To raise his income and support his new status as a husband, he is planning to expand his business and buy more accessories to sell. To make this possible, he is seeking a loan of US$1200 which he will pay back in 15 months He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for their support, which will help him tremendously and make his wedding possible.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Chanthol's  Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol S. (the first from the left with her group members) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group, there are six families including her own. The entire group members are living along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Chanthol S. and her husband, Mr. Ty Bauy, were married in 1984 and have eight children; three daughters and five sons. Three of her children are employed full-time. Chanthol and her husband have been growing vegetable for twenty five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

2-Mr. Son S. (he is not in the picture), 55, and his wife, Mrs. Lainim Um (shown in the picture in the middle), 53, were married in 1972 and have four children; two sons and two daughters. Son has been a motor taxi driver for five years and he alS. has another business is rent music instrument to villagers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase electric materials for his music instruments business.

3-Mrs. Thach M., 53, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. One of her children studies at the University in Phnom Penh. Thach has been in the business of selling meal for twenty years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase spoons and plates for her restaurant business.

4-Mrs. Sarum P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Sam-Oeun Dam, 38, were married in 1990 and have one son and two daughters. Sarum has been growing vegetables for five years. Her husband has been a garment factory worker for five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

5-Mr. Choeun K. (not in the picture), 38, and his wife, Mrs. Rany Um (shown in the picture from the right), 25, were married in 2001 and have one son and two daughters. Choeun has been growing vegetables for two years. His wife sells grocery items. He is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase seed and fertilizer for growing vegetables.

6-Mrs. Maly C., 38, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. One of her children studies at the University in Phnom Penh and other two children study in local school. Maly has been a tailor for fifteen years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $100 to add to her own money to pay school fees for her son study in University.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Mekheddin

texts.en:
Mekheddin B. is a 64 year old man who sells cigarettes, sunflowers and nuts in the central street of the small village of Imishli city. This business is the main financial income for his family since a very small pension forced Mekheddin to go out to sell products on the street.

He has six children and they try to help their father financially but Mekheddin never accepts financial support from them. He believes that while he is healthy and can make money himself, he will never ask for someone's help. He just needs more funds to expand his business and start selling beverages and cookies. For this purpose he has applied for a loan of US$1200. He appreciates your help very much. Let's do our best to help this old but very proud man!

loans.use: to buy beverages and cookies for resale

loans.name: Sreyrot

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyrot K., 24 years old, and her husband, Mr. Laihoun Hout, 26 years old, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2000 and have one son.

Mrs. Sreyrot has been a silk weaver for almost ten years - a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in the city of Phnom Penh. Mr. Laihoun is a motor taxi driver and a boat builder.

Sreyrot is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials for weaving and to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Ahammd

texts.en:
Ahammd is 21 years old, single and lives with his family. He does not have a formal education, but has learned a lot working with his father for the last six years in a car-repair shop. He loves this line of work, and wants to expand the family business as soon as possible.

He has applied for a loan to buy more replacement parts. By expanding his business, he hopes to improve his life and the life of his family.

He would like to thank all the lenders whose help makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To expand a car-repair shop

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir T. is 26 years old. Nazir began earning income selling seasonal vegetables when he was 17 years old by helping his dad. After a while, he began working at other jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of his family. Therefore, Nazir decided to independently re-engage in the seasonal vegetable sales business. Gradually, he is becoming known in the area, however, he still needs additional capital to purchase vegetables for sale, given the high demand during the current season. 

Nazir is asking for a loan of US$1200 to buy additional vegetables for sale and thus earn more profit. Nazir plans to use the additional income to help his children move forward in completing their studies. He is thankful to everyone for their support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mr. Kunthea N. (shown in the picture with his family), and his wife, Mrs. Srey Khun, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. The couple was married in 1986 and have six children - five sons and one daughter. The first son has a full-time job while the other three sons study in a local school and the two youngest stay at home. 

Mr. Khunthea has been producing concrete posts (for building fences) and concrete pipes (for using in sewage systems) for the past ten years. He buys cement and steel then sells these to villagers. Ms. Srey has been selling banana grills in front of the local school for thirteen years now.

Kunthea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cement and steel to build concrete posts and concrete pipes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cement and steel to build concrete posts and concrete pipes.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora I. lives in Khujand and she is divorced with two children. She works in the Joint-Stock Company "Navbakhor" and she is busy in the commercial industry of making national dresses. Gulnora has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005, and she recommends herself as an executive client. She has been in business for 2 years and has good ideas on business modernization. She is also engaged in selling socks and bags, trading in the weekend bazaar. Gulnora is now applying for a business development loan of 3100 STJ for 4 months. This will allow her to import new goods to resell that will increase her business turnover and then permit her in the future to open her own trade outlet of self-made national dresses. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Gulnora would like to purchase new imports to resell.

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Mrs. Yai K., 41 years old, is a widow with three children - two sons and one daughter. Her first daughter studies at the University in Phnom Penh and the other two children study in a local school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yai has been selling vegetables, meat, rice, and noodle for the past ten years. She bought them from a market in Phnom Penh to sell along the local roads in front of her house. Her business revenue has helped send her eldest daughter to study at the University. She hopes that she will be able to send her other two children to study at the University as well. Currently, her business is running very well because many customers come to her shop very day.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more vegetables, meat, tables, and chairs for expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling vegetables, rice, and Chinese noodles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Building Materials

loans.name: Iftihar

texts.en: Iftihar N. is 24 years old, single, and went into business for himself right after finishing secondary school because his family could not afford to send him to university. His main goal now is to help his parents financially. Since 2003, he has been selling cell phones. Business is very good, and Iftihar needs to increase his inventory of phones to meet the needs of his clients. To do this, he is applying for a loan of $1200 USD. Because he is a young businessman and this is his first loan, Iftihar is especially grateful to everyone who chooses to support him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Iftihar would like to increase his inventory of phones and accesories to sell.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun C., 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Song Sorn, 50 years old, live on an Island near the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. This couple was married in 1979 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of their children were married and live outside the family home. Two sons are security guards while the two daughters are silk weavers and the other daughter is a salesperson.

Mrs. Savoeun has been a silk weaver since she was fifteen years old. Silk weaving is a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Song is a chef and regularly cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in the village.

Savoeun is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida N. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005. She first applied when she heard from her sister about the MicroInvest loan procedure. She knew she could improve her business and open a trade outlet in the local bazaar to sell eggs. She has sufficient business turnover but she wants to work further with the MicroInvest. Now Mrs. N. is applying to KIVA for a loan of 3100 STJ for the educational program of her daughter. She dreams of a good future for her children and thanks KIVA for the support and hopes for good co-operation.

loans.use: Farida would like to increase her business in order to give her children good educations.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad A. is 26 years old. Murad has a food store and has been running his business for 8 years. He rents a retail store where he sells different kinds of food, primarily cookies and candies. His business is the family's main source of income. As a rule, Murad is trying to have a wide range of goods of good quality to meet the requirements of his customers and to satisfy the needs of customers with different levels of income. Today, Murad is requesting $1200 USD in order to increase the range of his inventory. Murad counts on you support!

loans.use: Murad would like to increase the range of his grocery store's inventory.

loans.name: Seng Sam-At's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-At S. (the first from the right with his wife and group members) was selected to be a group leader by the other members for a loan from Maxima. In the group, there are two families including his family. The entire group members are living on an island near the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Sam-At S. (age 51) and his wife, Mrs. Sok Chin, were married in 1980 and have three children - one son and two daughters. Both of their daughters are married and live outside the family home while the youngest son weaves silk at home. Sam-At has been a mason for a company for ten years and Mrs. Sok is a silk weaver. Sam-At is requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase silk materials for his wife's weaving business and to purchase pig feed.

2-Mrs. Savet (the second from the left with her husband), 27 years old, and her husband, Mr. SmoeU. Meng, 27 years old, were married in 2001 and have three daughters. Savet has been a silk weaver since she was thirteen years old, a skill she learned form her neighbor. Her husband has been a silk weaver since 2001 as well. Savet is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a binding machine, laminating machine, and stock

loans.name: Amaliya

texts.en:
Amaliya D. is 27 years old. She is married and the loving mother of three children. She started her own business 10 years ago because her husband's salary was not enough for their family expenses. Amaliya is a market entrepreneur from Imishli city. She runs a stall selling candies, sweets, eggs, sugar, salt, cookies, conserves, etc. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Amaliya is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again.

Amaliya is seeking to keep her business be more sustainable and has requested a loan of $1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. One of her plans for the future is to open a new vending facility. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Amaliya reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: Amaliya would like to increase the inventory of groceries for sale in her store.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub M. is 69 years old, he is married and has five children! Teyyub is a hard-working man who is now on pension. He started his business in 1983 as a source of main income in case of unemployment. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance investing in his business, which has been going well and which he would like to continue to grow. Teyyub is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy four calves. He will reinvest the capital to grow his business as he has been doing. With the profit from this loan, he wants to support his children with their education. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in continuing this business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Teyyub would like to purchase four calves to resell in order to provide for his children's education.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Madame A. Salamatou est née en 1958 à Gléi localité située à 173Km de la ville de Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son mari qui est un revendeur n’a pas un revenu stable. C’est ainsi qu’elle l’aide dans les dépenses de la famille surtout le paiement des frais de scolarité de leurs enfants. Elle vend des légumes et des produits de consommation courante à la devanture de sa maison.
Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 6 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs du haricot, un panier de légumes et 2 cartons de tomate et de lait afin de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamatou A. was born in 1958 in Gléi, a village located 173 km from Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children, all attending school. Her husband who is a retailer does not have a stable income. Thus she is helping him with the family's expenses and above all with the children's school fees. She sells vegetables and everyday goods in front of her house. Once she received a loan that she reimbursed fully. The second loan she is requesting would allow her to buy 6 bags of corn, 3 bags of beans, a basket of vegetables and 2 boxes of tomatoes and milk in order to resale them.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of everyday goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Komlavi K. est un mécanicien auto depuis 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 39 ans, Komlavi est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV aménager son garage et aussi acheter des outils de travail afin de mieux satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Komlavi K. has been an auto mechanic for 3 years in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Komlavi is 39 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. With this first loan with FECECAV, he wishes to outfit his garage and buy work tools to better meet customer demand. He reckons this opportunity will enable him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To outfit his garage and buy work tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat G. is 39 years old, and she is married with two children. She owns a specialized fabrics store at the central market in Dushanbe city. Salomat works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high, because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and a very important item of the dowry of any girl. She is one of the leading fabric vendors in the market where she works. She is very persistant and determined in all of her business endeavors, which has helped to sustain her venture for 5 years. Salomat is a skilled entrepreneur – when she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Salomat has obviously been a successful small business entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Today she is requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni ($1200 USD) for 12 months to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future. Salomat is counting on your help. Your support will really help her.

loans.use: Salomat would like to purchase new fabrics to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard W. is 58 years, married and has 5 grown up children. He stays in Ruai town, on the outskirts of Nairobi. Bernard also takes care of his father aged 90 years; who needs constant special care since he is bed ridden and has to have somebody by his side always. Bernard makes sure that the helper he has employed is always by his fathers' side so that he can feed and bathe him.

Bernard story is of sheer determination. In the year 1967, Bernard was employed in a hotel in Sagana a town in Central Kenya where he was paid Ksh 20 per month and he used to save Ksh 10 per month. His employer raised his salary to Ksh 100 per month. True to his determination he saved enough money and by the year 1988 and with an initial capital of Ksh 30,000.
Bernard with other businessmen from Central province relocated to Nairobi the capital city. Here they selling clothes which they usually got after sending one of them to neighboring Tanzania, this continued until 1989 when they decided to part ways, and everybody started operating individually.
During this year conflict of trade between the two countries made Bernard to opt to operate from Kenya by starting to sell second hand clothes from one of the biggest second hand markets in Kenya named Gikomba Market. This he did by acquiring a 
Stall, he started with 3 bales of clothes. Business is usually good since many people like the second hand clothes since they are cheap, some going for as less than a dollar per piece.

Bernard also combines his cloth selling business with the sale of fruits, and since these are seasonal he reaps profits from the sale of them.
 Bernard suffered a set- back in his business last year December when Kenya experienced the post election violence, all his stock of clothes were stolen and the rest was burnt by the youths. Bernard was so distressed and to be hospitalized for three weeks after which he got counseling, he ahs been selling pine- apples at his former stall and he still hopes he will open his stall again. During this period, Bernard was directed to come to the Action Now Offices so that they can see how to help him after he came to our offices. We foundries case worth sanding to Kiva lenders.

 Bernard is kindly requesting Ksh 40,000 from Kiva lenders. This will enable him; purchase 5 bales of second hand clothes. The repayment period for this loan is  14 months.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya G. is 41 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband works in Tajik aluminium factory. Thanks to the savings and support of her husband, she was able to start her own business 11 years ago. She now sells clothing for children. Due to her hard work, her customers have increased and she has had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon. 

Zulfiya has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2005. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. She is now requesting a loan of 4000 Somoni (1200 USD) which she will use to buy additional clothing to increase her range of children’s clothing. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 6 months. Zulfiya is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: To purchase children’s clothing in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en: Mukadam M. is 48 years old. She and her husband have raised four children. For 10 years already Mukadam has been working in the largest local market of the city. She sells green gram and peas. This legume is very popular in Tajikistan. They can be cooked in soups more made into cereal, both of which are very nourishing, healthy and tasty. So Mukadam's business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as her husband is retired on a pension. Mukadam has been working with IMON for a year, and has proved herself as an accurate client. Today she requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent purchasing green gram and peas to sell. Mukadam thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Mukadam would like to purchasing green gram and peas to resell in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchase of equipment and expansion of stock

loans.name: Afua

texts.fr: Afua A. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est revendeuse de pagne à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afua exerce cette activité de puis bientôt 5 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant des pagnes, des tissus et des bijoux pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afua A. is 38 years old, married and the mother of four school-aged children. She sells African batiks, which are known as pagnes, in the Togolese capital Lomé. Engaged in this trade for almost five years, Afua hopes to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing pagnes, fabric and jewelry for retail sale.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagnes, fabric, and jewelry

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is a wife of K. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived there for the last 25 years and is the mother of eight children, six sons and two daughters. Her daughters and her four youngest sons are enrolled in a local school. Her older sons help their father in his building and construction-supply business. He has been in this line of work for the last 35 years. Bushra baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy construction supplies (such as cement and sand) to help expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Asma baji wants a loan to buy baking supplies (bread, butter and eggs) to resell. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her shop. Martha baji wants a loan to buy crystal and handmade decorative pieces to resell. Mahnaz baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for her workshop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies for her business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for several small businesses

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un vaillant menuisier, depuis 3 ans, à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 45 ans, Komi est marié et père de 5 enfants. Ses œuvres sont de qualité et il est compté parmi les plus réputés de son secteur. Il souhaite par ce crédit redonner de la vivacité à son activité en achetant des planches pour la fabrication des meubles. Komi espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille par cette opportunité qui lui est offerte.
texts.en:
Komi A. has been a courageous carpenter for 3 years in Lomé, Togo's capital. Komi is 45 years old, married and the father of 5 children. His work is of quality and he is among the most well-known in his field. He wishes, with this loan, to revitalize his business by buying boards for the making of furniture.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des planches pour la fabrication des meubles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji is a wife of Y. M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has lived there for the last six years and is the mother of two daughters, both of whom are enrolled in a local school. Shagufta baji's husband is a laborer. She runs a business selling cloth and has been in this line of work for the last five years. She is applying for a loan to expand to her business by buying more clothes to sell.

She is joined in her loan group by a several other people. Elizabeth baji wants a loan to buy spices to sell in a market and various shops. Haseena baji and Elizabeth baji each want a loan to buy scrap (such as plastic bottles and iron) for their scrap business. Kosar baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy supplies for several small businesses

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi N. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle réside depuis son enfance à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Afi exerce le commerce des boissons depuis bientôt 5 ans et cette activité est sa principale source de revenus. Elle espère avec premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises.
texts.en:
Afi N. is 38 years old, married and the mother of two school-aged children. Since childhood she has lived in Lomé, the capital of Togo. For the past five years Afi has traded in beverages and this business is her principal source of revenue. With her first loan from FECECAV, she hopes to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages and other products for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase welding materials

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of L. M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 11 years. She is the mother of two daughters who are both in kindergarten. Shazia baji's husband has a scrap business. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Shazia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, iron and waste papers) for her husband's scrap business.

Shazia is joined in her group loan by a few more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy more scrap (plastic, iron) for her scrap business. Sabra baji and Shama baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell. Chanda baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy spices to refill in small bags and packets and to sell in markets and shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Shazia would like to buy scrap for her scrap business and the other women in the group would like to support their businesses.

loans.name: Mawuvii

texts.fr: Mawuvi V. est propriétaire et gérante d’un bar-restaurant  à Apéyémé une ville commerciale des plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 33 ans, Vitsetsia est très réputée pour être spécialisée en cuisine. Elle est mariée et mère de trois. Avec cette chance de Kiva et ce premier crédit de FECECAV, elle désire faire davantage de stock de tubercules, de mais pour les plats de fufu et de la pâte des plats très appréciés par la clientèle. Elle apprécie cette opportunité qui lui permettra de participer plus à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager
texts.en:
Mawuvi V. is the owner and manager of a bar-restaurant in Apéyémé, a commercial city on the Danye plateaus, located 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. V. is 33 years old and well-known for her cooking. She is married and the mother of three. With this Kiva opportunity and this first FECECAV loan, she would like to increase her inventory of tubers for making "fufu" and corn for making "pâte", dishes that are highly appreciated by her customers. She appreciates this chance, which will permit her to help shoulder the needs of the family by way of the profits she will make.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yam tubers, corn, and condiments for making meals

loans.name: Ibrahim S.

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim S. S.. Ibrahim was born in Kabala 46 years ago. He is married to a business woman. S. has eight children – five are in secondary schools, two are in primary schools, and the youngest is not yet of school age. Ibrahim has been a business man in Kabala for the past 20 years now. He sells roasted meat, Ataya (a Chinese green tea), and also owns a shop where his wife sells tea and drinks.

This is the very first time Ibrahim is seeking a loan from SMT. He was a very successful business man in Kabala before rebels looted his shop, where he sold bags of cement and rice. His family supplied him with the initial capital necessary to start with the new meat and soft drink business. The business is growing, but at a very slow pace. He thus came to SMT to seek a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to enable him to re-enter the business of selling cement and rice.

loans.use: Ibrahim would like to re-enter into his previous business of selling cement and rice.

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37840&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Vidalina Es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas. Vidalina es casada, tiene 53 años y 2 hijos, Vidalina es artesana, realiza tejidos, bordados D. mantas, colchas, tapetes, actividad que realiza en su casa, además cuenta con personas que bordan y paga por piezas acabadas, además tiene 3 tejedores que trabajan en su casa haciendo mantas. Además Vidalina venD. productos naturales que ofrece a amigos familiares.

Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lanas D. variados colores. Vidalina sueña con tener una bodega en su casa que recientemente termino D. construir y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=37840&_tpos=4&_tpg=1 Vidalina is a member of the “Virgen D. Cocharcas” communal bank. Vidalina is married, 53 years old and has two children. Vidalina is an artisan that makes tapestries and embroiders blankets, bedspreads, and tablecloths. She conducts her business in her house. She also counts on people that embroider and she pays for finished pieces. Additionally, three weavers work in her household making blankets. Vidalina also sells natural products to her friends. Vidalina needs a 1050 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool. Vidalina dreams of owning a small store in her house, which she just finished building. She also dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vidalina needs a loan for 1050 soles that will be invested in the purchase of various colors of wool

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Comunal Virgen D. Cocharcas. Julia es casada, tiene 66 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 hijo vive con ella, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el distrito D. San Juan Bautista, en donD. venD. abarrotes, bebidas, golosinas, su tienda esta compartido con cabinas D. Internet que es D. su hijo, su negocio esta abierto desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su nieta D. 10 años.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leche, azúcar y arroz. Julia sueña con surtir con más productos su negocio, ayudar en la educación D. su nieta.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Virgen D. Cocharcas” communal bank. Julia is married, 66 years old and has 8 children of which only one lives with her. Julia has a store in her house, which is located in the San Juan Bautista district. She sells groceries, drinks and candy; she shares her space with an internet booth that is run by her son. Her store is open from 5 in the morning until 9 at night. Her 10 year old granddaughter helps Julia with her business. With the 1050 soles loan, Julia will purchase milk, sugar and rice. Julia dreams of supplying more products in her store and contributing to her granddaughter’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia’s 1050 soles loan will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar and rice

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela. Lucia es casada, tiene 54 años y 7 hijos, Lucia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en una D. las puertas del mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes con la ayuda D. su hija, diariamente Lucia arma una carpa improvisada que la pueda proteger D. las lluvias. Además Lucia tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa en donD. venD. bebidas variadas, este negocio esta administrado por su hija.

Lucia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pescado congelado, arroz y aceite. Los sueños D. Lucia son vender condimentos por mayor, su hijo menor culmine sus estudios y descansar.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Marcela communal bank. Lucia is married, 54 years old, and has 7 children. Lucia sells food in one of the doors of the Magdalena market every afternoon with the help of her daughter. Every day she builds a tent that will protect her from the rains. Furthermore, Lucia has a small store in her house where she sells various drinks. This store is administered by her daughter. Lucia needs a 1500 soles loan to purchase frozen fish, rice and oil. Lucia dreams of selling her condiments wholesale, seeing her youngest son complete his studies, and resting.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lucia needs a 1500 soles loan that will be invested in the purchase of frozen fish, rice and oil

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is Mohamed M.. Mohamed was born in Kabala 27 years ago. He is married with 2 children, both of whom are still not of school age. Mohamed is a tailor and is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to help him buy working materials such as sewing machines, cottons, threads, and zippers. Previously, Mohamed received a loan of the same amount, Le 3,000,000.00, from Kiva through SMT.  He also used that loan to buy working materials. While the new loan amount remains the same, it will still enable him to make a better profit and consequently improve his living standard. Each time Mohamed makes profit, he reinvests part of the profit into the business and part of it into the house he is currently building.

loans.use: Mohamed would like to buy sewing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela. Agripina es madre soltera, tiene 59 años y 4 hijos, Agripina vende chicha que ella misma prepara a base de frutas como maracuya, maíz morado, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulatoria en una de las puertas del mercado Playa Grau, Agripina cuenta con maquinas enfriadoras que ubica en mesas, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Agripina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, maíz, maracuya y leña. Agripina sueña con que su hijo último estudie en la escuela de oficiales, tener otro negocio y ahorrar lo suficiente para el futuro.
texts.en:
Agripina is a member of the Marcela Communal Bank. She is a 59-year-old single mother with four children, and sells a fermented beverage known as chicha, which she prepares herself from passion fruit and purple corn. Using tabletop coolers, each day Agripina works as a traveling vendor at one of the gates to the Playa Grau marketplace. Agripina needs a loan of $350 (1050 soles) to invest in the purchase of sugar, corn, passion fruit and firewood. She dreams that her son would finally study at a business school, of having another business and of saving enough for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, corn, passion fruit and firewood

loans.name: Damba

texts.en:
This is Damba T.. Damba is 35, and she was born in Senyedugu about 3 miles from Kabala. She is currently living and doing her business in Kabala, where she is married to a business man who sells kola-nuts. The two have one child who is now a tailor. She also fosters two of her brother's children.

Damba is requesting a loan of Le 3,500,000.00 to help her expand her current business. Damba's business is seasonal and dependent on the price and availability of products from other regions. She sells items like beans, bitter-kula (a popular non-tobacco chew), rice, palm-oil, ground-nuts, and many more. Most of these items she buys from villages surrounding Kabala town, including Frawa, Gbrafe, and Gbabukoro. She then takes the goods to Freetown, where she sells them.

Damba's immediate goal is to be able to make more profit to raise funds to build herself a house - a house where she can sleep well, with peace of mind for herself and family.

loans.use: Damba would like to expand her food-sales business.

loans.name: Essinu

texts.fr: Essinu A. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est couturière dynamique qui excelle dans son métier installée à Apéyémé une ville à l’intérieur du Togo située sur les plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Quand ses concurrents se recourent aux nouvelles machines modernes de couture pour bien servir les clients, tout en faisant un bénéfice raisonnable, elle ne veut pas rester indifférente. Elle souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV contribuer à la prospérité de son affaire par de nouveaux équipements permettant de prendre rapidement en  compte les attentes de sa clientèle et gagner plus leur confiance. Après encore un peu de travail, elle espère que tout va changer  et qu’elle tirera rapidement profit de cet investissement.
texts.en:
Essinu A., age 38, is married and the mother of 2 children. She's an energetic seamstress who excels in her job. She lives in Apéyémé, a town located in the Plateaux Region of Togo, at 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital. She does not want to remain indifferent to the fact that her competitors have resorted to new, modern sewing machines to better serve customers, while still making a reasonable profit. She wishes to use this first loan with FECECAV to contribute to the prosperity of her business, by purchasing new equipments that would allow her to rapidly meet customer's demands and further gain their trust. After a bit of work, she hopes that everything will change and that she will rapidly profit from this investment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabrics

loans.name: Lidia Maruja

texts.es:
primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=25261&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Minka. Lidia es soltera y tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres, Lidia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus abuelos ubicado en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, bebidas variadas, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, para lo cual cuenta con personal que le ayuda a atender, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de una avenida y de la feria del distrito.

Lidia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, fideo, gaseosas y cervezas. Los sueños de Lidia son ampliar su negocio, surtir con otros productos y tener un bar en otro local.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=25261&_tpos=... Lidia is a member of the Minka communal bank. Lidia is single, 30 years old, and lives with her parents. Lidia has a store in her grandparents’ house, which is located in the Jesús Nazareno district. She sells groceries and various drinks. She works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. In order to do this, she counts on personnel to tend to the store. Her store is located close to a main street and the district market. Lidia needs a 2000 soles loan to purchase sugar, noodles, soft drinks and beers. Lidia dreams of expanding her store, providing other products and owning a bar in another local.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lidia needs a 2000 soles loan to purchase sugar, noodle, soft drinks and beers

loans.name: Tedy Magoha Peace Group

texts.en:
Tedy M., age 40, is married with four children (ages 16, 13, 9 and 6). She has a business selling chapatti and pork from her house. She started the chapatti business 4 years ago but only recently started selling pork. She works daily from 6am until 11am. Tedy is able to earn about $125 per month from the chapatti and $333 from the pork.

This will be Tedy's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she is excited to get started! She intends to use the loan to increase her pork selling business by buying more pigs.

Tedy will share this loan with her loan group, Peace. The group has 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Tedy is squatting in the front, second from the left in a white shirt.

loans.use: These women would each like to improve their own businesses.

loans.name: Elsa Charo

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Minka. Elsa es madre soltera, tiene 43 años y 1 hijo, Elsa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, su taller se ubica en una calle céntrica en un local alquilado, Elsa cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan a realizar las confecciones. Además Elsa alquila vestidos de novia, de fiesta, ternos, prendas que compra en la ciudad de Lima, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche.

Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vestidos de fiesta, ternos. Los sueños de Elsa es tener una tienda de venta de telas, ampliar su taller de confecciones y que su hijo sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Minka communal bank. Elsa is a single mother, 43 years old and has one son. Elsa tailors dress clothing. She rents her workshop, which is located on a central road. Elsa has two people that help with the tailoring. Additionally, Elsa rents out wedding dresses, party gowns, and three-piece suits, which she buys in Lima. She runs her business between 8 in the morning and 9 at night. Elsa needs a 1000 soles loan that will be used to purchase party gowns and three-piece suits. Elsa dreams of owning her own fabric store, expanding her workshop and raising her son to be a good person.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elsa needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase party gowns and three-piece suits

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Yolanda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Yolanda tiene un puesto ambulatorio en el mercadillo Señor de Arequipa en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día con la ayuda de su hija y por las tardes se encarga de la atención de sus hijos.

Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar. Yolanda sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, comprar un carro para pasear con su familia y viajar a otros países.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Ollantay communal bank. Yolanda is married, 45 years old and has 4 children. Yolanda is a street vendor in the “Señor de Arequipa” market, where she sells groceries and cereals. She works in her business every day from 6 in the morning until 12 in the afternoon, with the help of her daughter. In the afternoon, her sons are in charge of the business. Yolanda needs a 1050 soles loan to purchase rice, oil, and sugar. Yolanda dreams of giving her children a good education and purchasing a car for family trips and trips to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Yolanda needs a 1050 soles loan to purchase rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Rosa es madre soltera, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Rosa tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida cerca del estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, carnes, los días sábados y domingos vende comida en la puerta de su tienda, actividad que realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y cuenta con la ayuda de su sobrina.

Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas, pescado, papa. Los sueños de Rosa es mejorar su negocio, tener local propio y brindar todo lo necesario a su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Ollantay Community Bank. Rosa is a single mother, is 38 years old, and has one daughter. Rosa has a store in a rented location that is on an avenue near the stadium in the city of Ayacucho. She sells groceries, vegetables, and meats. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells food in the door of her store. She does this from 8:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night. Her niece helps her.
