Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sodas, fish, and potatoes. Rosa dreams of improving her business, of having her own premises, and of offering everything to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sodas, fish, and potatoes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Julia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Julia es artesana, realiza bellos tejidos a mano con palitos, bordados, como chompas, gorros, carteras, teniendo como materia prima la lana de alpaca natural y procesado, actividad que realiza en su casa con la ayuda de 18 mujeres, todas ellas conforman una asociación de mujeres Awaq, sus ventas los realizan a empresas y trabajan a pedidos.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1650 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lanas de diferentes colores. Los sueños de Julia son exportar sus productos directamente, tener una empresa más grande y todas las socias mejoren la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Ollantay Community Bank. Julia is married, is 50 years old, and has 5 children. Julia is a craftswoman, producing beautiful fabrics by hand with sticks and borders, such as sweaters, hats, wallets, using natural and processed wool from alpacas as a raw material. She does this is her home with the help of 18 women, all of whom belong to an association for women, Awaq. They sell their goods to businesses and work for orders.

Julia needs a loan of 1650 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of different colors of wool. Julia dreams of exporting her products directly, having a bigger business, and that all of the members will improve the quality of their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 1650 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of different colors of wool

loans.name: Godwin

texts.fr: Godwin A. est âgé de 38 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il gère un magasin de pièces détachées à  Danyi à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Même si les entreprises connaissent des difficultés aujourd’hui, Mr Godwin ne se plaint pas trop car l’année est bonne pour lui où il a réalisé déjà de grands chiffres d’affaires. Il souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité ce qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Godwin A. is 38 years old, married and the father of 2 children. He manages a spare parts store in Apéyémé, an inland town in Togo, located on the Danye plateau, 175 kilometers from Lomé - the capital-. Even if, nowadays, businesses experience hardships, MR. GASSOU does not complain too much because the year has been good for him. He has already made good sales figures. With this second FECECAV loan, he wishes to increase the size of his activity which will insure a good profit margin. This way, he will contribute to the improvement of his family's living conditions.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and resale spare parts  for cars and motorcycles

loans.name: Felicitas Espinoza

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Felicitas es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Felicitas tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en el que venD. carnes variados, es un negocio familiar, sus hijos viajan a la ciudad D. Andahuaylas una vez por semana D. donD. compran animales que luego transportan a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en carros alquilados, luego son beneficiados D. poco a poco en el camal D. la ciudad. Además Felicitas los días domingos viaja a las ferias a comprar animales.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ganado porcino, caprino, vacuno. Los sueños D. Felicitas son tener una empresa carnicera, D. crianza D. animales en la selva ayacuchana y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Ollantay Microfinance Institute. Felicitas is a married 53-year-old woman with three children. She has a stand at the Nery García market, where she sells different types of meats. It is a family-run business in which her children travel to the city of Andahuaylas once a week to purchase livestock, which they then transport to the city of Ayacucho on rented trucks. After that, they are taken to the city slaughterhouse. Felicitas also travels to different markets to purchase livestock every Sunday.

Felicitas needs a loan of 3,000.00 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of livestock—pigs, goats, and cows. Felicitas dreams of having her own meat company, raising cattle in the Ayacuchan jungle, and finishing contruction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock—pigs, goats, and cows

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.es:
Edilberta es socia del Banco Comunal Ollantay. Edilberta es viuda, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Edilberta tiene una tienda en su casa ubicado en la asociación ciudad de cumana que se encuentra cerca al estadio de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde vende abarrote, cereales, carnes, verduras, gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche con la ayuda de sus hijas.

Edilberta necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar. Los sueños de Edilberta son tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes y brindar la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edilberta is a member of the Ollantay communal bank. She is a 56-year-old widow with three children. Edilberta has a shop in her home, which is located in the city of Cumana, in the Ayacucho region (of Peru), near the town stadium. With her children’s assistance, she sells groceries, cereal grains, meat, vegetables, and carbonated drinks from 5:00 in the morning till 9:00 at night. She needs a loan of $975 (3000 soles), which she will invest in the purchase of rice, oil and sugar. Edilberta dreams of having a wholesale grocery store and of providing the best education possible for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Lila. Lourdes es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Lourdes tiene un locutorio en un local alquilado que se ubica al frente de un mercado de la zona, además vende celulares, recargas virtuales para celulares y brinda servicios de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza durante todo el día, su local esta ubicado cerca de un colegio y tiene proyectado implementar su negocio con útiles de escritorio.

Lourdes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de útiles de escritorio. Lourdes sueña con culminar sus estudios universitarios, tener una librería, casa propia, comodidades primordiales para su familia y sus hijas sean profesionales con buenos valores.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the Lila Community Bank. Lourdes is married, is 28 years old, and has 2 children. She has a call center in a rented location in front of a market in the area. In addition, she sells cell phones, recharges for cell phones, and offers photocopying services. She does this all day. Her premises are located near a high school and she has planned to supple her business with desk equipment.

Lourdes needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of desk equipment. Lourdes dreams of finishing her university education, having a bookshop, her own home, fundamental comforts for her family and that her daughters will become professions with good values.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lourdes needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of desk equipment

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en:
Hamis M., age 27, is single with one daughter who is 3 years old. He has a grocery store where he sells food and chips as well. He started this business in 2002. He opens his grocery at 7am until midnight daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $500.

In the past, Hamis has taken out 2 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy land and make some bricks to build a house. He hopes for a new loan to increase his business by buying more stock.

loans.use: Hamis would like to increase his stock for his store to support his daughter.

loans.name: Gladys Carola

texts.es:
Gladys Carola A. G. lives in Ayacucho, Perú. She works in her hardware store and sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and has had her hardware store for 1 ½ years. She is single and owns her own house.

She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.
texts.en:
Gladys Carola A. G. lives in Ayacucho, Perú. She works in her hardware store and sells cosmetics. She has been selling cosmetics for 2 years and has had her hardware store for 1 ½ years. She is single and owns her own house.

She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan of 1,650 soles to invest in her businesses to buy more products for her cosmetics business including make-up, make-up brushes and accessories, and for the hardware store, tools, scissors and locks.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi  A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il tient depuis 5 ans un une boutique d’alimentation générale à  Apéyémé une ville à l’intérieur du Togo située sur les plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Il souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité ce qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A., age 35, is married and the father of 3 children. For 5 years, he's been running a general grocery store in Apéyémé, an interior city in Togo, located on the Danye plateaux, at approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital. With this second loan with FECECAV, he wishes to bolster his business, which will ensure him a good retail margin. In doing so, he will help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandises for resale

loans.name: Jannett

texts.en:
Jannett P. F. lives in Ayacucho, Perú, and owns her own house. In addition, she owns her own workshop where she makes windows, doors, railings, and baskets and repairs cars. Jannett has been working at her workshop for one year, which is the same amount of time she's been a member at FINCA Perú. 

With the loan she has requested, she will invest in her workshop by purchasing more wood, plus equipment for repairing cars and tools.

loans.use: She will invest in her workshop by purchasing more wood, plus equipment for repairing cars and tools.

loans.name: Amarilis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Amarilis del Carmen A. Q. is 30 years old and has a 2-year-old son. She lives and works in Ayacucho, Perú. Her business includes a bar as well as fixing telephones for locals and visitors to use to make phone calls. 

She will invest her loan into her business and purchase items such as beer, groceries and other refreshments. In addition to working at her bar, she is also a high school biology and chemistry teacher, where she also sells clothes to her colleagues. With the money she earns from her businesses and her job teaching she hopes to be able to build a house on the land she owns and also buy a photocopy machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase items such as beer, groceries and other refreshments for her business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia O. R., a member of the community bank, Minka, lives in Ayacucho with her 3 daughters who are 10, 13, and 15 years old. With the help from her oldest daughter she runs a restaurant in Ayacucho which also has a photocopy machine, which is convenient for her customers. She does all the cooking and works every day of the week. She specializes in local dishes including puca picante, a dish that includes potatoes, pork and a special sauce. 

With her loan she will invest in her restaurant by purchasing refreshments, tables, trout and ingredients for puca picante. She has been saving to build a second floor onto her house and dreams of improving and building her business. Additionally, she would love to have her restaurant included on a guided tourist trail so foreigners can get a true taste of Ayacuchan dishes.

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant by purchasing refreshments, tables, trout and ingredients for puca picante.

loans.name: Elizabeth Rocio

texts.en:
Elizabeth Rocio B. J., 27, is part of community bank Kuskanchik at FINCA Perú. She has three children and lives in Ayacucho, Perú. Elizabeth sells men's and women's clothes. On weekly trips to Lima, 10 hours on a bus (one way), she delivers orders that she has received. Furthermore, when her husband needs help, she also works at his mechanic shop. 

She will invest her loan into her business by purchasing jeans, sweaters, and bus tickets to Lima. With her savings, she dreams of being the administrator of her own store.

loans.use: She will invest into her business by purchasing jeans, sweaters, and bus tickets to Lima.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
Emmanuel G. C. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Emmanuel G. C. quiere poner techo de concreto en su casa y piso firme como pueden ver la construcción aun no esta terminada. El tiene dos hijos por los cuales piensa darles un hogar y su espacio. Emmanuel vive en la casa de su mama pero el cree que es necesario hacer su propio patrimonio para darle a sus hijos y una casa a su esposa. Solicita la cantidad $975 dólares.

El señor G. trabaja en fabrica y su esposa de secretaria en una oficina con estos ingresos el podría pagar el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en:
Emmanuel G. C. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.

This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Emmanuel G. C. wants to put a concrete roof on in his house and a solid floor. As you can see, the construction is still not finished. He has two children for whom he wants to give a home and space. Emmanuel lives in the house of his mother, but he believes that it is necessary to build his own inheritance to give to his children and a house for his wife. He requests the amount of 975 dollars.

Señor G. works in a factory and his wife is a secretary in an office. With these incomes they would be able to pay the loan offered.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a concrete roof and solid floor on his house.

loans.name: Hilda Luisa

texts.en:
Hilda Luisa Q. M., a member of the community bank Virgen de Cocharas at FINCA Perú, lives in Ayacucho with her husband and her two children, ages 17 and 21. At a kiosk in a local market in Ayacucho, Hilda sells women's intimate clothing. Hilda has been saving to be able to cover her bills in case of an emergency such as her children getting sick. Additionally, Hilda has been able to purchase a car with her savings.

The loan Hilda has requested will be invested into her business in the purchase of products, including bras, underwear and socks. With the income she receives from her business, Hilda dreams of ensuring that her children remain in school to become professionals. She also has a goal of owning her own store where she will eventually be able to sell her clothing.

loans.use: To be invested into her business in the purchase of products, including bras, underwear and socks.

loans.name: Meyling Raquel

texts.es: Doña Meyling tiene 31 años de edad, con dos hermosos hijos que estudian, habita en un bario que se llama Villa Liberta en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en una institución de aduana como técnico en bodega, su negocio es la venta de prenda de oro y prendas de plata, también vende cosméticos que son productos que se venden bastantes por su variedad de estilo, bonitas y accesibles a los cliente vende al contado y al crédito de la quincena, en este negocio tiene tres años de experiencias, inicio con prestamos en bancos comunales, pues ha sido de gran ayuda para su bienestar económico. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar prendas de oro y plata ya que viene la temporada buena en las ventas. A futuro es tener un local fijo en una avenida central donde pueda captar mas clientes y ofertar sus productos, también desean comprar su propia casa ya que donde están es donde la mama y su anhelo es tener una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Meyling is 31 years old, with two beautiful children that are studying. She lives in a neighborhood called Villa Liberta in the capital of Managua. Her husband works in a customs-house as a technician in a cellar. She sells ornaments of gold and silver. She also sells a lot of cosmetics because of the variety of beautiful and accessible styles. She sells these to her clients by cash or on credit, paid fortnightly. She has three years of experience in this business, which began with loans from community banks. It has been a great help for her economic well-being. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy ornaments of gold and silver, since a good season for her sales is coming. In the future, she wants to have a fixed location on a central street where she can capture more clients and offer her products. She also wants to buy her own house, because she lives with her mother now, and her desire is to have a dignified home for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ornaments of gold and silver

loans.name: Eleodora

texts.en:
Eleodora Chávez is a member of a community bank and lives in Ayacucho with her husband and seven children, ages 28 to 18. Elionora specializes in sewing and making dresses, blouses, and typical clothing of Huamanga; she has been taking orders for the past 15 years. 

She will invest her loan into the purchase of sewing machines and material for clothing including buttons, zippers, lace and thread. With the income she receives from her business she dreams of ensuring her children remain in school and become professionals. She would also like to be able to hire employees to help her fulfill orders.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and material for clothing including buttons, zippers, lace and thread.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma M. R. lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 3 children. She is part of the community bank, Lila, at FINCA Perú. Norma works as a civil engineer in her house, where she has a small office. In addition, she has a store in Ayacucho which offers the following services: Internet access, photocopies, telephone booths and printing projects. 

With her loan, Norma would like to purchase new computers and a photocopy machine for her store. With the income she earns from both her business and from her professional work, she hopes to discontinue renting a topography machine for her engineering work and instead purchase one for her home.

loans.use: To purchase new computers and a photocopy machine for her store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.fr: Charles T. est âgé de32 ans et est propriétaire d'une boutique d'alimentation générale à Apéyémé, une ville à l’intérieur du Togo située sur les plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Marié et père de deux enfants, Charles  est un homme  honnête qui veut gagner la confiance de ses clients, de ses fournisseurs et de ses créanciers. Aussi prend-il toujours son affaire au sérieux et désire par cette opportunité de Kiva et ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV faire des approvisionnements importants et tirer rapidement plus de profits de son affaire. Ce faisant il pourra assumer bien son rôle de père de famille
texts.en:
Charles T. is 32 years old and a business owner in Apéyémé, a town on the Danye plateau 175 kilometers from the capital Lomé, towards the interior of Togo. Married and the father of two children, Charles is an honest man who wants to gain the confidence of his customers, suppliers and creditors. He also takes his business very seriously. With this opportunity at Kiva and this loan, his second from FECECAV, he wishes to purchase supplies key to making more profit from his business. Doing so means he would be able to assume his proper role as a father to his family.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for retail sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther H. is a member of the community bank Marcela. Ester, 28, lives with her partner and their 2 children aged 8 and 11. In the small town of Ayacucho, where Esther lives, she provides a very important service by renting small moto-taxis. The moto-taxis are a great way to get around the city. She also sells groceries from the rainforest. Esther travels every week to the rainforest to gather groceries. She spends 4 days a week in the rainforest and 3 days in Ayacucho and Lima selling her goods. 

She will invest her loan in the purchase of corn, sugar, vegetable stew and on bus tickets for travel. For her future, she dreams of having a bigger moto-taxi renting business; she is interested in also purchasing a truck to help with hauling her goods from the rainforest.

loans.use: To purchase corn, sugar, vegetable stew and on bus tickets for travel.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luís C. C. se ve a la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para útiles escolares. El señor C.  en este momento  no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para completar comprar material  de la escuela para sus hijos. Donde José Luís trabaja es una fábrica y su esposa también para ayudarle con los gastos familiares con estos ingresos que ellos perciben pagarían el préstamo otorgado.El necesita $125 dólares.
texts.en:
José Luís C. C. is asking for a loan for school supplies. At this time, Mr. C. doesn’t have enough money to finish buying materials for school for his children. José Luís and his wife work in a factory to pay for the family expenses with this income that they will collect to repay the loan. He needs $125.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies

loans.name: Cruzkaya

texts.en:
Cruz Kaya P. F. is a member of the community bank Minca. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, ages 4 and 1. With her family she runs a hostel and has been working there for the last 10 years. 

With the loan she will invest in the family business by purchasing juices, refreshments, sodas, and artisan goods and by maintaining the showcase of local traditional goods. She dreams of one day opening her own bazaar and selling artisan goods, clothes, shoes, gifts and wallets. Going to school to specialize in a professional field is also one of her goals. Currently, she lives with her in-laws, and she would love to move into her own place.

loans.use: Purchase juices, refreshments, sodas, and artisan goods for the store

loans.name: Maria

texts.fr: Maria D., 68 ans, mariée avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bemet Wouly depuis 6 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente d’huile, de balais, et de savon au niveau de son village. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Maria D., age 68, is married and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Bemet Wouly for six years. She wants to boost her business selling oil, brooms, and soap around her village. Her income enables her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in oil, brooms, and soap

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa Mané, 55 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Bemet Wouly de depuis 6 ans. Elle veut acheter des balais au marché hebdomadaire de Yarang pour les revendre à Kaolack. De Kaolack, elle achète de l’Omo qu’elle revend au village. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux charges et d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille. <b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Awa Mané, 55 years old and married with four children, has been a member of the Bemet Wouly village bank for six years. She wants to buy brooms at the weekly market in Yarang to sell in Kaolack. In Kaolack, she would purchase Omo detergent to sell in the village. The income would permit her to assist with expenses and improve her family’s health and way of life. The loan she is requesting would be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and retail sale of brooms and Omo detergent

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est âgé de 70 ans, marié e père de 5 enfants. Il est acheteur de produits café et cacao à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kossi détient cette activité depuis sa jeunesse et il maîtrise tous les rouages du métier. Il souhaite par ce crédit acheter plus de produits pour la revente. Monsieur Kossi compte sur cette opportunité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kossi A., age 70, is married and the father of 5 children. He buys and resells coffee and cocoa products in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kossi has been in this business since his youth, and he masters all of its ins and outs. With this loan, he wishes to buy more products for resale. Mr. Kossi is counting on this opportunity to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee and cocoa for resale

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: E. Justine est une vaillante couturière à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont deux sont sur les bancs de l’école. Justine espère avec ce crédit acheter un séchoir et des mèches pour mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle par cette opportunité améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Justine E. is a valiant hairdresser in Danyim, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She's 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children, out of which two attend school. With this loan, Justine hopes to buy a dryer and hair extensions to better meet her customers' needs. She hopes that this opportunity will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an hairdryer and hair extensions to better meet customer demand

loans.name: Evelyne

texts.fr: Evelyne T. est revendeuse de pagnes depuis plus de 5 ans à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Evelyne désire par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV acheter des pagnes et des tissus pour mieux satisfaire aux demandes de sa clientèle sans cesse croissante.
texts.en:
Evelyne T. has been a retailer of "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) for over five years in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. Evelyne would like to use this second FECECAV loan to buy pagnes and fabrics to better satisfy the demands of her ever-growing customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes and fabrics

loans.name: Denis Jose

texts.es:
El señor Denis T., tiene 32 años de edad, es acompañado, le tienen dos hijos, con edades de 7 años y 4 años, uno cursa el primer grado de primaria y el otro hijo el tercer nivel de preescolar, su compañera de vida se desempeña como ama de casa, este señor se dedica al comercio de curtiembre o teneria, actividad que va relacionada a la venta y procesamiento de cuero para calzado, mochilas, fajas, para lo cual se le otorgo un credito.
Don Denis T., tiene mas de 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la cual se da como herencia familiar ya que su padre se dededica a este negocio, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio debidamente legalizado, el señor compra a la Teneria Bataan, el cuero y posteriormente  limpia y procesa hasta su comercializacion en el mercado, el credito fue dirigido para la compra de mas cuero, por consiguiente adquirir mayor inventario ya que asi lo demanda su clientela los cuales son dueños de zapaterias del departamente de leon, chinandega, masaya, granada entre otros departamentos donde comercializa.
texts.en:
Mr. Denis T. is 32 years old, has a live-in partner and 2 children, ages 7 and 4. One child is in 1st grade, while the other is in preschool. His life partner is a homemaker, and he is in the tannery industry, a business in which he sells and processes leather for shoes, satchels, and belts, which is why he was given a loan.

Mr. Denis T. has been working in this field, which is a part of his father’s heritage, for over 16 years. His business is located inside his home and he has all the proper licenses. He buys leather from Teneria Bataan (Bataan Tannery), then cleans it and goes through with the tanning process. After that, he sells the leather in the market. The loan will be used to purchase more leather so that he can expand his products according to customer demand. His clientele is comprised of shoe store owners in the departments of Leon, Chinandega, Masaya, and Granada, among other departments where his leather is sold.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Suyapa

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Suyapa E., me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio el cual tiene bastante demanda ya que estoy ubicada en una zona muy poblada, personas de escasos recursos son mis clientes y me prefieren ya que vendo a un precio accesible para todos mis clientes, en estos momentos necesito surtir mas mi negocio y necesito un credito para poder acondicionar mi pulperia con muchos productos ya que las exigencias de mis clientes son bastantes, gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos en estudio y alimentacion, tambien no los descuido ya que mi negocio queda en mi casa de habitacion, de esta forma paso al cuidado de mis hijos. deseo salir adelante para tener una mejor ganancia y poder mejorar mi calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Suyapa E.. I sell popular consumer products. I have had my business for 5 years. The business has a lot of demand because it is located in a very popular area. My clients are people with limited resources, and I prefer them because I sell at an accessible price for all of my clients. At this time, I need to supply my business more, and I need a loan to be able to stock my grocery store with many products, since my clients have many demands. Thanks to this business, I have taken my children forward in their education and nutrition. Also, I don’t neglect them because my business is located in my home. In this way, I take care of my children. I want to go forward to have a better income and to be able to improve the quality of my life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soups, wheat flour, corn, sugar, coffee, milk, soft drinks, juices, rice, salsas, churros, hams, oil, butter, pastas, white bread, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Santos G., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad con la que he podido criar y educar a mis hijas, las cuales tienen 18 y 16 años de edad, en estos momentos necesito un credito para comprar mas materia prima para la produccion de mis tortillas y asi tener una mayor venta y mayores ingresos y de esta forma cubrir los gastos de mi hogar.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Santos G. and I have dedicated myself to the production and sales of tortillas (made from corn). A number of years ago I began this activity which has allowed me to raise and education my daughters, who are now 18 and 15 years old. At this moment I need a loan in order to purchase larger quantities of prime materials for the production of tortillas and in this was increase my sales and profits and thus cover the costs of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn, firewood, lime, phosphorus, water

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Monte Cristo, de la capital de Managua,  tienen un hijo que esta estudiando  y es madre soltera pues ha tenido que trabajar para salir adelante con su hijo, pero ha tenido el apoyo de su familia pues ha logrado tener su propio negocio que es una librería con nueve años de experiencia en las ventas. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en la librería  quiere comprar productos de cosméticos y perfúmenes para diversificar los productos y captar mas clientes. A largo plazo poner otra librería y crecer en inventario como en ventas, también tener salud para poder ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatima M. is 41 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Monte Cristo in the capital city of Managua. She has one son who is currently in school. She is a single mother who has had to work in order to move forward with her son, but she has had her family’s support. She has managed to open up her own bookstore, and now has nine years of experience in sales. She will invest this loan in the bookstore, and also wants to purchase perfume and cosmetics in order to diversify her products and attract more customers. In the long run, she hopes to open up another bookstore and increase both her inventory and sales, as well as be healthy enough to help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Esther R. me dedico a la produccion y venta de baleadas, tengo 10 años de dedicarme a esta actividad, mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en una zona comercial, tengo muy buena clientela, en estos momentos necesito comprar mesas y sillas para poder atender mejor a mis clientes, ya que son muchos y a veces ellos tienen que comer parados, y lo que deseo es tener una mejor atencion para mis clientes que son muy especiales para mi, soy madre soltera y este negocio me ha ayudado a mantener mis 3 hijos, tambien necesito el credito para comprar ollas y comales para la produccion de mis baleadas, con esto voy a cambiar la apariencia de mi negocio y brindar una mejor atencion a mis clientes.
texts.en:
Hello, My name is Esther R. and I devote my time to making and selling baleadas, Honduran tortillas filled with mashed, fried beans and other ingredients. For 10 years I have been in this business, which is located in a commercial area. I have good customers, but at this time I need to buy tables and chairs to better serve the many customers who sometimes have to eat standing. I would like to better serve my customers who are very special to me. I am a single mother and this business has helped me to support my three children. I also need the loan in order to buy pots and comales, cast iron griddles, for making baleadas. This will change the appearance of my business and better serve my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cast iron griddles, pots, tables, chairs, a cooler, plastic baskets and tablecloths

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
La señora Nimia, es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “Las perlitas”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín, Distrito de Tarapoto. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la costura y a la venta de productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa, en el Jr. Libertad  Nº 498. Los clientes son sus vecinos y amigos que viven en la misma ciudad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de hilos para remallar, telas de diferentes colores y calidades, también pagará la última letra de su máquina remalladota. Nimia confecciona ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, también quiere invertir en perfumes, y desodorante, los cuales son los productos que más solicitan los clientes y que tienen mayor rotación.

Nimia tiene 51 años de edad y es natural de Tarapoto. Su meta es implementar su taller con una vitrina y más máquinas de coser.
texts.en:
Mrs Nimia is a member of the Credit Group In the Meantime "Las Perlitas" and lives in the Department and Province of San Martín, in the District of Tarapoto. For the last three years she has been dedicated to sewing and selling beauty products. Her conducts her business from her own home, located at Jr. Libertad Nº 498. Her customers are her neighbors and friends who live in the same city. With this loan of S/. 1,000 (approximately US $ 325) which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of string and yarn to sew and knit fabrics of different colors and qualities, and to pay off the last installment of her sewing machine. Nimia makes clothing for women, men and children as well as investing in perfumes and deodorants, products that are most sought after by customers and which sell the quickets. Nimia is 51 years old and is a native of Tarapoto. Her dream is to open a workshop with a window and more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase string, yarn and fabrics. Payment for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Yadira tiene 45 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital Hialeah II etapa casada y con dos hijos de 10 y 15 años de edad, que estudian la secundaria,   su esposo trabaja de maestro de obra, en construcciones de escuelas nuevas. Doña yadira vende comida desde hace doce años, con capital propio vendiendo sopa los días domingo, luego comenzó a vender comida lo cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para construir un cuarto en la parte trasera de su casa, ya que su casa es pequeña y se le hace muy incomodo compartir los cuartos, y desea una mejor vivienda digna para su familia. A largo plazo es incrementar las ventas, mejorar el local para brindar mejor servicios a si como hacer variedad de alimentos para ofertar a su clientela, seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs Yadira is 45 years old, lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Hialeah II and is married with two sons who are 10 and 15 years old who are studying in secondary school. Her husband works as a craftsmen, constructing new schools. Mrs Yadira has been selling food for the last 12 years, with money made from selling soup on sundays, which she transformed into selling food which has up until now gone well. The loan she is requesting will be for the infrastructure in order to purchase construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, iron to build a room in the back of her house. Her current house is very small and not very amenable to divide into rooms, she would like an improved life and dignity for her family. In the long term she wishes to increase her sales, improve the business locale in order to provide better services such as offering varieties of products for her clients, and continue to put her sons through school.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs and construction of a room

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Paykanas”, ubicado en Jr. La Paz Mz. A Lt. 18 AA.HH. Violeta Correa del distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 3 años trabajando con al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos. 

En la actualidad, Juana continua con el mismo negocio de venta de ropa a domicilio y también cuenta con la venta de arroz, sal y fideos al por mayor. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 4 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de sal, 4 paquetes de fideos y ropa usada, ya que ese negocio le brinda mayores ganancias.
   
Juanita agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo y promete pagar puntualmente el préstamo que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “Las Paykanas” communal bank, located at the address Jr. La Paz Mz A Lt. 18 AA.HH. Violeta Correa in the district of Yarinacocha, department of Ucayali. She is 35 years old, and is mother to 5 children who are still dependant on her. She is married and her husband earns a living in wood extraction. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 [US$100], she decided to invest in the sale of used clothing. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos communal bank for 3 years.

Currently Juana continues with the same business of selling clothing from house to house and also sells rice, salt and pasta.

With loan of S/.2,000 [US$650], which will be paid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 4 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 4 packages of pasta and used clothing, since that business brings her the best earnings.

Juanita is grateful to Manuela Ramos for their support and promises to punctually pay for the loan granted her.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, salt, rice in bulk.  Purchase of used clothing.

loans.name: Marisa Judith

texts.es: Marisa  Judith C. A. es una mujer que tiene un hijo por el cual la motiva tener deseo de superarse ella se dedica a poner uñas de acrílico de todas formas y colores. También es estilista pero aun no se dedica a esto por que le falta utensilios de trabajo, mobiliario y  local donde esta hubicado su negocio es pequeño. Con el préstamo que se le otorgué piensa comprar todo lo que necesita para su nuevo local, como pueden observar en la fotografía es el local que piensa rentar para su estética. La cantidad de dinero que necesita es la cantidad de $775 dólares. Sus ingreso los percibe por medio del negocio de poner uñas pero ya teniendo su nueva estética obtendría mas dinero y su esposo trabaja en el municipio
texts.en:
Maris Judith C. A. is a women who has one son which is her motivation to improve her life and what led her to dedicate herself to providing acrylic nails in all forms and colors. She is also a stylist but as she doesn't have the work tools, furnishing and other things for this, as the location where she hold her business is very small. So she is not as dedicated to it. With this loan she is hoping to purchase all the necessary tools for a new location, as you can see in the photograph, taken at the location which we is hoping to rent for her beauty salon. She is requesting $ 775 dollars. She is able to pay half of her spendings from selling/placing nails but when she has her new beauty salon set up seh will profit from much more money. Her husband works for the city, in the municaplity.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools and furnishings for her beauty salon

loans.name: Las Maria Group

texts.en:
"Las Maria" is one of the prime examples of the good affects of microcredit loans. Every member of this group of 15 is applying for their 7th loan! Each member took out their first loan from Esperanza International having virtually nothing. Now, going on their 7th loan, each member has had success with their very own business. 

Antonia A. is the chosen group representative and has proven to be a great leader and a blessing to the group. She is a very hardworking woman who is very diligent in everything she does. She is the mother of 5 children, and they were the reason she took out her first loan. She has always wanted to provide a good life for her family, and for the first time in her life she is starting to be able to provide for them. She looks for this next loan to increase her business and to continue to grow. She dreams of being able to travel and having her own thriving food market someday. On behalf of Antonia, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Small Food Store

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señor Gloria tiene 54 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay”, ella desea tener una tienda de ropas para bebés; después de llegar  a Huaraz del distrito de Pariacoto de la provincia de Huaraz no le ha sido sencillo, no solo porque es madre soltera de tres hijas y un hijo, también porque ha tenido que atender a su hija discapacitada y dar pensión en su casa alquilada que se encuentra en el distrito de independencia de la ciudad de Huaraz, a estudiantes, así como abastecerse para también cuidar bebés, Gloria menciona que lo más difícil de su negocio es cuando los clientes no pagan a tiempo es por esto que también se dedica a cuidar bebés que con ayuda de sus hijas intenta sobrellevar su vida familiar.
Con este préstamo de s/.500 soles, que pagará en cuatro cuotas, comprará víveres para su negocio, como azúcar, arroz y aceite.
texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old, and is a member of the communal bank “Hard-Working Women of Patay”. Her wish is to have a baby clothing store. After arriving in Huaraz from the Pariacoto district, things have not been easy. This is not only because she is a single mother of three daughters and one son, but also because she has had to care for her disabled daughter and offer room in her rented house in Huaraz to students as a means of supporting herself. She also provides child-care services. Gloria mentions that the most difficult part of her business is when customers fail to pay on time which is why she also takes care of babies and, with the help of her daughters, she intends to improve the family’s situation.

With this loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in four installments, she will buy supplies such as sugar, rice and oil for her business.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of items at wholesale.

loans.name: Elizabeth Karina

texts.es:
Eli, tiene 29 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay”, tiene como objetivo abrir un bazar y vender ropas para bebés ya que ahora se dedica a criar a su único hijo debido a su separación con su conviviente, desde hace cuatro años ella vende abarrotes en prolongación libertadores de Patay en el distrito de Independencia en la provincia de Huaraz donde también es la casa de sus padres, una de sus mayores dificultades fue que al enfermarse de “sobreparto”(enfermedad que en la zona, se especifica como un shock después del parto)  ella estuvo en cama y no podía mover sus brazos y sus piernas y que gracias a su madre ha podido salir adelante .

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella comprará un saco de arroz, de azúcar y todos los víveres que alcance para su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Eli is 29 years old and is a member of the “Mujeres Empeñosas de Patay” (Hard-working Women of Patay) microfinance institute. Her goal is to open a shop and sell baby clothing. She is currently taking care of her only son after her separation. For four years, she has been selling groceries in Prolongación Libertadores of Patay, in the Independencia district of the Huaraz province, where her parents’ house is also located. One of her greatest hardships was coming down with a post-partum illness, characterized in the area as a type of shock experienced after giving birth. She was bed-ridden, unable to move her arms and legs, but thanks to her mother, she was able to overcome it.

With this 500.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase one sack of rice, one sack of sugar, and any other provisions she can afford for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Abner Monrroy Mz. D Lt. 7, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 1 depende aun de ella, es soltera y trabajadora. Antonieta con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir con la venta de maíz, fréjol, tomate, etc.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio, vendiendo plátano, tomate, detergente, naranja y otros.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando abarrotes para ampliar mas su negocio.

Antonieta se siente realizada, contenta y es por eso que  sigue adelante y pagando puntual su préstamo.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonieta is a member of the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” microfinance institute, located on Jr. Abner Monrroy Mz. D Lt. 7, in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali department. She is a 51-year-old single, working mother of 4 children—3 who are adults, and 1 who is still her dependant. Antonieta decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in selling corn, beans, tomatoes, etc.

She currently has her own small business in which she sells tomatoes, detergent, and oranges, among other goods.

With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase provisions in order to further expand her business.

Antonieta has a sense of joy and fulfillment, which is why she keeps moving forward and paying her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods

loans.name: Aylin Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Aylin pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en el Jr.16 de Noviembre Nº.161 - AA.HH “Las Américas”, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad que aun depende de ella, es soltera. Aylin con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de ropas y joyas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. 

En la actualidad  cuenta con el negocio de producto de belleza venta de “UNIQUE y NATURA”, en las mañanas apoya a su pequeño hijo y en las tardes reparte sus pedidos a sus clientes.
 
Con el préstamo de S/.1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses invertirá comprando  productos cosméticos de UNIQUE y NATURA. 

Aylin està  contenta porque ha logrado grandes cosas con la ayuda que le brinda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Ms. Aylin is a member of the “Mujeres Galácticas 2” (Galactic Women 2) microfinance institute, located on Jr. 16 in Noviembre Nº.161 - AA.HH "Las Américas,” in the Callería district of the Ucayali department. She is a 32-year-old single mother of an underage son who is still her dependant. Aylin invested her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in clothing and jewelry sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for two years.

She currently has a “UNIQUE y NATURA" beauty product business. In the morning, she helps her young son, and in the evening, she distributes her customers’ orders.

With this 1,800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase UNIQUE y NATURA cosmetics.

Aylin is happy because she has managed to do great things with the support that the Manuela Ramos movement has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Delsi Eneyda

texts.es:
La señora Delsi pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Psj. 14 de julio Mz. A  Lt. 9, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 4 hijos, 2 ya mayores de edad y 2 dependen aun de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja como docente de educación primaria, Delsi con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de abarrotes. 

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega en casa, brindándole ganancias, para así  poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará: 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 5 cajas de gaseosas, 1 caja de leche y otros.  

Delsi manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para su familia y gracias a ello su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Ms. Delsi is a member of the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” microfinance institute, located on Psj. 14 de Julio Mz. A Lt. 9, in the district of Yarina Cocha of the Ucayali department. She is a 34-year-old married mother of 4 children—2 who are adults and 2 who are still her dependants. Her husband is an elementary school teacher. Delsi decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in selling groceries.

She currently runs her general store from her home, which earns her profits, and she is thus able to repay her loan on time.

With this loan of 1,000.00 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 5 cases of soft drinks, 1 crate of milk, among other goods.

Delsi states that Manuela Ramos really helps her family, and thanks to this, her financial stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted wholesale goods

loans.name: Dina Laura

texts.es:
La señora Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Copaiba Mz. 6 Lt. 1, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años y es madre de 1 hijo menor de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Poder Judicial, Dina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir con la venta de productos UNIQUE. 

En la actualidad ella continúa con el negocio de venta de UNIQUE, y trabaja como docente de la especialidad de matemática.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2.300, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando productos de bellezas. 

Dina se siente muy contenta por la oportunidad que le brinda Manuela Ramos y agradece a Dios por darle vida y salud.
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” Communal Bank, located at Jr. Copaiba Mz. 6 Lt. 1, Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali department. She is 24 years old, mother to 1 young child who is still dependent on her, she’s married, and her husband works in the judicial system. With her first loan Dina received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 she decided to invest in and sell UNIQUE products. Today she continues with her business selling UNIQUR, and works as a math teacher. With this loan for S/. 2.300, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in buying beauty products. Dina is very content for the opportunity provided by Manuela Ramos and thanks God for giving her life and health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Dolibe

texts.es:
La señora Dolibe pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en la Av. 21 D. Octubre Nº 530 P.J Micaela Bastidas, del Distrito D. Callería del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 56 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, 3 mayores D. edad y 1 depenD. aun D. ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja en la U.N.U, como “Ayudante D. Medicina Humana”. Dolibe con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/.300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. dulces. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el Banco. 

En la actualidad ella continua con el negocio “venta D. dulces”, usualmente se levanta temprano para realizar las actividades del hogar, para luego en las tardes preparar los deliciosos dulces caseros y salir a vender a sus clientes.

Con el  préstamo D. S/.2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará: 1 saco D. harina, 1 saco D. azúcar, 2 cajas D. aceite, 3 barras D. mantequilla, 1 caja D. huevo, manteca, etc.

Dolibe agradece al Banco D. Manuela Ramos porque gracias a ello su negocio ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Señora Dolibe belongs to the "Galactic Women 2" Communal Bank located on 21st of October Ave. Nº 530 P.J Micaela Bastidas, of the District of Callería of the Department of Ucayali. She is 56 years old and is a mother of 4 children; 3 of legal age and 1 still dependant on her. She is married. Her husband works in the National University of Ucayali, as an "Assistant for Human Medicine". With the first loan received from Manuela Branches of 300 soles, Dolibe decided to invest in the sale of sweets. She has worked with the Bank for 4 years.

Currently she continues with the business of selling sweets. She usually rises early to carry out the activities of the home, in order to later prepare the delicious homemaD. sweets and to leave to sell to her clients.

With the loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy: 1 bag of flour, 1 bag of sugar, 2 boxes of oil, 3 sticks of butter, 1 box of eggs, lard, etc.

Dolibe thanks the Bank of Manuela Branches because, thanks to it, her business has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies wholesale for making sweets, such as flour, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
hola nosotros somos el grupo Torre Fuerte, estamos ubicados en el Barrio las Lomitas de la Ciudad del Paraiso, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos.
nuestro grupo se compone de la siguiente forma:
Xiomara U.: soy la coordinadora del grupo y me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos y ropa nueva, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a esta actividad la cual me ayuda mucho para el sustento de mi hogar.
Maria de la Cruz M.: ella tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de bicicletas, repuestos y reparaciones de las mismas, durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, ella trabaja junto con su esposo, tiene una hija la cual esta estudiando en la universidad.
Bexi Yolanda G.: ella tiene mas de 1 año de dedicarse a lo que es venta de ropa y calzado, las ventas las realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar, tiene 4 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela primaria del barrio donde ella vive.
por tal razon estamos solicitando un credito para poder seguir mejorando en nuestros negocios y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello, we are members of the group Torre Fuerte, and we live in the Las Lomitas neighborhood of the city of Paraiso. We know each other very well and have always worked together. Our group is made up of the following: Xiomara U.: i am the coordinator of the group and am dedicated to the sale of cosmetics and new clothing. I have three years of experience in these activities which has helped me very much in supporting my home. Maria de la Cruz M.: for more than 10 years she has dedicated herself to the sale of bicycles, spare parts and repairs of the same. During all of this time she has done well, and she and her husband work together. she has a daughter who is studying at university. Bexi Yolanda G.: she has more than one year of experience in clothing and shoe sales, which she sells both from her home and as a traveling saleswoman. She has four sons in primary school in the neighborhood in which she lives. For these reasons we are asking for a loan in order to improve our businesses and achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials and supplies to supplement our businesses

loans.name: Carlos Luciano

texts.es:
Carlos inició el negocio por deseos de salir adelante y de que a su familia no le hiciera falta nada, para lo cual era necesario contar con otro ingreso aparte del que percibe en la empresa para la cual trabaja como mensajero. Comenzó en Junio de 1992, como su papá siempre se ha dedicado al transporte, el le ofreció que trabajara con él por un tiempo, pero como realmente le gustó el trabajo y le empezó a ir muy bien, decidió seguir trabajando en el transporte público y así tener un ingreso extra para cubrir los gastos de su casa y familia. El crédito anterior de KIVA le ayudó a darle mantenimiento a su unidad y a prepararse para los meses que son épocas de mucha lluvia y en las cuales hay que mantener las unidades en excelentes condiciones mecánicas.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para mantener en buen estado su unidad y de esta forma brindarle un servicio seguro y cómodo a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Carlos began his business with dreams of being successful and of his family not lacking for anything. This required another income in addition to the one he earns working as a messenger for a business. He began in June of 1992, like his father he always has been a taxi driver, he offered him work for some time, but as he really like the work and it was going well for him, he decided to continue working in public transportation and in this way have extra income to cover his household and family expenses. The previous KIVA loan helped him maintain his unit and prepare himself for the rainy season when he has to maintain many units in excellent mechanical condition. He needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to maintain in good shape his unit and in this way provide safe and comfortable service to his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain his taxi

loans.name: Juanny

texts.es:
La señora Juanny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Abner Monrroy Cachay Mz. D Lt. 5, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años y es madre de 2 hijas menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo  trabaja como Técnico Agropecuario. Juanny con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de pollos. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el Banco.
.
En la actualidad ella cuenta con el negocio de venta de ropas, usualmente se levanta temprano para atender a sus pequeñas hijas, para luego dedicarse a repartir las prendas a sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2.500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses comprará: prendas de vestir al por mayor, 2 doc de blusas, 3 doc de pantalón, 2 doc de polos, y otros para damas, caballeros y niños.

Juanny agradece al Banco de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo incondicional que le brinda.
texts.en:
Mrs Juanny is a member of the Communal bank "Juan Zaplana Belliza" located at Jr. Abner Monrroy Cachay Mz. D Lt. 5, in the district of Yarina Cocha in the department of Ucayali. She is 40 years old and the mother of two young girls who are dependent on her. She is married and her husband work as a Technical Agriculturist. With the first loan of S/. 300 that Juanny received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of chickens. She has been working with the bank for five years. Currently she is involved in the selling of clothing, and typically wakes up early in order to take care of her little daughters, after which she then dedicates herself to the needs of her customers. With this loan of S/. 2.500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase larger quantities of garments: two boxes of blouses, 3 boxes of pants, 2 boxes of polos and other clothing for women, men and children. Juanny is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos bank for unconditionally supporting her.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing garments

loans.name: Jorge Martin

texts.es:
Jorge inició el negocio porqué pensó que era una actividad comercial muy importante ya que siempre existirán personas que tengan la necesidad de transportarse en taxi, como los empleados, alumnos, maestros etc. y de esta forma podía obtener un ingreso para sostener a su familia. Comenzó en Octubre de 1998 por lo que casi va a cumplir 20 años en esta actividad, aunque primero empezó como chofer de un microbús de ruta fija y posteriormente comprpo su propio vehículo para empezar a trabajar por su cuenta, aunque con el inconveniente de que tenía que rentar las placas, pero afortunadamente ya cuenta con su propia concesión y con un carro de modelo mas reciente. Por lo anterior, no se puedo quejar pues gracias a dios le ha ido muy bien y lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que el mismo se fija su propio horario. El anterior crédito con KIVA le ayudó mucho a mejorar su unidad y hacerla mas segura ya que pude invertir el dinero en amortiguadores y afinación para un mejor rendimiento.

El necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para mejorar las condiciones de su unidad y obtener un mejor rendimiento y ahorro de combustible.
texts.en:
Jorge started his business because there are always people in need of transport, like employees, students, teachers, etc., and he thought it was a good commercial activity. By starting the business he was able to earn income to sustain his family. He began in October of 1988, and has nearly 20 years of experience in this business. He first started driving a minivan on a fixed route, and later bought his own vehicle in order to work for himself. This was inconvenient because he had to rent the license plates, but fortunately he now has his own franchise and a new model car. Thanks to God the business has done well and Jorge likes his work because he gets to set his own schedule. Jorge's previous loan with Kiva helped him upgrade his taxi to make it safer because he could invest money in shock absorbers and tuning for better performance. Jorge needs a loan of US$250, which he will use to improve the condition of his taxi so that it performs better and saves gas. He will repay the loan in 3 months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en el Jr.16 de Noviembre Nº.161-AA.HH. “Las Américas” del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 1 hija mayor de edad, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos  de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de ropas. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el Banco  Comunal. 

En la actualidad  cuenta con el negocio de producto de belleza venta de “UNIQUE y NATURA”, brindándole grandes ganancias, permitiéndole pagar su préstamo puntualmente. 

Con el  préstamo de S/.1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses invertirá en la compra de : 1 vitrina y productos de UNIQUE y NATURA. 

Marina demuestra alegría en su rostro, por la oportunidad que le  brinda la vida, y por ende agradece al Movimiento de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Galacticas 2" which is located at Jr.16 de Noviembre Nº.161-AA.HH. "Las Américas" of the Callería district in the department of Ucayali. She is 49 years old and has a daughter. She used the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos to invest in the sale of clothing. She has been working with the communal bank for two years. Her current business consists of selling "Unique y Natura" beauty products. This business has been profitable for her and has allowed her to pay her loan promptly. The current loan she is requesting in the amount of $600 will be used to purchase a display case and "Unique y Natura" products. Mariana will repay this loan in 4 months. Mariana's happiness is reflected in her face. She is happy for the opportunity that life has granted her and is grateful to Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of display case.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
La señora Mirian pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en la Av. Pachacute Mz. A Lt. 9, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo es mecánico electricista. Mirian con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir con una pequeña venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio en casa “venta de repuestos y  accesorios de camiones y autos”.Mirian siempre tuvo en mente  formar su pequeña microempresa y este sueño lo hizo realidad Manuela Ramos.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 3.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando variedades de repuestos al por mayor: faros de volvo, fajas de motor de carro, relais de alternador, magneto de arrancador, etc.  

Mirian se volvió una mujer emprendedora demostrando felicidad, agradeciendo siempre a Dios y al Banco de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Mirian belongs to the Juan Zaplana Belliza community bank, Av. Pachacute Mz. A Lt. 9, Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali department. She is 37 and the mother of two young dependent children. Her husband is an electrical engineer. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Mirian decided to invest in a little grocery business. Now she sells car and truck parts and accessories from her home. Mirian has always dreamed of starting her own small company, and Manuela Ramos has allowed her to achieve that. With this 3,000 sol loan, which she will pay back in six months, she will buy a variety of parts wholesale: bulbs, belts, alternator relays, starter magnetos, etc. Mirian has become an enterprising and happy woman who will always be grateful to God and the Manuela Ramos bank.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of parts

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura inició el negocio porqué le gusta tener su propio dinero, ser una persona independiente y poder comprarme sus cosas y además ayudar a su mamá con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en septiembre de 2004 vendiendo en una mesita al frente de su casa con la ayuda de su mamá, fue entonces que le empezó a ir bien y se le presentó la oportunidad de comprar un carrito para elaborar tortas, lo cual le ayudó a tener mas espacio y a vender mas. Como esta actividad es solo por las noches, en el día aprovecha para dedicarse a vender ropa entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares, y también le ha ido muy bien. El anterior crédito con KIVA lo ocupó para invertirlo en materia prima para la elaboración de comida pero este que esta solicitando lo invertirá parte en materiales y parte en la compra de ropa para vender.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir materia prima que le permita elaborar mas cenas tales como sopes, tostadas, gorditas, tortas, etc. y para compra de ropa de temporada para dama con lo cual piensa incrementar sus ganancias
texts.en:
Rosura started her business because she likes to have her own money, be an independent person, and be able to buy things for herself and help her mother with household expenses. She started in September of 2004, selling food on a table in front of her house, with help from her mother. The business was doing well so when an opportunity to buy a small cart presented itself, and she bought the cart to have more space to sell cakes. Because Rosura only sells meals at night, Rosura spends her days selling clothing to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. This business has also taken off. Rosura's previous loan with Kiva was invested in raw materials to make food, but Rosura will invest this new loan partially in materials and partially in clothing to sell. Rosura needs a loan of US$400, which she will repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy raw materials to make more dishes like soups, tostadas, gorditas, cakes, etc. and to buy women's clothing for the season, which she thinks will increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso además de que le gusta mucho la repostería y las ventas, ya que es una actividad que aprendió hace muchos años porque su familia se dedicaba a eso. Comenzó a elaborar y vender pan hace 20 años, en aquel entonces su familia tenía una panadería establecida la cual cerraron hace dos años por la avanzada edad de su papá que ya no podía trabajar y fue cuando decidió a elaborar el pan en su casa y venderlo a domicilio, lo cual le gusta hacer y en la actualidad me ha ido muy bien y ya tiene muchos clientes. Con el anterior crédito de KIVA pudo comprar materiales para elaborar el pan y con este crédito que esta solicitando quiere aprovechar la época de frío que se acerca y en donde sus productos tienen mas demanda.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir materia prima, recipientes y moldes que le permitan elaborar más pan y atender mejor a sus clientes que en esta época de frío que se acerca demandan mas producto.
texts.en:
Margarita started her business out of necessity, and she enjoys baking and sales. She learned to bake many years ago because it is her family trade. She began to bake and sell bread 20 years ago, when her family had an established bakery. It was closed two years ago because her father was getting old and couldn't work. This was when Margarita decided to bake bread in her home and sell it door to door. She likes this work and the business has gone well. Margarita has many clients. With her previous loan through Kiva Margarita bought cooking supplies to make bread, and now she'd like a loan to increase production because she expects more demand during winter. Margarita needs a loan of US $400, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy raw materials, containers and molds that will help her make more bread. She'll be able to better serve her clients during the winter when demand is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Zully Ruby

texts.es:
La señora Zully pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en la Av. Nuevo Bolognesi Mz. F  Lt. 6, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49  años y es madre de 3 hijos, solo 2 viven con ella y son independientes, es casada, su esposo es carpintero. Zully con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio en casa “Taller de Costura” usualmente ella se levanta muy temprano para atender a su familia y luego dedicarse a la confección de sus prendas. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 12 metros de tela de Algodón, 15 kilos de tela Dacron, blondas, cierre y otros para implementar su negocio.
 
Zully día a día agradece a todas las personas que le apoyan, en especial  al Banco de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Zully belongs to the Banco Comunal, "La Amistad," Av. Nuevo Bolognesi Mz. F Lt. 6, Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 49 and the mother of three, two of whom are adults still living with her and her husband, a carpenter. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Zully decided to invest in a little garment shop. Now she works from her home-based garment business, getting up very early to take care of her family and then work on sewing her clothing. With this 1,200 sol loan, which she will pay back in five months, she will buy 12 metres of cotton cloth, 15 kilos of Dacron, lace, closures and other things to start up her business. Zully is grateful every day to everyone who supports her, especially the Manuela Ramos bank.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale materials

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua la señora Angelina C. se dedica desde hace 12 años a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy amablemente con el propósito de mantener su hogar.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería para comercializarla. Es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así suplir su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión. Son sus sueños seguir con su negocio para así continuar mejorando su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Ciudad Sandino in Managua city, Mrs. Angelina C. has had her convenience store business for more than 12 years which she amiably runs with the goal of supporting her home. Today she has approached Ceprodel for a loan to buy merchandise to sell. For this reason she approached Ceprodel and in this way she can supply her business but she requires an investment to do so. Her dreams are to keep on with her business and in this way continue improving her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener un ingreso que le permitiera darles de comer a sus hijos, ya que su esposo falleció y ella se quedé con la responsabilidad de sus hijos, razón por la que buscó varias alternativas para ganar dinero y esta fue la que mejor se acomodaba a sus necesidades, ya que de esta forma también podía estar al pendiente de sus hijos. una vida mejor, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas. Primero comenzó lavando y planchando ropa ajena y haciendo el aseo en casas de sus vecinas y algunas otras actividades que le daban ingresos para sostener a sus hijos, pero a partir de Abril de 2002 fue que comenzó a vender ropa usada, cuando su hijo que vive en los E.U.A. le empezó a mandar pacas de ropa usada para venderlas y de esta forma mantener a sus otros hijos y también ayudar a sus nietos. Gracias a su anterior crédito con KIVA pudó comprar mas pacas de ropa y en la actualidad va a ocupar el dinero para comprar ropa usada para el otoño y el invierno.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir mas pacas de ropas y tener un mejor surtido que ofrecerle a sus clientes y de esta manera aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana started her business out of necessity to earn an income that would help her feed her children. Her husband had passed away and Juana was left with the responsibility for her children. She looked for various alternatives to earn money and this was the best way to accommodate her needs, because she can also care for her children while she works. This is a better life, and Juana enjoys sales.
