First Juana began washing and ironing clothing and cleaning the houses of her neighbors, plus a couple of other activities that combined, earned enough income to support her children. In April 2002 Juana began to sell used clothing when her son, who lives in the U.S., sent her boxes of used clothing. She sold them, and was able to support her other children and help her grandchildren. Thanks to a previous loan with Kiva, Juana could buy more boxes of clothing. Now she'd like to buy used clothing for autumn and winter. Juana needs a loan of US $400, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy more boxes of clothing so as to offer better supplies to her clients and increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en la Calle Oroya  Mz.10 Lt.07, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41  años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y 2  aun dependen de ella, es soltera,. Guadalupe con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en  venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, Internet y lo va implementar con una fuente de soda.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 1 saco de arroz, un saco de azúcar, 2 cajas de leche, implementación de su fuente de soda. 
 
Guadalupe esta muy agradecida con Dios por las cosas buenas que le brinda y por darle la oportunidad de surgir en la vida.
texts.en:
Guadalupe belongs to the Banco Comunal, "La Amistad," Calle Oroya Mz.10 Lt.07, Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 41 and the single mother of six children, four of whom are grown up and two of whom are still dependent on her. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in a grocery store. Now she has the grocery store and the Internet and wants to add a soda fountain. With this 2,000 sol loan, which she will pay back in five months, she will buy a sack of rice, a sack of sugar, two boxes of milk and set up her soda fountain. Guadalupe is very grateful to God for the good things He has given her and for giving her the opportunity to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various food products, setting up a soda fountain

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado las ventas, y de esta manera tiene la oportunidad de conocer personas además de que le permite ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero y también ayudar a sus hijos para que terminaran una carrera profesional y tener asi mejor calidad de vida. Comenzó en Agosto de 1992, primero vendiendo cerámica que una señora le daba a comisión para que la vendiera. Como se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio decidio independizarse y sus ganancias se duplicaron. Además de la cerámica también comenzó a vender productos de belleza y sus ganancias también eran buenas, posteriormente se dedicó a vender joyería y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa. El anterior crédito que recibío a través de KIVA le sirvió muchísimo ya que pudo resurtir su negocio para la temporada de fin de año que es cuando las personas compran más.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 5 meses para volver a surtir el negocio para darle un mejor servicio a los clientes y para que estos le sigan comprando
texts.en:
Rosa started her business because she's always liked sales. Her business gives Rosa the opportunity to get to know other people, be independent, earn her own money, help her children pursue professional careers, and have a better quality of life. She started in August of 1992, first selling ceramics that she commissioned from a lady who crafts them. When she realized that business was good, she decided to work independently and her sales doubled. In addition to ceramics, she also began to sell beauty products, and later she added jewelry. Now she sells clothing, too. Rosa's previous loan with Kiva helped her a lot because she was able to resupply her business for the holiday season, when people spend more. Rosa needs a loan of US$550, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll once again use the money to supply her business so as to provide better service to her customers so that they continue to buy.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Teresa pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en el Jr. Oroya Mz.G Lt. 2, AA.HH. Nuevo Bolognesi del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 45 años y es madre de 3 hijos, 1 mayor de edad,  y 2 aun dependen de ella es casada, su esposo es fotógrafo. Teresa con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en venta de néctar.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de comida “pensión” en la cual acostumbra a levantarse temprano para realizar sus actividades
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, compro: 10 kilos de tomates, 20 pollos, 15 kilos de papa, lechuga y otros.  

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio y la estabilidad económica de su familia ha mejorado
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to Banco Comunal, "La Amistad," Jr. Oroya Mz.G Lt. 2, AA. HH. Nuevo Bolognesi, Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 45 and the mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on her. Teresa’s husband is a photographer. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of 300 soles, she decided to invest in a nectar business. Now she depends on her meal sales and is used to getting up early to conduct her activities. With this 1,200 sol loan, which she will repay in five months, Teresa will buy 10 kilos of tomatoes, 20 chickens, 15 kilos of potatoes, lettuce and other foods. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, her business and her family’s economic stability have improved.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale ingredients

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur la señora Maria Gutierrez se dedica desde hace 20 años a la actividad económica de la agricultura. Es importante destacar que ella es una madre de dos hijos los cuales tiene que mantener y por se esfuerza día a día en su actividad económica.

Actualmente el motivo por el cual ella acude a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de insumos para la agricultura. Por esta razón es que ella espera que se le otorgue y así mantener su actividad económica. Es importante destacar que ella se ha destacado como fiel cliente de Ceprodel y por esta razón ha solicitado el crédito.
texts.en:
Sra Maria Gutierrez has worked for 20 years in the agricultural sector of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. It’s also important to note that she is the mother of two children whom she works hard to support. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan to enable her to buy agricultural supplies. She hopes to be given financial assistance so she can continue her work. Maria has been a long-term and outstanding client of Ceprodel, and for this reason she has asked for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural supplies

loans.name: Silvia Ynes

texts.es:
La señora Silvia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Galácticas 2”, ubicado en el Jr. Amazonas Mz. A Lt. 17 del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años y es madre de 5 hijos que aun dependen de ella, es casada su esposo se dedica a la mecánica de motos y carros. Silvia con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos  de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de especería (condimentos). Tiene 10 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal. 

En la actualidad ella cuenta con el negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras y especería   se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para apoyar a sus hijos en casa, luego  a las 6 de la mañana   va al mercado para dedicarse a su negocio.
 
Con el  préstamo de S/.3,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará: 1 saco de azúcar, 1 paquete de fideo, 3 kilos de cominos, 2 kilos de pimienta, 4 tiras de doña gusta, verduras y otros.

Silvia manifiesta que,  Manuela Ramos es una ayuda para nosotras y para su familia, es por eso que sigue adelante y pagando muy puntual su préstamo
texts.en:
Silvia belongs to Banco Comunal, "Mujeres Galácticas 2," Jr. Amazonas Mz. A Lt. 17, Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 41 and the mother of five dependent children. Her husband is a motorcycle and car mechanic. With her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles, she decided to invest in condiment sales. She has been working with the Banco Comunal for 10 years. Now she depends on her grocery, vegetables and condiment sales. She gets up at 5 A.M. to help her kids and then goes to the market at 6 to work in her business. With this 3,000 sol loan, which she will repay in four months, Silvia will buy a sack of sugar, pasta, three kilos of cumin, two kilos of pepper, bouillon, vegetables and other things. Silvia says that Manuela Ramos is a support for her and her family, and that is why she can move forward and pay her loan off quickly.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various wholesale products

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
Ruth inició el negocio porqué siempre ha sentido gusto por las ventas y el comercio ademas es una actividad que puede hacer en su casa en determinada horas, lo que le permite estar siempre al cuidado de su hija y de su hogar, además de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó en Marzo de 2000, primero vendiendo productos de belleza , y actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropa, primero vendia estos productos entre familiares, vecinos y amistades y ellos le fueron recomendando más clientes y gracias a Dios hasta la fecha le ha ido muy bien ya que en la actualidad tiene una buena cartera de clientes. El anterior crédito que recibío de KIVA le sirvió para invertir en mercancía lo cual le ayudó bastante para surtir su negocio de ropa para fin de año y así pudo sostener el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 5 meses para adquirir mercancía que le permita tener un mejor surtido de ropa para sus clientes y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ruth started her business because she's always liked sales, and it is something that she can do in her house during predetermined hours. Her business allows her to care for her daughter and her home, and its a way to help her husband cover household expenses. Ruth began in March of 2000, first selling beauty products. Now she sells clothing, initially to family, neighbors, and friends. These clients recommended her to others, and thanks to God Ruth's business has done well to date. Now she has a good client portfolio. Ruth's prior loan from Kiva helped her invest in merchandise, with which she supplied her business for the holiday season, and thereby sustained the business. Ruth needs a loan of US$550, which she'll repay in 5 months. She'll use the money to buy merchandise that will allow her to have a better supply of clothing for her clients and improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Lucero Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Lucero del Amanecer esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. L. Mejorada en el distrito D. Mariscal Cáceres en Huancavelica. Esta comunidad, ubicada al margen derecho del Río Mantaro, entre 2600 y 3600 D. altitud, tiene un clima cálido, cuenta con acceso a las ciudades D. Huancavelica y Huancayo por vía férrea y por carretera. Su actividad principal es L. agricultura ( cereales, papas, habas, verduras), L. ganadería (ovinos, vacunos y animales menores), comercio y turismo.

Teresa A., es casada tiene 8 hijos, inició su negocio hace 8 años con un pequeño capital, pero por problemas D. salud perdió todo, volvió a empezar vendiendo comida e implementando una tienda que actualmente todavía L. tiene. Con los prestamos que recibe incrementa su mercadería y ahora no solo venD. en su tienda sino en un puestito que tiene en un colegio. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales, sobre todo los 4 últimos, pues los mayores son casados y no tuvo medios para hacerles estudiar.

Paulina S., es casada tiene 5 hijos, empezó a trabajar con FINCA hace 6 meses donD. invirtió su primer préstamo en L. compra D. cuyes y gallinas, antes no vendía nada porque nadie le prestaba dinero, ahora compra y venD. animales menores. ElL. manifiesta que ha logrado mejorar sus ingresos, ahora ya no tiene problemas con L. comida diaria, su sueño es ahorrar para comprarse un terreno pues vive con su suegra.

Saturnina F., es casada tiene 4 hijos, antes solo se dedicaba a lavar ropa, ahora venD. anticuchos y frituras. Antes tenia problemas con su esposo, pues le gustaba mucho el licor, ahora él esta trabajando pues e como elL. ha ido superándose. Con sus prestamos logró comprar una anticuchera, ahora gana mas que antes y tiene mejores ingresos para sus hijos. Saturnina ahorra para que sus hijos vivan felices sin que les falte nada, sobre todo en los estudios.
texts.en:
The Lucero del Amanecer Bank is located in the community of L. Mejorada in the district of Mariscal Cáceres in Huancavelica. Situated on the right bank of the Mantaro River, at an altituD. of between 2600 and 3600, the community has a mild climate and can be accessed from the towns of Huancavelica and Huancayo by both rail and road. Farming (cereal crops, potatoes, beans, vegetables); animal husbandry (sheep, cattle, and young animals); as well as commerce and tourism are the main activities. Teresa A. is married and has eight children. She began her business 8 years ago with a small amount of capital, but because of health problems, she lost everything. She began selling meals and opened a small store that she still runs. With the loan that she receives, she plans to increase her stock. Now she not only sells from her store but also from a stall that she has in a school. Her dream is to see her children become professionals, especially her four youngest children as the older ones are married and she does not have the means to have them study. Paulina S. is married and has five children. She started work with FINCA six months ago when she invested her first loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and chickens. Beforehand she could not sell anything because no one would lend her money, whereas now she buys and sells young animals. She has succeeded in increasing her income and now has no problems putting bread on the table. Her dream is to save enough to buy a plot of land so she can live there with her mother-in-law. Saturnina F. is married and has four children. In the past she used to wash clothes for a living, but now she sells anticuchos (type of kebab) and fried foods. She used to have problems with her husband because he drank too much, but now he has work, and so she has been able to overcome her difficulties. With the loan she has managed to buy a kebab stand, and now she earns more than before and has more money to spend on her children. Saturnina’s plan is to save money so that her children can lead happy lives and lack for nothing—especially where their education is concerned.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Bank Lucero del Amanecer needs 5100 soles so that its 13 members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Sara Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Sara pertenece al Banco Comunal “De La Amistad”, ubicado en el Jr. Tambo Mz. F Lt. 10 -  AA.HH “Nuevo Bolognesi”, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años y es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales solo 1  depende aun de ella, es casada su esposo es jubilado en la carrera de Educación. Sara con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.300 decide invertir en la venta de manualidades.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con el negocio de ventas de manualidades y productos de belleza (AVON, EBEL).
 
Con este préstamo de S/.1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 4 metros de tela, 6 ovillo de hilo de tejer, 5 metros de tela galleta, felpa (tela toallita) y productos de belleza.  

Sara manifiesta que todas las mujeres pueden salir adelante con fe y voluntad.
texts.en:
Sara belongs to Banco Comunal, "La Amistad," Jr. Tambo Mz. F Lt. 10 - AA. HH "Nuevo Bolognesi,” Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 58 and the mother of six, and one of those children is still dependent on her. Her husband is a retired teacher. With her first Manuela Ramos loan of 300 soles, she decided to invest in handicraft sales. Now she sells handicraft and beauty products (Avon, Ebel). With this 1,000 sol loan, which she will pay back in five months, Sara will buy six skeins of yarn, five metres of quilted fabric, plush fabric (towelling) and beauty products. Sara says that all women can get ahead with faith and willpower.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of fabric, yarn, towelling and beauty products

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
El Sr. Joel habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah IV etapa, tiene 44 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa y con dos hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, que estudian, don Joel trabaja en servicios de seguridad, las 24 hora de día y noche y el siguiente día tiene libre, pero aprovecha a trabajar en construcción ya que su salario es bajo, y con los trabajos extras se ayuda ya que su meta es terminar de construir su casa ya que es muy sencilla e insegura es de tabla y zing y  lo que mas desea es que su familia tenga una vivienda digna. Con la solicitud de préstamo que esta haciendo es para infraestructura quiere hacer las paredes de su casa , lo cual desea vivir un poco mejor y gozar de mejores condiciones para su familia. Lo cual necesita   comprar  materiales de construccion como piedra, arena, cemento, hierro el no gastaria en la mano de obra ya que tambien se desempeña en construccion, que va hacer de gran beneficio en los ahorros .
A largo plazo es poder tener su casa construida, cuidar de su familia, y dar estudios a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Joel lives in the Hialeah IV stage neighborhood of Managua. He is 44 years old and has two children ages nine and 12 both of who are in school. His wife is a homemaker and Joel works as a security guard. He works a 24 hour shift and has the following day off but takes advantage of his day off by working in construction because his salary is not very high. The extra work is helpful as his goal is to finish building his home. Joel is requesting this loan to improve the infrastructure of his home since it is currently made of wood and zinc. His wish is to live better and to enjoy a home that is worthy of his family. He will only use the loan to purchase construction materials such as rock, sand, cement and iron as he will provide the labor himself. His long term goals are to build his home, to take care of his family, and to provide for the education of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and construction of the walls of his home.

loans.name: Rosa Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Copaiba Mz. A Lt. 2, AA.HH José D. San Martín del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada, su esposo es Jubilado del “Ministerio del Interior”. Rosa con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. abarrotes.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con una bodega, realiza sus actividades desD. muy temprano para luego atender su negocio.   
  
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1.500, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando abarrotes en general: 1 saco D. arroz, 1 paquete D. aceite, detergentes,1 paquete D. fideos, etc.    

Rosa manifiesta que las mujeres trabajadoras y luchadoras siempre saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a client of the Juan Zaplana Belliza Bank which is located in Jr. Copaiba Mz. A Lt. 2, AA.HH José D. San Martín, in the district of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali state. She is 54 years old and is the mother of three grown children. Her husband used to work for the Ministry of the Interior but is now retired. With her first loan of S/.300 from the organisation Manuela Ramos, Rosa decided to buy and sell groceries. At present she has a small store. She starts her chores very early so she can then attend the store. With this loan of S/. 1,500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy more groceries: a sack of rice, a container of oil, detergent, a box of noodles etc. Rosa shows that hard-working, determined women will always succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various items for her store.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La señora Rita pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en la Calle Oroya  Mz. H Lt. 2, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49  años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 mayores de edad y 2  aun dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo trabaja como tutor social en el Centro Juvenil “Maranguita”. Rita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en  venta de comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un taller de costura para diversos tipos de prendas de vestir.
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 15 kilos de telas variadas (licra, algodón), 3 docenas de cuello para polos, 15 metros de blondas, etc.  .
 
Rita manifiesta que su estabilidad económica ha mejorado gracias a la ayuda que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Señora Rita is a member of La Amistad Bank, located in Oroya Mz Street, H Lt. 2, in the District of Callería, Ucayali state. She is 49 years old and is the mother of 6 children, 4 of them adults, and 2 whom she still supports. Her husband is a social worker for the Juvenile Centre “Maranguita”. She used her first loan of S/. 300 from the organisation Manuela Ramos to buy ingredients so she could sell food. Today she has a dressmaking business where she makes various types of clothing. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which will be paid back in five months, she will buy 15 kilos of material (lycra, cotton), 3 dozen collars for polo shirts, 15 metres of silk lace etc. Rita says that her financial stability has improved thanks to the assistance she has received from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of material, silk lace at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Marcia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Marcia tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Monseñor Lezcano de donde fue el banco popular 4 ½ c al lago, casada y con tres hijos  de 16, 20 y 22 años de edad, uno de ello estudia la secundaria, y los otros dos trabajan y apoyan en los gastos de la familia su esposo se desempeña como conductor. Doña Marcia vende ropa desde hace cuatro años e inicio con capital propio con ayuda de su esposo, vende al contado y al crédito, con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa variada para niños y adultos, lo cual para estas fechas las ventas son buenas, y desea también poder cumplir con unos encargos de ropa de sus clientes.
A largo plazo es captar más clientela, incrementar las ventas, y poder hacer mejoras a su casa para gozar de una vivienda digna con su familia, también a ayudar a su hijo  con los estudios.
texts.en:
Marcia is 42 years old and lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married and has three children ages 16, 20 and 22. One is in high school and the others work and help with the family's expenses. Her husband works as a conductor. Marcia has been selling clothes for four years. She started the business with her own money and with the help of her husband. She takes cash and credit payments. She will use the money from this loan to purchase a variety of clothing for children and adults as this clothing sells well during this time of year. She will also use the loan proceeds to fill some orders from her clients. Her long term goals are to attract more clients, to increase her sales, and to be able to make improvements to her home so that she can enjoy a worthy home with her family and to help her son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: El Sr. Ever tiene 40 años de edad, su esposa es modista , con tres hijos de 8,12 y 14 años de edad, los tres están estudiando, don Ever tiene 40 años de edad y se desempeña trabajando como capitán de mesa en un restaurante lo cual tiene ocho años de experiencias, toda los días llega noche a su casa ya que el restaurante se llena mas por la noche abecés animado por las propinas que los cliente le dan, otras cansadas por el desvelo. Con la solicitud del préstamo  quiere meter las aguas negras y comprar dos puertas para su casa, para estar más higiénico y seguro con su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener las condiciones para seguir mejorando su casa, tener un negocio propio y poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ever is 40 years old. His wife is a dressmaker, and they have three children—ages 8, 12, and 14—all of them in school. Ever is the head waiter at a restaurant where he has worked for 8 years. He arrives home late each night, since the restaurant is busiest at night—some nights Ever comes home feeling inspired because of the tips that his customers have given him, while on other nights he feels tired from the long hours. With the loan he has requested Ever would like to install a sewer system and purchase two doors for his house so that his family can have a safer and more hygienic home. His long-term goal is to be in a situation where he can continue improving his house, have his own business and be able to help his children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making repairs and installing a sewer system

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es: Don Wuilman tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un bario que se llama Laureles Norte, casado y con dos hijos mayores de edad, de 23 y 25 años, que ya son independientes, su esposa es comerciante, por la mañana se levanta a preparar el desayuno a su esposo ya que desde horas muy tempranas esta listo para salir a trabajar, ya que su trabajo es de taxista y tiene que chequear el carro ante de salir, ya tiene catorce años en este negocio que abecés le resulta cansado por que la situación esta mala y lo clientes no quieren pagar lo que vale la carrera, pero también hay días buenos, pues el inicio con recursos propios cuando compro su carro. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro. Zinc, para un anexo en la parte de atrás de la casa. A largo plazo es poder tener otro taxi para dar mejores servicios y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Wuilman is 42 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 23 and 25 both of whom are independent. His wife is a merchant and she gets up in the mornings to prepare breakfast for her husband who has to get ready for work early as he works as a taxi driver and needs to check his car before leaving. He has been in this business for fourteen years and the job can sometimes be tiring because the situation is bad and clients do not want to pay what the trips are worth. However, there are good days. He started his business by buying his car with his own funds. He is asking for this loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and zinc to build an addition to the back of his home. In the long run, he hopes to have another taxi to be able to offer a better service and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build addition to  home.

loans.name: 8 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
La asociación “ 8 de marzo” pertenece al centro focal de  Villa Adela, hace mas de nueve años, estas mujeres has formado a lo largo de los años  un grupo muy organizado y unido. Todas ella están casadas y tiene un promedio de 4 hijos, éstos de distintas edades, desde bebes hasta jóvenes universitarios. Tienen la esperanza que sus hijos culminen sus estudios ya que muchas de ellas por falta de recursos económicos no culminaron el bachillerato.
Existen diversas actividades dentro la asociación siendo la venta ropa una de ellas, la comercializan en los mercados de la ciudad de El Alto, también se dedican a la venta de cosméticos en puestos y también de manera ambulante, otra actividad entre la asociación es la venta de queso de Patacamaya (localidad de La Paz), es decir que realizan viajes a ésta localidad para abastecerse de una buena cantidad de queso para luego comercializarla en los mercados y ferias de la ciudad. 
La asociación 8 de marzo necesita mayor capital para compara mayor mercadería, de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias, con el objetivo de poder ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder aseguar en bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The association “8 de marzo” belongs to the focal center Villa Adela. For more than 9 years these women have stayed together over the years as a very organized and united group. All are married and have an average of 4 children of various ages, from baby to university age. They hope that their children will finish their studies as many of them, for lack of economic resources, didn’t finish high school. There are diverse businesses within the association, selling clothing is one of them, selling in the markets of El Alto city; also some sells cosmetics in stands and as a street vendor; another activity in the association is the selling of Patacamaya (a locale near La Paz) cheese, where they make trips to this locale to stock up with a good quantity of cheese to then sell in the markets and festivals of the city. The association 8 of March needs capital to buy more merchandise, and in this way improve their earnings, with the objective of begin able to save for their childrens’ education and be able to ensure the well-being of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase products

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica tiene 41 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 18 años de edad, el mayor esta estudiando, su esposo es albañil trabaja independiente y a veces por contratos. Doña Verónica trabaja en una casa particular en servicios domésticos desde hace veinte años a diferentes familias, pues anteriormente cuando comenzó era madre soltera ya que su esposo la abandono y tenía que cubrir sus necesidades con la suerte que le dieron trabajo el cual hasta hoy ha sido su sustento y ayuda para su familia, con suerte se volvió a casar y tiene una familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura ya que quiere cambiar el techo de su vivienda que esta en mal estado, y con estas lluvias ha estado pasando necesidad ya que se moja.  A largo plazo es poder tener un negocio propio y así poder estar en su casa, ayudar a sus hijos con los  estudios.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua. She has two children ages two and 18 years old. Her oldest child is in school. Her husband is a construction worker who works independently and is also sometimes contracted. Veronica has worked as a domestic worker for over 20 years for different families. She was given the opportunity to work as a domestic worker when she was a single mother who had been abandoned by her husband. She had to pay for the necessities and this work has, until this day, allowed her to support her family. Luckily she remarried and she now has a family. This loan will be used to repair the infrastructure of her home. She wants to change the roof of her home which is in bad shape and is in need of repair because it leaks. Her long term goal is to have her own business and be able to stay at home and to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the roof of her home.

loans.name: Los Solecitos Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Los Soles esta conformado por 4 integrantes, la Sra. Esther es la coordinadora del grupo.

Esther inicio el negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la casa ya que el trabaja vendiendo en el mercado rodante jugetes y articulos de novedad y temporada, el se enfermo un tiempo y ella empezo con la venta de estos articulos para los gastos de su hogar desde hace 3 años.

Pilar inicio el negocio ya que el ingreso de su esposo no era suficiente, empezó hace 5 anos cuando desocuparon a su esposo del trabajo y encontro otro donde le pagaban un poco menos, por lo que fue algo dificl al principio y ella tuvo que buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos extras. dedicandose a la venta de cosmeticos.

Candelaria inicio el negocio ya que su esposo no encontraba trabajo y sus hijos estaban pequeños y no podia pagar los gastos mas basicos, fue entonces que empezó su negocio de venta de calzado por catalogo, fue surtiendo poco a poco hasta que hizo crecer su negocio y ha podido salir adelante.

porque inicio el negocio hace tres años ya que queria llevar a su familia de vacaciones entonces le empezó a ayudar a vender perfumes a una conocida para obtener mas dinero al ver que empezaron a obtener mas ingresos y verse menos precionados con los gastos decidio dedicarse a esto al 100%, posteriormente un familiar le empezo a traer perfumes de U.S.A. a buen precio y fue asi que empezo a crecer su numero de clientes.

Ellas necesitan de un prestamo por US $1225 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con sus negocios, con tu apoyo esto sera posible.
texts.en:
The Soles Group is composed of 4 members. Mrs. Esther is the group's coordinator. Esther started her business to help her husband cover living expenses. 3 years ago, he was selling toys, souvenirs and other assorted gifts at the local market when he fell ill and she had to fill in and continue selling those item in order to keep paying their household expenses. Pilar started her business because her husband's income alone was not enough for their family's survival. She started her business 5 years ago when her husband was let go of a job and found a new one that paid less. It was tough at the beginning, so she decided to start selling cosmetics as a way to generate extra income. Candelaria started her business because her husband was having difficulties finding a job and their children's basic needs were not being met. She started selling shoes thorough catalog orders and, gradually, the business grew and she was able to succeed. Mrs. Paola started her business 3 years ago because she wanted to take her family on a vacation trip. She began selling perfumes to an acquaintance to raise some money and then she realized it was actually becoming a source of income. Financially, she fell less pressured and decided to dedicate herself 100% to this venture. Subsequently, a relative was bringing perfumes from the U.S.A. at low prices which enabled her to gain more customers. They need a loan in the amount of US $1225 that will be paid back within 5 months. It will be used to keep buying merchandise and keep their businesses moving forward. With your help, this can become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda inició el negocio para pagar gastos adicionales y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, primero empezó a hacer y vender arreglos florales para diversas ocasiones a sus vecinos y ellos le recomendaron mas personas para arreglos de mesas, y fue así como empezó a hacer se de clientes y que su negocio fue prosperando.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $325 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo y cumplir los encargos que tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Yolanda started her business to help her husband afford living expenses and to cover additional living costs. She started manufacturing and selling flower ornaments for her neighbors' special occasions. Those neighbors, in turn, began telling their friends about Yolanda's table ornaments; therefore, she slowly began building a clientele and her business prospered. She needs a loan in the amount of US$325 that we will be paid back within 6 months. This amount will be used to purchase merchandise to fulfill clients' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Adrian Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Adrián tiene 27 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah II etapa, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 6 años que esta estudiando la primaria, su esposa trabaja en servicio de domestico, la mama le ayuda a cuidar a su hijo ya que los dos trabajan para salir adelante y poder terminar de construir su casa ya que es muy sencilla es de tabla  e insegura . Don Adrián trabaja desempeñándose como auxiliar de bodega desde hace cuatro años. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la construcción de paredes de concreto de su vivienda. A largo plazo es ascender de puesto y obtener un mejor ingreso, y ayudar a su hijo con los estudios.
texts.en:
Adrián is 27 yeears old, lives in the Hialeah II neighborhood in the capital city Managua. He and his wife have a 6 year old son who is in primary school. His wife works as a domestic employee, his wife’s mother helps take care of their son as both he and his wife work in order to get ahead and be able to finish building their home. Adrián has worked as an assistant in a grocery store for 4 years. The loan is for the infrastructure of concrete walls for his home. In the long term he hopes to move up in his job and obtain a better income, and help his son with his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and construction of concrete walls of his home

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos escolares de sus hijos, ya que ella desea que sigan estudiando para que tengan mejor calidad de vida, ella empezó vendiendo cosméticos primero entre sus familiares y luego en mas colonias para tener mayor numero de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $625 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder incrementar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa started her business to help her husband pay for their children´s education. She wants them to continue getting an education so they might have a better life in the future. She began selling cosmetics to her friends and relatives and later added perfumes to her inventory to reach more customers. She needs US$625, which will be paid back within 6 months, to purchase merchandise and better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Metodio

texts.es: Metodio es un hombre entregado a su trabajo y a su familia, gracias a sus terrenos puede cultivar grandes cantidades de  plantas de café, plátanos y frutos cítricos, los cuales son un gran soporte en la economía de su hogar.  Adicionalmente, viaja regularmente a la ciudad de Pucallpa, parte de la selva, donde abundan las tortugas, las cuales trae a vender a su región, de igual manera distribuye pescado en los mercados.  Metodio no es de las personas conformistas, todo lo contrario, es de las personas que se proyecta, y está constantemente pensando en su la mejora de su calidad de vida.  Ahora desea incrementar su producción, para ello requiere de 1000 soles, cantidad que solicita en calidad de préstamo, para que siga creciendo como agricultor y en la venta de animales.
texts.en:
Metodio is a man dedicated to his work and his family. On his land he grows large quantities of coffee plants, plantain bananas, citrus fruit, all of which contribute greatly to his household finances. He also travels regularly to the jungle town of Pucallpa, where there are a lot of turtles that he transports back to his own region to sell. He does the same with fish that he sells in the markets. Metodio isn’t the conforming type, quite the contrary. He is the kind of person who plans ahead and is constantly thinking how he can improve his quality of life. Now he wants to increase production, for which he is asking for a loan of 1000 soles. The money will be used to expand his farm and to buy and sell animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in his coffee crops and for the buying and selling of animals

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio es de las personas que pone como prioridad la palabra de Dios, viaja a diversos lugares como misionero, enseñando la Biblia, hace esto sin descuidar su actividad como agricultor y gracias a la ayuda de su esposa puede realizar sus múltiples tareas.  Demetrio viaja constantemente, pero la gran mayoría de días en el mes lo pasa junto a su familia en sus terrenos de cultivo, lo encontramos en las afueras de su hogar  extendiendo la cosecha de café, tiene la esperanza que los precios del café mejoren para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias.  De igual manera, espera incrementar su producción y para ello, para ellos solicita este préstamo, inversión que hará en sus plantaciones de café, para que con la mejora de sus ingresos pueda tener la posibilidad de brindar educación superior a sus tres hijas y también continuar viajando llevando la palabra de Dios a las personas.  Esperamos que usted pueda brindarle el apoyo  necesario para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Demetrio is one of those people that puts a priority on the word of God. He travels to diverse places like a missionary, teaching the Bible. He does this without neglecting his activities as a farmer and, thanks to the aid of his wife, he can carry out his multiple tasks. Demetrio travels constantly, but the great majority of the days of the month he spends with his family in his fields. We find them on the outskirts of his home, extending the coffee crop. He hopes that the prices of coffee will improve so that he can obtain better profits. Similarly, he hopes to increase his production and for this, he requests this loan. He will invest in his coffee plantations, so that, with the improvement of his income, he can have the opportunity to offer higher education to his three daughters and also to continue travelling carrying the word of God to the people. We hope that you can offer him the necessary support to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián está muy agradecida con las instituciones que le ayudaron a adquirir una pequeña camioneta donde brinda servicios de transporte de carga a los pobladores de las zonas alejadas, así como también, él mismo puede trasladar sus productos agrícolas a las ciudades cercanas.  Las dificultades que se le presentan es debido a las largas distancias que recorre por zonas donde la carretera no está en buenas condiciones, entonces su camioneta necesita estar en constante mantenimiento, ahora ha presentado algunas fallas y esto ocasiona que no pueda realizar los traslados y no hay ingresos económicos para su hogar.  Es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, para invertirlo en la reparación de su carro y además para sus plantaciones de café, las que requieren de los abonos necesarios.
texts.en:
Julian is very grateful to the institutions that helped him obtain a small truck which he uses to offer freight transportation services to people who live in remote areas. He also transports their produce to nearby towns. The difficulties he encounters are due to the long distances that he travels through areas where the roads are in poor condition. As a result his truck is in constant need of repair. Right now it is out of service, which means that he cannot transport goods and has no income. For this reason he is asking for a loan which he will use to repair his vehicle and also for his coffee fields which require fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his truck which he uses to transport freight, as well as to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza es una humilde madre de familia que para mantener su hogar  trabaja vendiendo  refrescos en las calles. Desde muy temprano prepara sus refrescos de  maíz y de soya, los coloca en varios baldes y así sale a vender por las calles y por los mercados cercanos.  Debido a este trabajo sufre diversos malestares físicos, por el peso de los baldes, por eso desea comprar un triciclo donde llevar sus baldes. Pero ahora no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir este vehículo, el cual aliviaría su pesada carga.  Mostrando esta necesidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de este triciclo, está segura que con paso del tiempo y dejando de cargar sola los baldes sus malestares pasarán.
texts.en:
Eliza is a humble mother that works selling refreshments in the streets to maintain her home. From very early she prepares her refreshments of corn and soy, places them in various buckets and thus leaves to sell along the streets and by the nearby markets. Due to this work she suffers diverse physical discomforts from the weight of the buckets. Therefore she desires to buy a tricycle which can carry her buckets. But now she does have sufficient money to acquire this vehicle, which would alleviate her heavy load. Demonstrating this need, she requests a loan for the purchase of this tricycle. She is sure that with the passing of time and stopping carrying the buckets herself, her discomforts will pass.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tricycle to carry her buckets, that she uses to sell refreshments on foot.

loans.name: Mirko

texts.es: Mirko es un joven que gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres pudo concluir sus estudios superiores de pedagogía, pero las diversas circunstancias le permitieron ejercer su carrera, sin embargo no pierde  la esperanza de pronto ser un maestro ejemplar.  Mientras tanto, trabaja como agricultor en sus hectáreas de terreno, cultiva frutos cítricos y plátanos, por las tardes trabaja con su motocarro haciendo transporte de pasajeros, para así incrementar los ingresos en su hogar, y apoyar a sus padres, ya que es el último  hijos y el único que vive con ellos.  Ahora desea incrementar sus ingresos y pronto ejercer su carrera para tener mayores posibilidades de crecer personalmente como profesional  y ayudar a sus padres, el monto que  requiere  es de 600 soles, para incrementar su producción agrícola, espera que usted pueda ayudarlo a realizar sus deseos prontamente.
texts.en:
Mirko is a young man who thanks to the hard work of his parents was able to complete his higher-education, but various circumstances didn't allow him to carry out his carry. Nevertheless, he never lost hope of soon being an exemplary teacher. Meanwhile, he works as a farmer on his hectares of land, cultivating citrus fruit and bananas, and in the afternoons uses his automobile as a taxi to earn extra income for his household and support his parents. He is their youngest child and the only one who lives with them. Now he wishes to increase his income and soon start his career to expand the possibilities of growing as a professional and helping his family. At the moment, he's requesting 600 soles to increase his agricultural production. He hopes you will help him realize his dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase agricultural production

loans.name: Yesenia Aparicia

texts.es: La Sra. .Yesenia tiene 36 años de edad, habita en un barrio que se llama Campo Bruce tiene  tres hijos de 3, 4, y 5 años de edad, su esposo es dueño de una unidad de taxi y lo trabaja todo el día.  Doña Yesenia es una mujer trabajadora pues desde horas muy temprano se levanta para hacer el desayuno a su familia ya que el niño mayor va al colegio y tiene que alistarlo para que su esposo lo pase dejando, ya que su negocio es una pulpería y le toca  atender a sus clientes, y por las mañanas se vende bastante, la pulpería la puso desde hace cuatro año con ayuda de su esposo. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para comprar insumos diarios para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de productos a si como incrementar las ventas, pues este es su cuarto crédito con la institución ya que con la facilidad de los prestamos ha podido surtir mas su negocio y a futuro desea poner una miscelánea  donde pueda vender de todos los productos lo cual esto le generaría mejores ingresos, también ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 36 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Campo Bruce. She has three children ages three, four and five. Her husband owns a taxi and works all day. Yesenia is a hard working woman. She gets up in the early hours of the day to make breakfast for her family. Her oldest son goes to school so she has to get him ready so that her husband can drop him off at school since Yesenia has to attend to her business. Yesenia has a grocery store and she sells quite a bit in the mornings. Yesenia established her store four years ago with the help of her husband. She is asking for this loan to purchase daily supplies so that she can offer her clients a variety of products in order to increase her sales. This is the fourth loan that she has received from this institution and with this help she has been able to increase the stock in her store. In the future, she hopes to be able to open a general store where she can sell all kinds of products which will allow her to generate more income and to help her children with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Toda su vida Gregorio se ha dedicado a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, pero las diversas necesidades de su familia lo llevaron a trabajar en otras actividades, con mucho esfuerzo, luego de varios años de trabajar en su chacra, pudo conseguir comprar un motocarro, con el cual brinda transporte de pasajeros por las tardes y noches.   Gracias a estas actividades, puede brindar lo necesario en su hogar y sobre todo darle oportunidades a sus 6 hijos de educarse y ser mejores que su padre algún día, nos comenta.  Pero pese a estas dos actividades han habido meses donde las cosas no han marchado bien en el trabajo, debido a los diversos mantenimientos que requiere su  motocarro, lo cual dificulta  la mejora de sus ingresos.   Estas son  las razones por la que Gregorio solicita nuestro apoyo en la mejora de su herramienta de  trabajo y espera que atendamos a su solicitud de préstamo para reparar su motocarro que tanto le costó  obtener
texts.en:
His whole life Gregorio has dedicated himself to farming, specifically to the cultivation of coffee. However, the diverse needs of his family led him to work in other activities. With much effort, and after several years of working his farm, he was able to acquire a motocar which he uses to transport customers in the afternoons and evenings. Thanks to these activities, he can provide for his home and – importantly – give his six children the opportunity to become educated. He tells us he hopes they can live better than their father. However, despite his two endeavors, there have been months when things have not gone well due to the various maintenance issues related to his motocar which create difficulties for him in improving his income. These are the reasons why Gregorio seeks our support in making the tool of his trade work better, and he hopes that we respond to his request of a loan so he can make repairs to his motorcar which costs him so much to maintain.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his motocar which he uses to tranport passengers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es una mujer que desde niña sus padres le enseñaron  a trabajar en el campo, hoy es madre de 8 hijos, quienes le ponen en apuros económicos por las diversas necesidades que atender, sobre todo de educación, para que logren superarse y crecer  profesionalmente.   Por ello Victoria  desea incrementar sus ingresos y solventar los gastos de sus hijos, para ello necesita aumentar su producción, y de esta manera  obtener mayores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.   Frente a ello, solicita un  préstamo para la compra de semillas, contar con usted es motivador para ella, así puede seguir esperanzada en continuar su trabajo para la mejora de su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman whose parents taught her to work in the field since childhood. Today she is a mother of 8 children, who put her in an economic predicament because of all the necessities they require, above all their education so that they are able to better themselves and grow professionally. Because of this, Victoria wants to increase her income and cover her children's expenses. To do this, she needs to increase her production, and in that way obtain higher income and satisfy the necessities of her household. Facing this, she requests a loan to buy seeds. To count on you is motivating for her, and with this she can stay hopeful in continuing her work to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds for her next planting

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac es un noble joven dedicado a la agricultura, labor con la cual puede ayudar a  su familia frente a la crisis económica que vienen atravesando, a sus 22 años está íntegramente dedicado a sus terrenos de cultivo, donde invierte su  juventud y tiempo  con el fin de lograr el bienestar en su familia.  Acompañado con sus ganas de progreso, desea ser independiente, forjar su futuro y conformar su propia familia.  Es consiente que  eso podrá realizar siempre en cuando logre  adquirir una estabilidad económica para ofrecer a su familia lo necesario y no hacerles pasar carencias.  Es por ello que  desea adquirir un terreno donde para ampliar su producción, sembrar nuevos productos y llevarlos a vender a los mercados de la ciudad más cercana.  Bajo estas metas requiere de su apoyo, solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes necesarios  para toda  producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Isaac is a noble young man who works in agriculture; work with which he can help his family face the economic crisis that is coming through. At 22 years old, he is completely dedicated to the land he cultivates, where he invests his youth and time with the goal of obtaining the well-being of his family. Accompanied by his desire to progress, he wants to be independent, to shape his future, and to form his own family. He is aware that he will be able to accomplish this when he is able to establish economic stability to offer his family the necessities and not have them go through shortages. It is because of this that he wants to acquire land, where he can expand his production, plant new products, and take them to the markets in the closest city for sale. Given these goals, he requires your support. He requests a loan to buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers necessary for all agricultural production.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his farming

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Hace más de 4 años, Fabian trabaja como agricultor en una hacienda, donde también vive con su familia, los dueños de esta hacienda les otorgan a sus trabajadores  una vivienda.  Junto a otras personas, pasa todo el día dedicado a la producción de los terrenos asignados, como también seleccionan los productos y los embarcan en los camiones  rumbo a la capital y diversas ciudades del país.  Sin embargo los deseos y ambiciones de Fabián es empezar su propia producción, gracias a su trabajo lograron  obtener un terreno donde cosechar, y a la par de su trabajo en la hacienda, don Fabián  con ayuda de su pareja trabajan en la producción de papa.  Ellos requieren de un préstamo para la compra de abonos y semillas, para así incrementar su producción  y poco a poco independizarse y trabajar  en sus propios terrenos, con ello aumentará las expectativas de  crecimiento y desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
For more than 4 years, Fabian has been working as a farmer on a ranch, where he lives with his family. The owners of the ranch provide their workers with housing. He, along with other people, spend all day cultivating their assigned fields, as well as picking crops and loading them on to trucks headed to the capital and to different cities in the country. Nevertheless, Fabian aspires to start his own crop business. Thanks to his work, he was able to obtain a plot of land for cultivation. In addition to his job at the ranch, Mr. Fabian, with the help of his spouse, works growing potatoes. They need a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer so that they can increase production and become independent little by little. Thus, they can work their own fields, and their family’s growth and development can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto es una hombre de avanzada edad, por problemas de salud no puede dedicarse a sus labores como agricultor, sin embargo se las ingenió para establecer un negocio dentro de su comunidad, debido a la gran demanda de establecimiento de comida, instaló un pequeño restaurante, punto de encuentro de varios pobladores, los que agradecen a don Modesto por el local, que sirvió para estrechar lazos de amistad y compañerismo entre los vecinos.  Ahora Modesto desea que su negocio pueda ser más acogedor y por ello desea ambientarlo para que las personas puedan sentirse cómodas y a gusto con la atención del restaurante. Espera que podamos atender su necesidad y otorgarle la cantidad que necesita en calidad de préstamo, para la mejora de su negocio, y sobre todo para la mejora de su calidad de vida y la de su pareja.
texts.en:
Modesto is an older man. Because of health problems, he cannot do his work as a farmer. Nevertheless, he managed to establish a business within his community. Owing to the large demand for food establishments, he set up a small restaurant, a meeting spot for various inhabitants who are grateful to Mr. Modesto for the business, which serves to strengthen bonds of friendship and camaraderie among the neighbors. Now Mr. Modesto wants his business to be more welcoming and for this he wants to adapt it so that people can sit comfortably and feel at home with the restaurant service. He hopes that we can meet his need and grant him the amount that he needs in the form of a loan to improve his business and, above all, to improve his quality of life and that of his partner.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up and adapting his small restaurant

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma es una alegre agricultora, nos dicen sus vecinos y amigos, que la mejor de su localidad, por el empeño que le pone a su trabajo cada mañana.  También es una buena   madre, y por el bienestar de sus hijos es que realiza todas las tareas que embarga la labor de agricultora, sin descuidar el cuidado y atención de sus 5 pequeños hijos, quienes tienen sueños por realizar.  Para ayudar a sus hijos a cumplir sus metas, entiende que tiene que mejorar su economía, para ofrecerles una educación de calidad, para ello espera incrementar su producción, tener la capacidad económica de brindar lo necesario a sus seres queridos.  Para eso requiere de  un préstamo, para comprar lo necesario para su próximo sembrío y cultivo de sus productos, contando con su apoyo, Wilma podrá seguir siendo la mejor agricultora y la mejor madre.
texts.en:
Wilma is a cheerful farmer, her neighbors and friends tell us; the best in her area because of the effort that she puts into her work every morning. She is also a good mother, and it is for the well-being of her children that she does all the tasks that make up the work of a farmer, but without neglecting the care and attention of her 5 small children, who have dreams to fulfill. To help her children achieve their goals, she understands that she needs to improve her finances, to offer them a quality education. For this, she hopes to increase her production to have the economic capacity to give what is needed to her loved ones. For that, she requires a loan to buy what she needs for her next planting and growing of her products. With your support, Wilma will be able to continue being the best farmer and the best mother.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to purchase all that is necessary for her next crop

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es: Desde pequeña, Jovita estuvo inversa en la actividad agrícola, y ahora que es madre es la única actividad con la cual puede mantener a su familia, la encontramos trabajando en la cosecha de sus productos, tuvo la amabilidad de mostrarnos su trabajo y su cosecha.   Es una mujer muy trabajadora y preocupada por el progreso de su familia, para así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.  Es por estos motivos solicita un préstamo para el aumento de su producción.  Es importante para ella elevar los ingresos de su hogar, de eso depende que los gastos de educación de sus hijos puedan ser solventados.  Y en el futuro poder pagar una instituto superior para que progresen académicamente, con su ayuda, Jovita podrá lograr que estos niños tengan una esperanza de un mañana mejor.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Jovita worked in agriculture and, now that she is a mother, it is the only activity with which she can support her family. We found her working in the harvesting of her products. She was nice enough to show us her work and her crop. She is a very hardworking woman and is concerned about the progress of her family, for that is the way to improve the quality of life of her loved ones. It is for these reasons that she requests a loan to increase her production. It is important for her to increase her household income, as she depends on this to cover her children's education expenses, and in the future to be able to pay for higher education so that they can progress academically. With your help, Jovita will be able to give her children hope for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital to increase her agricultural production

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo de las buenas personas que su trabajo lo basa en el bienestar de su familia, como padre, desea educar a sus hijos y hacer de ellos hombres de bien, gracias a su actividad como agricultor puede  brindarles lo necesario para desarrollarse, un claro reflejo de ello es que el mayor se encuentra estudiando en la capital, gracias al trabajo y apoyo de su padre.  Se ha dado cuenta que la producción de sus campos ha disminuido y desea en lo posible incursionar en el negocio de venta de abarrotes, instalar una bodega en su casa, y así tener un apoyo e ingreso extra para hogar, ya que nota que la agricultura esta en crisis.  Es esta la razón, hace presente su necesidad con el fin de obtener apoyo mediante un préstamo, para iniciar su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Maximo is the kind of person who bases his work on the well-being of his family. As a father, he wants to educate his children and make them good men. Thanks to his work as a farmer, he can give them what is necessary to develop. A clear reflection of this is that the oldest is studying in the capital, thanks to the work and support of his father. He has realized that the production of his fields has decreased and when possible he wants to enter into a grocery business, to set up a store in his house, and with this have extra support and income for his household, as he notes that agriculture is in crisis. This is the reason to present his need with the objective of obtaining support in the form of a loan to start up his grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up a store in his house since his farming income has decreased considerably

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl es un joven dedicado a la crianza de animales, con el fin de poder ayudar a sus padres en sus gastos, esta actividad no es desagradable para él, todo lo contrario,  la realiza con sumo gozo porque tiene gran aprecio y cariño a los animales, los cuida de la mejor manera.  Como todo joven tiene sueños que realizar, uno de ellos es incrementar la cantidad de animales, para con el tiempo venderlos en los mercados, especialmente en los días festivos. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carnerito y así, en algo, aumentar sus animales y sus ingresos para fines de este año.
texts.en:
Saul is a young man who raises livestock as an end to a means to help his parents with their expenses. This isn't an unpleasant occupation for him, actual it is quite the contrary - he carries out his duties with an enormous pleasure and with great affection towards the animals, taking care of them the best way possible. Like every young person, he has dream that he wants to see materialized. One of them is to add to his livestock herd, so that with time he will be able to sell them in the markets, especially on holidays. He is requesting a loan for this reason. He wishes to purchase a calf to add to his herd of animals and to increase his income by the year's end./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf to add to his herd.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela es una mujer emprendedora que muestra mucho empeño en las labores de su bodega, por los avances que a tenido, su bodega es la más concurrida de su comunidad, porque es una tienda bien surtida y sus clientes pueden encontrar de todo en un mismo lugar.  Sin embargo, percibe  que sus vecinos requieren de otros productos, para satisfacer estas necesidades, Mariela ha pensado incrementar mercadería para mujer, ropa interior, para las damas de la localidad.   Para ello solicita un préstamo para implementar su negocio con nueva mercadería y así satisfacer las necesidades de las damas de su comunidad, como las suyas propios, contar con usted es la opción para que Mariela haga realidad estos proyectos.
texts.en:
Mariela is a hard working person who is very dedicated to the work in her convenience store. Thanks to the improvements in ther store, hers is the store that is the most visited in her community. It is well stocked and her clients can find everything all in one place. Nevertheless, she has noted that her neighbors require other products, and to satisfy their requests, Mariela has thought to increase her line of merchandise for ladies, such as undergarments, for those in her community. She is requesting a loan for this end, to implement the new line of products in her business and satisfy the needs of the ladies in her community. With your support Mariela can realize her goals.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments to increase the selection of merchandise in her store.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico, de 32 años de edad es padre de un hijo maravilloso que lo ama mucho, y lo incentiva a seguir adelante, vive junto a su esposa Greysi quien lo apoya mucho, sobre todo en su negocio.  Él se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad en su propio domicilio desde hace ya 7 años, gracias a este negocio, compró un motocarro, con el cual trabaja por las tardes brindando transporte de pasajeros, asimismo vende bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas). Federico mantiene abierto su negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas heladas casi todo el día, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es dar una buena atención a sus clientes y ver producir de una forma ascendente su negocio.   Trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios, mantener activo su negocio y sobre todo para la educación de su hijo.  Ahora desea ampliar su tienda de abarrotes y ambientar con mesas, sillas y otros, su venta de bebidas heladas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Federico, age 32, is the father of a wonderful son who loves him very much and motivates him to move forward. Federico lives with his wife, Greysi, who supports him a lot, especially in his business. He has been selling provisions and basic need items from home for 7 years now. Thanks to this business, he was able to purchase a motorcycle taxi, which he works with in the evenings providing transporation to passengers. He also sells cold drinks (beer and soft drinks). Federica keeps his general store open almost all day long. What he likes about his job is providing good customer service and watching his business grow. He works in order to cover his daily expenses, to keep his business active, and aboveall, to provide an education for his son. He now wishes to expand his general store and give his beverage business some atmosphere with tables, chairs, and other things in order to better welcome his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Liven up his beverage business with better furniture

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es madre soltera, tiene una hija de un añito de edad, quien es su mayor inspiración de seguir surgiendo, vive con su hermana y su mamá quienes la apoyan mucho.  Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, plátanos, leche , etc) y bebidas heladas, desde hace 4 años en un pequeño local construido al costado de su vivienda, atiende todo el día, y lo que le gusta más de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente con las cuales intercambia ideas, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona y tiene mucha concurrencia, lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado, con ambientes necesarios para dar una buena acogida a sus clientes. Trabaja para dar lo mejor a su pequeña hija y sobre todo para respaldar sus gastos diarios.  
Gloria quiere ampliar e implementar su negocio de abarrotes, así como también quiere mandar a construir un kiosco, donde pueda vender cómodamente su bebidas heladas.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother with a one-year-old daughter who is her greatest inspiration to continue surging ahead. She lives with her sister and her mother, who support her efforts greatly. For the past four years, she has dedicated herself to the sale of groceries (rice, bananas, milk, etc.) as well as cold beverages in a small location built next to her home. She tends to her store all day, and she enjoys her work because it allows her to interact with different people with whom she exchanges ideas since her store is well-situated and experiences a good amount of traffic. What is difficult for her is not having an adequately-outfitted location, with the atmosphere necessary to give her customers a comfortable experience. She works to provide the best for her daughter and to cover her daily living expenses.

Gloria would like to expand and improve her grocery business, and she would also like to have a kiosk built where she could comfortably sell her cold beverages.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her grocery store and also build a kiosk for selling cold beverages.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis, de 34 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos, los mismos que están estudiando, el vive junto a su pareja Viviana, con quien mantiene una relación conyugal de 12 años, y la apoya mucho.  Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, es chofer, desde hace 3 años, gracias a su buena administración del dinero, ahora es propietario de un motocarro, el cual le ayuda a fortalecer su hogar, con el ingreso que tiene de su motocarro apoya a su pareja, que se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches . Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer a mucha gente con quienes incluso comparte ideas y además no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.   Trabaja para la educación de sus hijos y desde luego para solventar sus gastos diarios.  Desea mandar a reparar su motocarro y trabajar tranquilo, posteriormente quiere comprarse otra moto.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old and he is the father of three children, all of whom are attending school. He lives together with his partner Viviana, with whom he has had a common-law relationship for the past 12 years. She supports him in everything. His occupation is passenger transport. He has been a driver for the past 3 years and thanks to his savvy financial administration, his is now the owner of his own motorcycle, a tool that has helped him establish his home. With the income earned with his motorcycle he is able to support his partner, she sells prepared foods in the evenings. What he loves about his work is that he gets to meet so many people and he gets to share ideas with them, and also, he loves that he can choose his own hours of work. He works hard to provide an education for his children and to cover the daily expenses. He wants to have his motorcycle repaired to work without worries of it failing, and in the future, he hopes to purchase a second motorcycle.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle, with which he provides passenger transport.

loans.name: Berlin

texts.es: Berlín quien tiene 30 años, es padre de 2 hijos maravillosos que le incentivan a salir adelante, vive junto a su pareja, quien lo apoya en todo sus decisiones y está de acuerdo con sus metas trazadas.  Desde hace 6 años, trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros por diferentes lugares  de Pucallpa, es propietario de un motocarro, en el cual solo trabaja por horas, ya que también se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos para el hogar. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque así conoce muchos lugares.   Trabaja duro, ya que quiere brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser, como también velar por los gastos familiares.  Desea comprar repuestos para la reparación de su motocarro, en el futuro quiere alquilar un local para su negocio de venta de artefactos.
texts.en:
Berlín is 30 years old, father of 2 marvelous children who are his incentive to be successful. He lives with his wife who supports him in all his decisions and is in agreement with his goals. For 6 years he has worked transporting passengers to different places in Pucallpa as owner of a motorcar, which he works alone for hours. He also sells home electronics. He likes his work a lot because he gets to know many places. He works hard as he wants to provide his children with everything they need and they are his reason for being, and he also takes care of his family’s expenses. He wishes to buy parts to repair his motorcar. In the future he wants to rent a locale for his business selling electronics.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts to repair his motorcar

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 45 años, es viuda y madre D. 5 hijos, los mismos que son solteros y trabajan para apoyarla en lo posible.  Ella se dedica a la venta D. postres y bebidas heladas (cerveza, gaseosa, gelatinas, entre otras variedades) en su domicilio, venD. estos productos por las tardes, desD. hace 2 años, por las mañanas trabaja  como empleada domestica.  Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es conocer mucha  gente con quien comparte cocimientos D. negocio.  Lo difícil es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una mejor acogida y atención a sus clientes.  Se motiva trabajando para sus gastos diarios y para mantener activo su negocio.  El motivo D. su solicitud D. es mandar a construir una “ramada”, que es una estructura que tiene 4 maderas como columnas a los 4 extremos y un techo cuadrado D. ramas, en este espacio y bajo su sombra, ambientar adecuadamente para la venta D. sus bebidas, y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old, she is a widow, and the mother of 5 children. Her children are all single and they work hard to support her as much as they can. She sells desserts and cold drinks (beer, soft drinks, gelatins, among other things) from her home. She sells her products in the evenings and she has been doing so for the past 2 yeasrs. In the mornings she provides home maintenance services in private homes. She loves her work because she gets to meet so many people and she likes to share business knowledge and practices. The hardest part about the job is trying to find a store to rent to proviD. her customers with better service. She is motivated to keep working to cover the daily expenses and to keep her business active. She requests a loan so that she can build a gazebo maD. from wood and palm tree branches as the roof covering. Under this shaded area she wants to model it appropriately so that she can sell her drinks from it and to proviD. her customers with better service.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To model an adequate space where she can sell her desserts and drinks.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 35 años, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser, ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo a quien ama mucho.  Se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y productos de primera necesidad desde hace 5 años, pero no es el único ingreso que tiene, ya que también, dentro de su domicilio tiene una pequeña vidriería, a cargo su esposo, ella trabaja todo el día, y lo que le gusta de su negocio es que concurre mucha gente con quienes trata temas distintos y hasta incluso le enseñan muchas cosas que ella desconocía, lo difícil es no contar con un local adecuado, ya que el espacio es muy reducido.  Trabaja arduamente para apoyar con los gastos familiares.  Solicita este préstamo para la ampliación e implementación de su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are attending school. They are her reason for being. She depends on the unconditional support from her husband, whom she loves so very much. For the past 5 years she has been selling soft drinks and basic needs products. But this is not their only income - her husband sells panes of glass. She works all day and she loves her job because she gets to meet so many different people and shares different ideas with them, and she even learns things that she never knew before. The hard part is that she doesn't have an adequate space to run her business - her current location is very small. She works arduously to help cover the family's expenses. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and expand.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Catherine
