texts.es: Catherine, de 21 años es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de un añito de nombre Jahir, ella vive junto con su mamá, quien la apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos.  Se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza, desde hace 3 años, este trabajo lo realiza por horas, y lo que le gusta es que conoce muchos lugares e intercambia ideas con sus clientes, quienes son su motor de trabajo, nos menciona. Lo mas difícil para ella es no contar con una movilidad, ya que tiene que trasladarse por los diferentes lugares.  Catherine trabaja para darle lo mejor a su hijo y desde luego apoyar con los gastos familiares.  Desea implementar con más mercadería su negocio, y establecer en su casa un espacio para ello, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy transitada.
texts.en:
Catherine, age 21 years, is a single mother. She has an infant son by the name of Jahir. She lives along with her mom, who supports her a lot and is in agreement with her proposals. She is dedicated to the sale of clothes and beauty products. For 3 years, she has carried out this work for hours. What she likes is that she knows many places and exchanges ideas with her clients, who are her motivation for work, she tells us. The most difficult thing for her is to not have transportation, since she has to travel to different places. Catherine works to give the best to her son and, of course, to help with the family expenses. She wants to introduce more merchandise to her business, and to establish a place for it in her house, since it is located in a well traveled zone.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to provide a place for her sales in her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son solteros e independientes.  Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas) desde hace 4 años, negocio con el cual se siente orgullosa de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos, trabaja todo el día, y le encanta mucho su trabajo porque socializa y aprende mucho.  Sus productos de belleza los deja al crédito o al contado y los lleva a ofrecer por los distintos lugares de su zona.  Ahora quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus bebidas heladas y por ello presenta esta solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother of three still-single children who are now on their own. She dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products and cold beverages (beer and soda), which she has done for the past four years. She is proud of her business and of managing to help her children get ahead. She works all day, and she enjoys it a great deal because she gets to socialize with others and learn a lot. She sells her products on credit or in cash, and she takes them around the various areas of her zone to sell. She would like to order a kiosk built where she could sell her cold beverages, which is why she is soliciting a loan.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for the selling of cold beverages.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 50 años es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando carreras profesionales, vive con su esposo Landis, quien es mecánico y la apoya en todo lo posible.   Ella se dedica a al arte textil, aprendió empíricamente de su mamá, Lina es muy solicitada por muchas instituciones, por su buena labor, lleva en esta actividad mas de 10 años, confecciona ropa para niños y adultos en los distintos géneros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que intercambia ideas y se socializa, pero lo mas importante es que mediante ese negocio está sacando adelante a sus hijos, quienes muy pronto serán ¿profesionales. Lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un taller adecuado.  Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en mandar a construir un local para su taller textil y así brindar mejor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lina is 50 years old and she is the mother of 3 children, they are all attending professional training classes. She lives with her husband Landis, he is a mechanic and he supports with all that he can. She works with textiles, a trade that she learned from her mother. Lina's talents is highly sought after by institutions for her excellent work. She has been carrying out her business for the past 10 years. She produces clothing for children and adults of both genders. She loves that she can exchange ideas with her customers and she can socialize with them. But the most important thing is that her business is providing for her children. They soon will graduate and start their professional life. The most difficult part about their job is that her shop is not adequate to function. She will invest the funds of the loan to have a space built for her where she can set up her textiles shop and provide her customers with better care.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a space where she can set up her textiles shop.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: Anita tiene 27 años, es madre sotera de un hijo que está estudiando y es sus ganas de seguir adelante.  Se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas), en su casa desde hace 2 años.  Para Anita lo más importante es seguir adelante, ya que su negocio de una u otra forma la hace sentir una persona útil, siempre se manifestó como una mujer activa, atiende durante todo el día, se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y ver sus ingresos diarios. Le va muy bien.  Trabaja para la educación de su hijo y solventar sus gastos diarios.  Con el dinero del préstamo implementará con más productos su negocio. Espera que podamos ayudarlo a cumplir sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Anita is 27 years old, a single mother of one son who is studying and who is her impetus for being successful. She has sold cold beverages (beer and soda pop) in her home for 2 years. For Anita the most important thing is getting ahead, as her business in one form or another makes her feel like a useful person. She is always an active woman, attentive to her business all day, she feels happy to have her own business. What she likes about her work is selling and seeing her daily earnings. Her business is going well. She works to pay her child’s education and daily expenses. With the loan she will buy more products for her business. She hopes that we can help her meet her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more products for her beverage business

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Esta cliente inició su negocio en una pequeña pulpería y con los créditos que adim le ha proporcionado ella empezó a ofertar gran variedad de productos. Ella ha ido creciendo en sus negocios con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su  esposo el que desempeña el oficio de sastrería  y tiene su propio taller; con estos ingresos extras  le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus hijos que están en la universidad. Por su carácter amable se ha ganado la simpatía de sus vecinos logrando mantener una gran clientela. Su mayor sueño es de ampliar su negocio hasta llegar a tener una abarroteria.
texts.en:
This client started her business in a tiny general store and with the loans that ADIM has granted her she began to offer a large variety of products. She has been growing her business with the help of her children and her husband who works as a tailor and has his own shop. With this extra income she helps him with the household expenses and with the education of their children who are in university. Because of her pleasant personality she has won the friendship of her neighbors, succeeding in keeping a large clientele. Her biggest dream is to enlarge her business so that it will one day be a convenience store.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann K., 48 years old, is married and lives with her husband and ten children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer but her farming is just to support her family members. Previously, she said she could sell some rice but currently, she cannot because of inflation and bad weather conditions. She said the rice and fertilizers prices have doubled in the past year; this means that she needs to pay double the prices for fertilizers for her rice field but still gets the same amount as before. 

She grows rice two times a year. First, during the dry season, harvesting the rice takes about 3-4 months. During the rainy season, harvesting takes about 6-7 months. Rich people prefer rice that grows during the rainy season because it tastes more flavorful.

She still received support from three of her children, two of whom are garment workers and one is a sand pump worker. Her husband is a worker and makes around US$4 each day. Vann K. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to purchase good bean seeds to grow. This will help increase the family profit.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for rice harvesting business.

loans.name: In

texts.en: In H., 46 years old, makes a living by selling rice cakes in the village, earning approximately US$1 per day. Meanwhile, her husband is a teacher and makes only about US$2 a day. This couple lives in Kampong Cham and has three children. Two of their children work as tailors in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. In H. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to open a tailor shop for her children.

loans.use: To open a tailor shop for her children.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S., 27 years old, is married and lives with her two young children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2007, she has had a battery recharging business that earns her a living of about US$2 per day. 

People live in the countryside and mostly depend on the battery to power their lighting. Her husband is a construction foreman and makes US$2 per day. Srun S. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more construction tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her husband's business.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai L., 31 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children. Living in Kampong Cham, she is able to make around one dollar per day. She grows rice and crops on her plot of land. She said she has been planting since 1980 - before she got married. Her husband, Chhuon Soeun, 31 years old, has a business digging wells, making around US$3 per day. Thai L. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase land for reselling.

loans.use: To purchase land for sale.

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mot S., 42 years old, is married and lives with her three children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer and makes US$2 each day. She grows rice two times a year. 

First, during the dry season, it takes about 3-4 months to harvest rice while during the rainy season, it takes around 6-7 months. Her husband is a cow dealer, making around US$3 per day. Three of their children all students. Mrs. Mot would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase more cows.
(Mot S.'s husband is pictured)

loans.use: To purchase additional cows for reselling.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophy T., 47 years old, is a grocery seller who lives in Preytahou Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She sells many kinds of products including cake, candy, soft drinks, and food ingredients in front of one school in her village and earns around US$1.66 per day. 

Her husband, Mr. Ly Kong, is construction worker, earning around US$2.00 per day. Sophy has four children, some of whom are students and stay at home to help generate family's income. Two of her children are garment workers who earn US$4 per day. 

Sophy and her husband work hard everyday in order to support family daily expenses. Grocery selling business is the main income for family so she needs to update her business through increasing additional inventories to satisfy her customers' demand. She faces obstacles of lacking enough money to carry out her plan. Hence, Sophy would like to request a loan of US$300 to purchase more grocery inventory. Her future plan includes purchasing a store in the market for her daughter to sell vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem S., 47, lives with six of her eight children and her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has had a business selling rice since 2003 and is able to make $3 per day of profit, while her husband is a farmer and makes less than $1 per day to support the family. Chhem S. would like to ask for a loan of $300 to help increase the amount of rice she sells.

loans.use: To help increase her rice sales

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wiriasih

texts.id:
Situsi ekonomi yang semakin sulit seperti sekarang ini sangat dirasakan oleh Ni Ketut Wiriasih. Suaminya yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani terkadang penghasilannya tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya, selain itu Ni Ketut Riasih juga harus membiayai pendidikan anaknya yang sekarang duduk di kelas 2 SMU. Hal ini yang mendorong Ni ketut Wiriasih membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dengan beternak babi. Ni Ketut Wiriasih sudah menjalankan usaha ternak babi sejak 10 tahun yang lalu namun karena kekurangan modal usaha yang dialaminya sehingga Ni Ketut Wiriasih mengaku sangat sulit untuk mengembangkan usahanya.
Untuk mengembangkan usahanya Ni Ketut Wiriasih memilih mengikuti progran ternak babi yang dikelola oleh DINARI dengan pinjaman awal yang didapat sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- jangka waktu pinjaman 6 bulan dan pembayaran dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, Ni Ketut Wiriasih menggunakan pinjaman tersebut untuk membeli bibit penggemukan dan sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan. Ni Ketut Wiriasih berharap melalui pendampingan dan pinjaman usaha yang diberikan olah DINARI usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan hasil yang didapat juga akan lebih meningkat dari keuntungan yang diperoleh sebelumnya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Wiriasih is feeling impact of increasingly difficulty economic situation. Her husband works as a farmer with uncertain income that is often insufficient to afford the family's need. Ni Ketut Wiriasih also needs to pay for her child's high school tuition fee. This situation motivated Ni Ketut Wiriasih to help her husband earn some income by farming pigs. Ni Ketut Wiriasih has been farming pigs for the past 10 years. However due to insufficient funding, she has ben unable to grow the business. Ni Ketut Wiriasih started joining DINARI's pig farm improvement program. She is currently applying for $575 loan with 6 month tenor. She will be using the loan to purchase feeds. Ni Ketut Wiriasih is hoping that through DINARI's funding and training assistance, she can grow her farm and bring in more earnings to pay for her family's daily needs

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and feeds

loans.name: Ni Ketut Narti

texts.id: Sebagai ibu rumah tangga Ni Ketut Narti mempunyai cita-cita menjadi sorang peternak babi yang sukses, dengan tekun ia menjalankan usaha ternak babi yang selama ini sudah ia jalani  lebih dari 15 tahun. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan Ni Ketut Narti biasanya memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang akan di panen 5 bulan kemudian dengan keuntungan bisa di peroleh antara Rp. 250.000,- sampai Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Ni Ketut Narti mengaku dalam menjalankan usahanya ia sering kekurangan modal untuk membeli pakan maupun menambah jumlah bibit yang akan dipeliharanya, oleh karena itu Ni Ketut Narti memutuskan untuk mengikuti program ternak babi yang dikelolah oleh DINARI dan mendapat pinjaman modal awal sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,-  dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pembayarannya di akhir periode membuat Ni Ketut Nantri sangat senang karena ia bisa mengembangkan usahanya. pinjaman yang di dapat dipergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi penggemukan dan sisanya untuk membeli pakan. Ni Ketut Narti sangat berharap melalui pendampingan yang diberikan oleh DINARI usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan dapat menhasilkan keuntungan yang lebih besar dari usaha sebelumnya sehingga bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Narti aspires to be a successful pig farmer. She has been farming pigs for the last 15 years. In one growing cycle, she usually farms 2 pigs that is fattened and slaughtered after 5 months. She can earn about $27 - $33 per pigs. Ni Ketut Narti often experiences insufficient funds availability to purchase feeds or increasing numbers of farmed pigs. Therefore, Ni Ketut Narti decided to join DINARI's pig farming program and applying for a $525 loan with 6 month tenor. She is going to use the loan to purchase 4 fattening pig and feeds. Ni Ketut Narti is hopeful that DINARI's assistance will help her develop her farm and increase her farm's profitability, so she can improve her family's economic condition.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fattening pigs and feeds

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Houn T., 34, sells groceries in the local market of Kampong Cham Province. She is married with three children, who are still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about $3.30 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $500 to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in the market.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Ni Ketut Semadi

texts.id: Ni Ketut Semadi tinggal di Desa Tukadaya bersama suami dan seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di bagku pendidikan SMP. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang petani yang tidak menentu membuat NI Ketut Semadi kesulitan dalam membiayai anaknya yang masih sekolah, belum lagi di tambah kebutuhan hidup keluarganya yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Untuk menunjang kebutuhan hidup keluarganya maka  Ni Ketut Semadi memilih untuk beternak babi. Melalui program ternak babi yang dikelola oleh Dinari, Ni ketut Semadi mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan yang mana  pembayarannya dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman, membuat Ni Ketut Semadi lebih bersemangat lagi untuk bisa mengembangkan usaha ternak babinya. Pinjaman yang diperoleh tersebut dipergunakan untuk membeli 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan yang akan di peliharanya dalam jangka waktu 5 bulan. Biasanya dalam satu periode pemeliharaan Ni Ketut Semadi mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 300.000,- per ekor. Melalui pendampingan dari Dinari saat ini, Ni Ketut Semadi berharap pada akhir periode nanti dia bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar dari kenuntungan yang didapat sebelumnya.
texts.en:
Ni Ketut Semadi loves in Tukadaya village with her husband and her child that is currently studying in junior high school. Her husband's farming income is uncertain and often insufficient to afford her child's tuition fee and ever increasing daily expenses. To support her family, Ni Ketut Semadi started a pig farm. She is joining DINARI's training program and applied for $525 loan with 6 month tenor The loan will be used to purchase 2 piglets that will be faremd and fattened for 5 months. In one fattening cycle, Ni Ketut Semadi can earn up to $33 profit per pig. With DINARI's assistance, Ni Ketut Semadi is hopeful that she can earn increased profit.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: Shazia Riaz Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is married to R. M. and lives in a small neighborhood named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shazia baji's husband has a scrap business with five years of experience. Shazia baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her previous three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva’s Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, iron and papers) for her husband's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Maya baji wants a loan to buy scrap (plastic and iron) for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for a scrap business

loans.name: Parveen Javed Bhatti's Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is married to J. B. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 14 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Parveen baji's husband has a scrap business. He has been in this business for the last ten years. Parveen baji herself sews clothes for her neighbors and earns a profit. She successfully repaid her previous two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles and waste papers) for her husband's scrap business.

Parveen baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rani baji wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. Rozi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more scrap for her husband's scrap business

loans.name: Shahnaz Ilyas Masih's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is the wife of I. M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of one daughter and reads at the third standard level. Shahnaz baji's husband is a building constructor and also provides construction supplies. He has been in this profession for the last 30 years. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy construction supplies to expand her husband's business.

Shahnaz baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Salma baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy material (leather, nails) for a shoe-making business. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy gold to make sets to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to expand her husband's construction business

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Koeurn K. grows vegetables to sell in Kdey Dong Commune, Kampong Thom Province. Besides vegetable growing she also makes Khmer food to sell in her village. She has been running the business since 1980 and earns around $3 per day. Koeurn is married with three children, and all her children live at home and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Nhanh Sem, is a construction worker who earns around $3 per day for the family. Because of the increasing cost of transportation for her family, Koeurn would like to have a motorcycle to help reduce costs and make it easier to quickly transport her vegetable crop to sell in the market. However, Koeurn lacks the money to carry out her plan. In this situation, she has requested a loan of $1,050 to purchase a motorcycle and also a pump machine to use for her vegetable growing. For her future plan, she aims to have a large farm to grow vegetables.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and water pump

loans.name: Mohammad Ashraf

texts.en:
Mohammad Ashraf is 28 years old. He is educated. He is one of the staff of the National Bank of Afghanistan. He has been involved in this business for more than 8 years but he lives in a rental house. With his salary he can support his family and pay the rent of his house, but he can't build a house or buy a house. A few years ago, he bought land but he was unable to build on it. Now he needs a loan to build a house and go to live in his own house.

Therefore he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 18 months to start working on his land to build his new home and start a new life to help with his family better than now and make a bright future for his family.

Ashraf is happy with all parts of his family. He would like to say that it is really a big help for Ashraf. He wants to say that without this loan it would be impossible for him to undertake the work on his house. Finally, he would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: to build a house on the land he owns

loans.name: Salah Mohammad

texts.en:
Salah M. is 56 years old. He is a man with full experience in his job. He has a restaurant that he has been involved in for more than 20 years. First he had a restaurant in Parwoan province, then when he came back to Kabul, he opened a restaurant in Kabul. He has 10 employees in his restaurant. Its location is very good but the restaurant is smaller than other restaurants with lots of customers in the area. He would like to expand his restaurant.

Therefore he wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to start working on enlarging his restaurant, to expand his business and help his family, especially his sons who are not married yet.

He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and he has requested from all workers who use a loan and make a good business for themselves. It is a good opportunity for everyone and he would like to thank the lenders who help his country.

loans.use: To expand his restaurant

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
A. Dilorom lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She has been a MicroInvest client since 2007 and wants to assure us she is a very reliable client who trusts the MicroInvest loan process. She started the business practically from scratch, trading in small wares, but thanks to previous loans she improved the business terms and opened a trade outlet in the local bazaar.

Now Mrs. A. Dilorom trades in assorted children's wear. She has been in business for 5 years and is full of enthusiasm and willingness to work. She dreams about the good and assured future for her children. Thanks to her politeness and sensitivity, she has many repeat customers. She works with suppliers who work with clients of different income levels because the prices for her good are lower than the bazaar prices. Mrs. A. Dilorom asks KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ to import new models and to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to import new models and broaden the existing assortment

loans.name: Rahbarjon

texts.en:
A. Rahbarjon lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 6 children. Mrs. Rahbarjon applied to the MicroInvest because she heard so many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan process. Mrs. A. Rahbarjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004 so she is one of the first of our clients. Her business has good stability and her income has increased with the loans, which she has paid back on time.

Mrs. A. Rahbarjon is engaged in assorted children's wear and selling towels. She buys her assortment straight from suppliers for net cost. It permits her to sell the goods for a lower price than the bazaar prices. Now Mrs. A. Rahbarjon asks KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ for importing new seasonal goods that will permit her to increase business turnover, and to open a new trade outlet.

loans.use: to increase the business turnover and to open the new one trade outlet.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en:
A. Sanoat lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. She decided to become a client of MicroInvest because all her friends and colleagues improved their business situations thanks to the MicroInvest loan process. Mrs. A. Sanoat has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004, and she is the one of the oldest clients in our program. She is a reliable and experienced client. She is engaged in commercial service and trade; she trades in assorted children's wear.

A. Sanoat works with suppliers and trades in normal prices that are not the higher bazaar prices. She has very strong competition, and so now would like to import seasonal wear. Now Mrs. A. Sanoat asks KIVA for the business support loan of 2600 STJ for 3 months for importing new seasonal wear.

loans.use: new imports of seasonal wear.

loans.name: Thoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun B. is 34 years old and breeds pigs for a living. She has a full year of experience raising the pigs at her home. Thoeun is married to Mr. Preng Koem, 34, a fisherman, and they have three children, all of whom live at home and attend school. Thoeun talked with her husband about their lack of capitals to expand the business, and she decided to ask for a $400 loan to purchase more piglets to breed. The loan will help grow their business and increase their income to better meet the family's living expenses. Thoeun is one the leader of a group of three women sharing the loan. The other two are:

1. Mrs. Choem N., 25, a fish seller. She depends on her husband to do the fishing, while she sells the fish in the market. Choem requests a loan of $300 to purchase fishing tools, such as nets and traps, for her husband's business.

2. Mrs. Vuttha S., 38, also a fish seller. She purchases fish from a supplier and sells them in the market. Vuttha seeks a loan of $300 to stock fish for resale. The women all live in Sarikakao Commune, Kandal Province.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to breed

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: I. Gulsara lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. Gulsara has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and the loan sums are continually increased, which shows the business stability and development. She has a meat and milk production business. She dreams of purchasing a milk cow for sour cream production (to supply it to the local bazaars). The plan is to widen the assortment of milk and sour products, like pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curds, and more. Now Mrs. I. Gulsara asks KIVA for a business development loan of 2200 STJ for 4 months. Mrs. I. Gulsara thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: business development loan

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
U. Sulton lives in Spitamen, Tajikistan. He is married and has four children. After hearing many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan process, Mr. U. Sulton decided to ask for a loan for business development. He improved his existing situation. The business stability and income increase helped him repay the previous loans on time.

Mr. U. Sulton was engaged first in agricultural products and rice cultivation. But thanks to the previous loans he started a new business. Now he is engaged in the livestock business. He has two cows, one bull, and four rams. Mr. U. Sulton would like a KIVA loan for 2800 STJ for 5 months in order to purchase a pedigree bull.

loans.use: pedigree bull purchasing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of plastic containers to resell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for her salon, and clothing.

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phon P., 38, is a motorcycle taxi driver. He has been driving a taxi since 2004 and can earn approximately $2.33 per day. His wife, Mrs. Eoeun Met, 37, buys raw materials and makes Khmer traditional baskets to sell from her house. Phon has four children, all of whom go to school and also help with their mother's business. Phon faces difficulty with his old motorcycle, which is often broken, depriving him of customers and thus affecting his income. He needs a new motorcycle to improve his income, but he lacks the money to carry out this plan. Hence, he has requested a loan of $200 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to replace the old one. Phon was chosen as the leader of a five-member loan group. The other members are:

1.Mrs. Phai T., 52, who sells wooden cutting boards used for chopping meat. T. requested a loan of $300 to buy a secondhand motorcycle for transportation.

2.Mrs. Hing P., 46, sells desserts and Khmer noodles in front of her house. Hing needs a loan of $300 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for easier transportation.

3.Mrs. Tan T., 64, a Khmer noodle seller. Tan requests a loan of $200 to purchase piglets to breed.

4.Mr. Man M., 27, a motorcycle taxi driver. Man needs a loan of $250 to replace his motorcycle.

These five people all live in Leangdaiy Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mr. Lim L., 29, is a motorcycle-taxi driver. Normally, he brings his customers from the village to the market, earning around $3 per day, while his wife, Mrs. Sokhim Rom, 29, works as a vegetable seller. Sokhim has run her business since 2004, and she also looks after two children, both of whom are students. The family lives in Prektaho Commune, Kompong Tom Province. Sokhim has trouble finding a place to sell; she needs a permanent shop. Lim decided to request a loan of $400 to purchase a small shop in the local market for his wife to sell vegetable. The loan will increase their income to cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy a small shop in the market

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Mrs. Nga M., 42, is a farmer and also helps with her husband's business. They have four children, three of whom are in school, while one is married and has moved away from home. Nga is married to Mr. Saroeun Soy, 42, who is a fisherman. Saroeun always goes fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. Recently, Nga has been wanting to expand her business but has lacked the capital to do it. Nga decided to seek a loan of 1,000,000 Riel ($250) to purchase fishing equipment and more seeds for her rice crop. The loan will increase their income and help keep their family fed. They live in Compongko Commune, Kompong Tom Province.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment and rice seeds

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil, is a 43 year-old father of four children. Khalil lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon where he works as a mechanic. He is a well-known expert in his business, and people from all the surrounding villages come to his garage to repair their cars. Over the years, Khalil has learned that it is far less expensive to buy spare parts in bulk by their wholesale unit price, rather than individually. He has therefore requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to purchase the wholesale spare parts which will help him increase his small business's profitability. This is the second time that Khalil will be working with Al Majmoua. His first loan was repaid successfully and on-schedule.

loans.use: Khalil would like to purchase a supply of wholesale car parts for Khalil's auto repair shop.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is 45 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the south of Lebanon. Abbas owns a shop where he sells artificial flowers and decorative items for the home. Abbas is an energetic and active man who has always found new ways to grow and advertise his business. Most recently, Abbas requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to help purchase a diverse array of new decorative items and flowers. Abbas wants to create an impressive flower display in front of his store to attract more clients. Abbas has been a microcredit client of Al Majmoua Al Majmoua for the past five years and has always repaid his loans in full and on schedule.

loans.use: To purchase artificial flowers

loans.name: Najeeb Allah

texts.en:
Najeeb Allah is married. He is educated. He worked in a government place in Afghanistan, but after 15 years working, he decided to open a retail shop. He has been working for more than 5 years and still he is making progress, but he has always wanted to expand this business. He was unable to do that until he found AFSG in Kabul and applied for a loan.

Therefore, he wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghanis with a term of 12 months to complete his retail stock and enlarge his shop to become strong in his business to support his family better in the future.

Najeeb is happy with this loan that helps him in this business. He is sure that he can further his business with more success. Finally, he would like to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To complete his retail stock and enlarge his shop

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is 59 years old and lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon. He owns a mini market selling basic household needs, such as kitchen supplies, which also delivers Nargileh and coffee to neighborhood clients. Nargileh is a traditional and popular Lebanese water-pipe which is used to smoke flavored tobacco. It is the custom in Lebanon to pass free time by sitting with friends and relatives on the sidewalks of businesses and homes sipping dark Turkish coffee and smoking Nargileh. Thus, Muhammad is always busy distributing Nargileh and coffee, refilling his patron's coals and cups throughout the day and night. Muhammad has requested a loan of $700 to purchase a new stock of products for his market of more Nargileh items in order to meet the increasing demand of his clients. Muhammad has been an Al Majmoua micro-credit for five years, and has always made his payments on schedule.

loans.use: Muhammad would like to buy new grocery stock, more Nargileh, and related accessories.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad B. is 37 years old and lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the south of Lebanon. He is a kind man who nearly everyone in the village trusts and works with daily. Ahmad owns a mini market in town where he sells household items such as food and cleaning supplies. Ahmad wishes to increase the variety of products he sell so he can respond to his client's needs. He has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of $1000. This is the fourth time that Ahmad will be taking a micro-loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a diverse new stock of items

loans.name: Koffivi

texts.fr: Koffivi A. est revendeur de pneus à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 35 ans, Koffivi est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il exerce cette activité depuis bientôt 2 ans. Il souhaite par ce crédit faire d’avantage de stocks de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. Ce faisant il augmentera ses ventes et ses gains qui lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffivi A. is a tire reseller in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Koffivi, age 35, is married and the father of 3 children. He's been running this business for almost two years. With this loan, he wishes to bolster his stock to better meet customers' needs. In doing so, he will increase his sales, and the profits will enable him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for resale

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène A. est revendeuse depuis plus de 5 ans, des habits et prêts-à-porter, à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 42 ans, Philomène est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont trois sont toujours sur les bancs de l’école. Elle exerce cette activité depuis  3 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenu. C’est ainsi qu’elle souhaite améliorer la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup plus de marchandises, ce qui augmentera ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Philomène A. has been a retailer for over five years selling outfits and ready-to-wear clothing, in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Philomène is 42 years old, married, and the mother of four children, three of whom are still in school. For three years now, she has been in this business, which remains her principal source of income. This is why she would like to expand her business by buying much more merchandise, which will increase her sales and therefore her profits in order to meet the needs of her children better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy outfits, ready-to-wear clothing, and 'pagnes' for retail sale

loans.name: Heanh

texts.en: Mrs. Heanh H., 48, is widowed and sells rice dishes in a parking lot. She sells cooked rice with fried pork and hot dogs for passengers. She has been selling since 2000 and earns around $4 per day. She cares for four children, all of whom attend school. H. works hard every day in her business. She lives in Prek Preahsdach Commune, Battambang Province. One of her children is a garment worker and another is a tailor; their income helps to cover the family's expenses. To grow her business, she needs to cook more rice and also make a variety of food to satisfy customers. Hence, she would like to request a loan of $700 to purchase ingredients such as rice, meat, and hot dogs. For her future plan, H. wants to have her own store in which to run and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her rice dishes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Invest in products such as wigs, hair dryers and other goods for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
I. Saodat first applied for a MicroInvest loan in 2005. She is an active client with the program, and trusts MicroInvest. She has the status of "non-problem" client. She has improved her business thanks to previous loans, and today she has a seasonal selling outlet. Her business stability and business increase helped her repay the previous loans, and to take the business to the next step. 
Mrs. I. Saodat works as chambermaid in a hotel, and works for additional family income. She has many customers, and has a broad assortment of goods. Mrs. I. Saodat is applying for a KIVA loan of 1000 STJ for 4 months, for importing new goods and an increase in business turnover.

loans.use: importing new goods and increasing business turnover.

loans.name: Kholim

texts.en:
K. Kholim was born in 1961 in the Nausky region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 7 children. Mr. K. Kholim has been a client of our program since 2005 when he applied first for a business development loan. 
Business stability helped him repay the previous loans and to take the next step. Mr. Kholim has been trading for 30 years in the national wedding accessories business such as national govra, fiancee trunks, and more. He has a specialized trade outlet in the central bazaar. Mr. K. Kholim is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of 4000 STJ for 5 months to expand his trade outlet and new wood accessories business.

loans.use: trade outlet expansion and new wood accessories business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is married to A. M. and lives in a historical place named Yadgar in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She completed her education in the 10th standard [grade]. She is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her daughter reads at the 9th standard level. Her elder son is in 7th standard. Her younger son is in 2nd standard.

Shahnaz baji's husband runs a small hotel in his community. He is a well-known person, and everybody comes to buy food from his hotel. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and helps her husband with his food business. She successfully repaid her previous three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and a Kiva Field Partner). Now she is applying for a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, lentils, vegetables, rice, and spices).

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the family's food business

loans.name: Komitse

texts.fr: Komitse A. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il habite à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Komitse est un excellent coiffeur depuis plus de 2 ans et tire ses revenus de cette activité. Il désire par ce crédit acheter des tondeuses et aussi aménager son atelier. Komitse souhaite améliorer ses conditions de vie par les revenus qui seront issus de son activité.
texts.en:
Komitse A. is 36 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Komitse has been an excellent barber for over two years and makes his income from this activity. He wants to use this loan to buy hair clippers and also refit his barber shop. Komitse hopes to improve his living conditions through the income from his business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair clippers and refit his barber shop

loans.name: Khafiza

texts.en:
S. Khafiza was born in 1968 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. S. Khafiza first applied for a loan in 2008, and has shown herself to be a serious and reliable client. She started the business practically from scratch but thanks to the previous loan she gained a wider assortment of children's wear.

Mrs. S. Khafiza is also the manager of kindergarten. She also has a livestock business. Now she applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 2600 STJ for 3 months for importing new seasonal wear. In the future she wants to open a specialized trade outlet for selling children's wear.

loans.use: importing new seasonal wear.

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru: Акобирова Зебониссо жительница района Файзабад. 1968 года рождения. Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством и животноводством. Перед зимой ей для хозяйства необходимо запастись комбикормом. Поэтому она планирует получить кредит и закупить сено и жмых. Это поможет ей безпрепятственно откармливать своих животных. Развитие животноводства  поможет сохранить цены на молочные и мясные продукты. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zebonisso A. lives in the Fayzabad region. She was born in 1968. She is married with 5 children. She works in agriculture and animal husbandry and needs to buy forage before the winter comes. Zabonisso plans to obtain a loan for purchasing hay. This would help her feed the cattle. The development of this animal husbandry business would contribute to keeping local meat and dairy prices low. Zebonisso plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase forage

loans.name: Suvanar

texts.ru: Сафарова Суванар проживает в районе  Файзабад. Домохозяйка . Вдова , имеет пяьтерых детей. Занимается животноводством  уже 25 лет. Это дело помогло ей растить детей. Саршие выросли и уехали на заработки в Россию. Но она продолжает  заниматься животноводством. Возможность получить кредит  поможет ей увеличить бизнес. То есть , полученный кредит поможет ей купить овец и коз. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Suvanar S. lives in the Fayzabad region of Tajikistan. She is widowed and has 5 children. For the past 25 years she has been working in animal husbandry, and this business helped her bring up her children. Her older children work in Russia. Savrinisso keeps raising livestock. A loan from Kiva would help her purchase sheep and goats and thereby expand her business. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Зайналова Мохира проживает в районе Файзабад. Работает учителем в средней школе. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живет с родителями , всю семью обеспечивает сама. Кроме работы в школе занимается животноводством. Возможность получить кредит , дает возможность купить еще одного бычка. Увеличив поголовье скота , ее хозяйство будет приносить больше дохода.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohira Z. lives in the Fayzabad region. She works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is divorced and has one child. She lives with her parents and supports the entire family herself. Besides working as a teacher she also does animal husbandry. The opportunity to receive a loan is an opportunity for her to buy another calf. By increasing the head count of her cattle her business will bring her more income. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Moriya

texts.ru: Кодирова Мория жительница Файзабадского района. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Домохозяйка, занимается разведением домашнего скота. Дело приносит доход , но она хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем возможного кредита.  Развитие бизнеса поможет ей увеличить доход, а так же расширить дело. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Moriya Q. lives in the Faizabad region. She is married and has six children. She is a housewife who also breeds cattle at home. This business brings in good income, but she wants to increase the headcount of cattle by getting a loan. By developing her business she will increase her profits and also expand her business. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
B. Munira is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married and has 2 adorable children. Eight years ago, Munira decided to start her own business. She was working in a garment factory near her home and knew a lot about sewing designs of the national carpet. So with some savings, she opened a small seamstress shop in her house, which helps her husband support the family. In time, she gained customers and a good reputation for her work. Her elder daughter also helps her with the business. Munira’s children are all studying at school, and next year her daughter is planning to enter University. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business.

Munira is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) that she plans to invest in buying new, modern designs. She commits to paying back the loan in 12 months. Help this family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Munira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for your generosity.

loans.use: Purchase new, modern designs for sewing the national carpet

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: Véronique K. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché de Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle espère par ce crédit accroître la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mils, d’arachides et de haricots. Les profits issus de son commerce lui permettront de miuex subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Véronique K. is 45 years old, married, and a mother of five. She sells grains at the big market in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She hopes to use this loan to increase the size of her business by buying bags of corn, millet, peanuts, and beans. The profits from her business will allow her to better provide for her children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, millet, peanuts, and beans

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru: Ризоева Зайнаб живет в районе Файзабад. Замужем , имеет четверых красивых детей. Сама работает в средней школе кишлака. Кроме этого занимается животноводством. Хочет получитьь кредит и купить молодого теленка. Откормив его она сможет выгодно продать. Это принесет ей доход. Кроме того позволит увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев
texts.en:
Zaynab R. lives in the Faizabad region. She is married and has four beautiful children. She works in a secondary school in the village. Besides this job she also does animal husbandry. She wants to receive a loan to buy a young calf. By feeding him for a while she can later resell it for more. This will bring her good profit and also help increase the headcount of her cattle. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
K. Zaynura is 39 years old, married, and has two children, a boy and a girl. She feels very happy because she has always had her husband's and her family's support for her own shop. For 4 years, she has been selling clothes for children.

Zaynura has a unique ability to analyze a merchandise market and find her niche. This helped her start her business and make it successful. She is requesting a loan of $600, which she will repay in 8 months. Zaynura plans to purchase new men's shirts to expand the range of clothes she sells, so she can meet the demands of her loyal clientele. With your help this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchase new shirts for men to sell

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra M. is a woman with many strengths. She has a business selling clothing, which she has managed to expand. She is also very proud of being a grandmother; she already has a grandson who is her responsibility. She is dedicated to caring for him at all times. It is for this reason that she works everyday. She wants to support her young daughter as her daughter cares for her small son.

Zuhra has worked in her business for 14 long years. She used to acquire clothes sporadically, but at very high prices. For this reason she came to Dushanbe; she wanted to receive loans so she could acquire merchandise in bulk to then market and sell it. She has received 6 loans, all repaid on time and in the correct manner. These loans have been used to buy stock and to improve the quality of life for her, her daughter and her grandson.

Now Zuhra is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1025 USD) for the term of 7 months. She wants to increase the selection of her autumn clothing she has for sale. You could become an important part in Zuhra's life. She deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving her.

loans.use: To purchase children’s clothing in order to increase the selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Махкамова Назира проживает в районе Файзобод. Возраст 32 года. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на рынке в центре района. Торгует детской обувью и одеждой. Для ввоза сезонной одежды решила получить кредит , сроком на  15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazira M. lives in the Faizobod district. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. Nazira works in retail and manages a stall at the regional market where she sells children shoes and clothes. For the upcoming winter season she wants to take out a loan to purchase more clothes wholesale. She is planning to repay the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes wholesale

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
M. Dilorom is 44 years old. She is married and the loving mother of 4 children. 

Dilorom is a woman who likes to fight for her dreams. One of her dreams is to see her children go to college and have a better quality of life than she did. This is why Dilorom sells clothing. Little by little, she has assembled a clientele who seeks her out to buy clothing from her. 

However, Dilorom does not have enough merchandise for the cold season to offer to her customers, so she is requesting a loan of 3400 Somoni ($1025 USD), which she is willing to pay in a period of 7 months. With this money, Dilorom will be able to buy clothing for the season to be able to offer it to her customers. With your help. she will be able to succeed with her children.

loans.use: To buy children’s clothing to sell

loans.name: Gulbi

texts.ru: Хикматова Гульби жительница района Файзабад. Работает портнихой у себя на дому. Принимает заказы для пошива национальных платьев. Для того , чтобы улучшить качество продукции ей необходимо купить машинку –оверлог.Для этого она планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.Гульби замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Ее бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.
texts.en:
Gulbi H. lives in the Faizabad region. She is married and has five children. Gulbi works as a seamstress from home and specializes in making national costumes. Her sewing business is currently the only source of income for her family. In order to improve the quality of her work she needs to purchase a new sewing machine. For this purpose Gulbi would like to take out this loan for the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
S. Salomat is married with three children. She lives in Dushanbe with her family. 

Salomat sells fabric in the central city market that is used to make national dresses. She has been in this trade for 6 years and it helped her to earn significant income while also allowing her to tend to her family. Thanks to this business, she has been able to help pay the bills and educate her children. 

Salomat has repaid all of her previous ten loans from IMON without any delinquencies. Now she requests 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for a term of 6 months. She wants to buy additional merchandise in order to increase the range of the goods that she sells. 

Salomat is hoping to use generated profit to help her daughter get a good education at the University. We believe that her enthusiasm, motivation and desire to improve her living standards will lead to prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy new children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.en:
Shahriniso T. is 38 years old. She is married and has four children. Shahriniso’s husband works in the Tajik Aluminium Factory, but his salary does not provide a steady income. For that reason, Shahriniso decided to start her own business selling clothes for children and shirts for men nine years ago. Little by little, she began to be noticed at the market. 

Currently, she has clients that seek her out to buy her merchandise. Still, Shahriniso does not currently have enough merchandise to offer her customers. For this reason, she asks for a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) to be repaid over a period of 6 months. With these funds, Shahriniso will be able to buy more shirts, thus increasing the range of her goods. With your support, she will be able to help her family get ahead financially.

loans.use: To buy new men's shirts to sell

loans.name: Jamilay

texts.ru: Мухиддинова Джамиля жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми. Еи 47 лет, она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Уже 16 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку   на центральном рынке района. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить товар. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и получить прибыль. Кроме того таким образом она сможет привлечь новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Jamilay M. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. She is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. Jamilay has been working in retail for the last 16 years. She manages a market stall at the central market. Jamilay wants to take out this loan in order to purchase more goods wholesale. This will allow her to expand the variety of goods she can offer at her market stall and will improve revenue. This will also help Jamilay to attract new clients. She is planning to pay back the loan in then next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve sales

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
S. Muhiba describes herself as a hard-working, enterprising and happy married mother of two children. Her husband is a laborer. She decided to start a tailoring business to help him with household expenses. She wanted her children to get an education and that wasn't possible on her husband's salary alone. She started by helping a woman who ran a tailoring shop. After she learned the business well, she installed a small shop in her home. During the last 20 years, the business has gone very well and grown.

Now Muhiba is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750). She plans to use the loan to purchase modern materials so she can fulfill her customers' requests for national dresses. Muhiba and her family are very grateful for your support in helping this business grow and move ahead.

loans.use: Purchase new modern materials to sew the national dresses

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
S. Zebiniso is 22 years old. She is living with her parents and two little brothers. She is a well-known seamstress in her community. Five years ago, Zebiniso decided to take advantage of her reputation, and bought a tailoring machine. Since then, she has provided tailoring services. Zebiniso is well-established and has many customers, the majority of whom are young girls who often order national dresses. She constantly has new clients and has seen her business grow.

Zebiniso is requesting a loan of 2500 Somoni ($750) to purchase the new modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses.You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Zebiniso and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchase new modern fabrics for sewing national dresses

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi E. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est revendeur des insecticides et herbicides, une activité prospère étant donné que c’est une zone rurale et la principale source d’activité est l’agriculture. Il espère, avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, faire plus de stocks en marchandises pour satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle sans cesse croissante. L’augmentation des ventes va engendrer un accroissement des profits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi E. is 35 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Danyi, a village located about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He sells insecticides and herbicides – a prosperous business given that this is a rural area with agriculture as its main source of income. With this second loan from Kiva Field Partner FECECAV, Koffi E. wants to increase his stock in order to better meet the needs of his ever-increasing clientele. The growth in sales will generate more profit, thus allowing him to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase herbicides and insecticides to resell

loans.name: Fali

texts.fr: Fali V. est revendeuse de tubercules d’ignames à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis bientôt 3 ans. Agée de 45 ans, Fali est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Pour éviter les ruptures de stocks et mieux satisfaire la clientèle, Fali souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des ignames dans les villages environnants et aussi louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Cette chance lui permettra de mieux gagner sa vie
texts.en:
Fali V. sells yams in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has done this for nearly three years. Fali, aged 45, is married and has four children. To avoid stock shortages and better serve her clientele, Fali wants to use this loan to buy yams in nearby villages and rent a storehouse for the yams. This opportunity will allow her to better earn her living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams to sell and also rent a storehouse

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en: This is Kaday K.. Kaday is 42 years old. Depending on the season, Kaday sells jeans, ground-nuts, beans, palm-oil, etc. Kaday is married to a business man who sells "gari" (food made out of the cassavas plant) and palm-oil.  They have seven children – one is in college, four are in secondary school, one is in primary school and the other is a motor mechanic. This is the first time Kaday is seeking a loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.00.  She will use the proceeds from the loan to buy more ground-nuts, beans and rice to sell in the marketplace. She will use the profits to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: Kaday would like to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim J.. Ibrahim is 27 years of age, married with one child who is in primary school. Ibrahim was born in a village called Doguliya about a mile from Kabala. His wife is a business woman who sells cooked rice. Ibrahim has been in the cattle business for the past 3 years now.

This is the first loan Ibrahim is seeking from SMT. He is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to enable him to buy more cattle. He buys the cattle from Doguliya and other villages surrounding Kabala. The price per cattle varies depending on the size of the cattle. Prices range from Le 70,000.00 to 100,000.00. He then sells cattle in Kabala for prices ranging from Le 80,000 to 110,000.00. Ibrahim's immediate goal is to build a house, manage his resources well, and invest in the education of his children.

loans.use: Ibrahim would like to buy more cattle to resell.

loans.name: Yaya

texts.en:
This is Yaya J.. He was born in Kabala about 38 years ago. Yaya is married to a business woman and the two have four children, all of whom are in primary schools. Yaya deals in cattle and has been in this business for the past 15 years now. He buys the cattle in villages surrounding Kabala, including Dogulia and Bindi. He sells in Kabala and sometimes in Bo and Kenema, both larger cities in southern and eastern Sierra Leone. Prices for cattle in the villages vary depending on the size of the cattle (between Le 70,000 and Le 90,000). He then sells the cattle at prices between Le 80,000.00 and 110,000.00.

Sometimes in his business, Yaya encounters some challenges. Challenges include slow sales, sick or dead cattle and theft. In certain cases, however, Yaya can overcome the challenge of a sick animal by taking it to the veterinarian. Previous loans have helped Yaya a great deal. Yaya was able to buy a motorbike that he uses as transportation to villages where he purchases the cattle. He can also now pay for school fees, food and clothes for his children. He is thankful for SMT, as SMT loans have improved his living condition tremendously.

Furthermore, Kiva loans to Yaya are making him and his family happy because of the financial benefit he receives from such loans. With the increased profits gained through these loans, Yaya says the burden of taking care of his family is reduced.

loans.use: Yaya would like to buy more cattle to sell.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 47 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo Roldan es trabajador independiente y la apoya mucho en su negocio. Nelly se levanta muy temprano a preparar todas sus prendas para luego llevar a venderlas por diferentes lugares de su zona. Junto a su esposo  trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y que en un mañana sean profesionales y hombres de bien.  El objetivo de Nelly  es crecer con su negocio, motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo, para el alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas, además de comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería. Con tu ayuda logrará su objetivo en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly, 47 years old, is a mother of 2 children has worked selling clothing and shoes for quite some time. Her husband Roldan is an independent worker and helps her a lot with her business. Nelly rises very early to prepare her garments to later sell them in different places in her area. Together with her husband they work with much diligence to see their children happy and that in the future they be professional, good men. Nelly's objective is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to rent a location to sell her garments, as well as buying a larger quantity of merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal in very little time.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a location to sell clothing and shoes and increase her merchandise

loans.name: Perla

texts.es: Perla vende comida por las noches desde hace varios años atrás, es una mujer que se considera polifacética del trabajo, ya que por las mañanas también vende fruta ambulatoriamente, cuando no hay fruta vende verduras y así varia en la venta de cualquier otro producto según la necesidad de las personas. Sus negocios le resultan rentables debido a que su casa, está ubicada en un lugar muy transitado, sobre todo turístico. Tiene 46 años, es madre 5 hijos que ya son independientes y trabajan. Lo importante para ella es salir adelante y no quedarse atrás, quiere incrementar y ampliar  su negocio de venta de comida, ya que tiene gran acogida debido a su buena sazón y jovialidad. Sin embargo para que siga adelante, estima la cantidad de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Apoya a esta madre que demuestra sus dotes para los negocios.
texts.en:
Perla has been selling food at night for many years. She is a woman that considers herself to be versatile in business since in the mornings she sells fruits in a mobile manner. When there isn't fruit she sells vegetables and this way varies the products to be sold according to the needs of the customers. Her businesses have been profitable due to her house, which is located in a very busy area with many tourists. She is 46 years old and a mother of 5 children that are independent and working. The important thing for her is to continue ahead and not to fall behind; she wants to expand her food selling business since she has a great following due to her flavorful cooking and cheerfulness. Nonetheless, in order to continue ahead she needs a loan in the amount that she is requesting. Support this mother that has shown her business talents.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her food selling business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo tiene 67 años, es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de pescado en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.  Se encuentra sola, quedó viuda, y su único pasatiempo es su negocio, el mismo que la incentiva a seguir adelante.  Trabaja arduamente para ver crecer su negocio, aumentar su sustento económico y tener una vida tranquila.  Consuelo desea la prosperidad de su negocio, quiere comprar otro puesto en el mercado, es por eso que necesita de un capital que hará posible su objetivo.  Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo trabaja para prosperar.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 67 years old and the mother of five children who are now on their own and have their own families. Almost her whole life, she has dedicated herself to the sale of seafood at a stand in her local market. She finds herself alone, having been widowed, and her only pastime is her business which is her incentive to keep going. She works arduously to grow her business, increase her financial status, and live a tranquil life. Consuelo wishes for a prosperous business, and wants to buy another stand at the market. This is the reason she seeks a loan, which will made her objective possible. Let us support this mother who, with talent and effort, works to prosper.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an additional stand at the local market to sell seafood.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 37 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando carreras técnicas, espera que culminen sus estudios y sean útiles a la sociedad, ella se esmera por darles lo necesario para que sigan adelante. Vende comida en un ambiente de su casa, por las mañanas, caldo de gallina y jugos de fruta; y por las tardes, distintos platos al gusto del cliente. Liz es madre soltera, la responsabilidad que tiene de ser padre y madre, logra que demuestre, que para salir adelante, aun estando sola, se puede, sólo dedicarse al máximo a lo que se propone. Ahora quiere construir un kiosco, implementar su negocio de venta de comida y posteriormente tener un restaurante. Para iniciar el camino al cumplimiento de estos objetivos necesita de un capital.  Ayudemos a esta madre, que con amor y esfuerzo hace lo posible por seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Liz, 37 years old, is a mother of 2 children that are studying for technical careers. She hopes that they finish their studies and are useful members of society. She strives to give them all that is necessary for them to get ahead. She sells food in a location in her house, in the morning selling chicken soup and fruit juices and in the afternoon various dishes that her customers request. Liz is a single mother, she has the responsibility of being both mother and father, and to continue ahead, even though see is alone, she has to dedicate herself wholly to everything she does. Currently, she wants to build a kiosk in which to set up her food selling business and in the future she wants to have a restaurant. To start along the path to accomplishing her objectives she needs capital. Help this mother, who with love and effort is doing everything possible to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kiosk in which to setup a food selling business

loans.name: Elza

texts.es: Elza tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de comida y también de diversos objetos y adornos en un ambiente que acondicionó en su casa, se decidió por este negocio a razón de encontrarse ubicada en un lugar muy transitado. También brinda pensión (menú diario) a los trabajadores de una empresa. En la actualidad, su deseo es implementar su mercadería y adornos diversos, para aumentar sus ventas. Su esposo Eugenio la apoya en sus actividades y en las metas que propuestas. Elza muestra su esmero por mejorar, y que todo este esfuerzo es por bienestar del último de sus hijos, ya que los demás son profesionales e independientes. Tiene muchas ganas de surgir y ampliar su negocio,  por el que se muestra entusiasta y con confianza,  para que todo esto lo realice necesariamente requiere de un capital, el mismo que la hará cumplir su objetivo.
texts.en:
Elza is 38 years old and has 4 children. She sells food and a variety of objects and adornments from a space at her home, located at a very busy spot of the town. She also provides a set menu for factory workers. At the moment it is her wish to buy more merchandise and adornments to increase sales. Her husband Eugenio supports her with her activities and to reach her goals. Elza tries very hard to improve and the effort is for the benefit of the youngest of her children, they others are professionals and independent. She wishes her business to grow and improve and she feels very enthusiastic and confident about it. In order to achieve this she needs capital which will be spend on reaching her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business in food sale as well as sale of adornments.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia  se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, a sus 36 años, es madre de tres hijos que estudian y son su motivación diaria para seguir adelante con su negocio, es madre soltera, esto no la imposibilita de prosperar sola, adicionalmente a su tienda, por las tardes vende comida y cuenta con una fiel clientela que degustan de su buena sazón.  El propósito de Patricia es ampliar su negocio (bodega) para llegar a tener más adelante un minimarket y posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de comida, para ello requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita, el cual la ayudará a concretar su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Patricia has been selling groceries for a long time, and at 36 years old, she is the mother of 3 children that go to school and that are her daily motivation to continue forward with her business. She is a single mother, but that does not stop her from prospering on her own. In addition to her store she sells food in the afternoon. She counts on her loyal customers who enjoy the good flavors. Patricia's goal is to expand her grocery store in order to have a minimarket in the future and eventually construct a kiosk for the sale of food. For this she will need the sum of money that she is requesting which will help her to acheive her objective as quickly as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of merchandise in the grocery store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina de 44 años de edad, es madre de 3 tres hijos, los cuales 2 de ellos ya son profesionales e independientes gracias a la educación y buenas costumbres que les impartió, quedando el último de sus hijos a su cargo, quien está estudiando en la universidad. Vive con su esposo Teobaldo que se dedica a trabajar en forma independiente y la apoya mucho. Marina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años atrás, para contribuir con los gastos familiares. Debido al carisma con el que cuenta la cantidad de sus clientes ha ido en aumento, por ellos se ve en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, por lo que requiere de un capital para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo, Marina logrará lo que se propone.
texts.en:
Marina, age 44, is the mother of three children, of which two are professionals and independent thanks to their education and good manners they were taught. The last of the children remains in her care and is studying at the university. She lives with her husband Teobaldo who is self-employed and supports her greatly. Marina has been selling groceries for many years in order to contribute to the family's income. Due to her charisma which so so many of her customers count on, her business has grown. Because of this, she sees a need to increase and equip her business, and this will require capital to achieve this long-time goal. With your help, Marina will achieve what she is proposing.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for grocery store.

loans.name: Mayernith

texts.es: Mayernith tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos estudiantes, su esposo Sixto, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho, y ambos desean salir adelante y brindar a sus hijos lo necesario.
