Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace varios años atrás y por su amabilidad y buena atención cuenta con gran cantidad de clientes, que siempre le mencionan y sugieren las cosas que faltan en su bodega, y ella trata de satisfacerlos, porque como ella nos dice “el cliente tiene la razón”. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de comida, solo lo hace para la hora del almuerzo. Mayernith quiere implementar su negocio, así como también modificar algunas partes de su vivienda, es por eso que requiere de un préstamo para realizar estos objetivos.
texts.en:
Mayernith is 38 years old and a mother of 3 school aged children. Her husband Sixto is an independent worker, supports her a lot and both desire to get ahead and provide their children with everything they need. She has worked selling groceries for several years and thanks to her friendliness and customer service she has a large number of customers that always suggest the products that her store lack. She tries to satisfy these request because, as she says, the customer is always right. She also works selling food, which she does at lunchtime. Mayernith wants to expand her business, as well as improve various parts of her house, and for this reason she needs a loan to fulfill these objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La venta de bebidas y dar una buena atención es la rutina diaria de María, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en un  lugar apropiado, muy transitado, de la Laguna de Yarinacocha, se siente feliz de estar en ese lugar, ya que al ser una zona turística, concurre mucha gente de varios lugares.  A sus 41 años es madre de 3 hijos, quienes están estudiando carreras profesionales, su esposo Ángel se dedica a trabajar con madera, la apoya en todo, ya que fue él quién la incentivó a realizar esta actividad.  Para María lo más importante es seguir creciendo en su negocio y más adelante mandar hacer algunas modificaciones y ampliar a su local, para la realización de su meta, requiere de una cantidad de dinero, que solicita en calidad de préstamo.
texts.en:
Selling beverages and good customer service is Maria's daily routine. Her business is located in an appropriate place, very busy, of Laguna de Yarinacocha. She is happy to be in this location, since being a tourist zone, many people from different areas pass by. At 41 years old she is a mother of 3 children that are studying for professional careers. Her husband Ángel is a woodworker and supports her in everything, since it was he who motivated her to start her business. For María the most important thing is continuing to growth her business and later making some modifications to her location. In order to fulfill her goals, she needs capital and is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the number of beverages that she sells as well as improving her store

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia, madre abnegada para sus hijos y gran compañera para su esposo, se dedica a las labores de su casa, es madre de 3 hijos que estudian y son su razón de ser. Patricia pertenece al banco comunal las “Las Triunfadoras de las Palmeras”, en  el distrito de Yarinacocha, gracias al apoyo de su IMF está logrando poco a poco sus objetivos.  Sin embargo, la educación de sus hijos es más importante, desea apoyarlos hasta verlos profesionales. Patricia necesita de un préstamo para invertirlo en el gasto educacional de sus hijos, en el  arreglo del motocarro de su pareja Leon, así como también mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Apoyemos a esta madre que lucha duro por sacar adelante a su familia, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Patricia is a self-sacrificing mother for her children and a loving spouse. She works in the home, is the mother of three school-age children and they are her reason for being. Patricia belongs to the village bank "Las Triunfadoras de las Palmeras" in the district of Yarinacocha and thanks to the help of her microfinance institution is achieving her goals little by litt.e Without a doubt, the education of her kids is the most important of those goals and she would like to help them all become professionals. Patricia needs this loan to invest in her children's education, the repair of her husband Leon's car, and also to help make home repairs. Help this mother work hard to improve the lives of her family members and she will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational costs for her children.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 49 años es madre de 6 hijos, de los cuales 3 de ellos ya se independizaron, quedando los 3 menores que están en el colegio.  Desde hace varios años, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, diariamente le pide a Dios que sus hijos sean felices y sobre todo, hombres de bien. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Francisco quien trabaja como maestro albañil.  Carmen tiene un propósito, que es poner su tienda de ropa de primera, sobre todo de buena calidad, ya que cuenta con una gran gama de clientes dentro y fuera de su zona, para ello le es necesario un capital para cumplir su objetivo. Con tu ayuda harás posible que se cumpla en muy corto tiempo el objetivo de Carmen.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old and a mother of 6 children of whom three are school-aged and still live at home and three are already living independently. For a few years, Carmen has worked selling used clothes and prays daily that God will make sure that her children are happy, and above all, good people. Carmen counts on the support of her husband Francisco who works as a master carpenter. Carmen's goal is to stock her store with high quality products since she already has a large base of clients that know her (both within and outside of her city) and it is for this reason that she needs more capital. Your help will allow Carmen to meet her goals in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of higher quality clothing for sale in a small store.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Su ardua labor en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, la realiza por sus cuatro hijos, a los mismos que quiere apoyarlos en sus estudios, actualmente están cursando la primaria y la secundaria. Melita, es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio hace mucho tiempos atrás, gracias a su buena atención y sobre todo buena administración ha ido de mejora en mejora. Junto a su esposo Pedro, quien trabaja como maderero, se propusieron seguir adelante por su familia, por eso Melita decidió implementar su negocio, ella necesita de un capital para lograr su objetivo, cantidad que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Melita works hard in the sale of groceries and other basic products for the benefit of her four children, who she wants to support in their studies where they are currently in primary and secondary school. Melita is a women that fights hard to get ahead. She began her business many years ago and thanks to careful attention and good administration has improved things little by little. Together with her husband Pedro, who works in the lumber business, she is working to improve her family's well being. With this in mind, Melita decided to implement her business and she needs a little more capital to achieve this objective in the form of a loan. With your help, this mother will get ahead in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria, a sus 49 años es madre D. 6 hijos, que ya son independientes, trabajan y siempre la apoyan, ella se siente muy contenta D. tener unos hijos tan colaboradores, auque no pudieron estudiar una carrera profesional, son hombres muy trabajadores, y eso es lo más importante para Maria. Ella se dedica a la venta D. postres (queques, piononos, acaramelados, etc.), que lleva a vender por diferentes lugares y cuenta con una extensa clientela. Ahora necesita adquirir varios pedidos D. sus clientes, por lo que solicita este préstamo, ya que quiere cumplir con todos, además D. adquirir un kiosco para la venta D. sus postres y dejar D. hacerlo D. manera ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Maria, aged 49, is the mother of six children. Her children are all already independent; they all work and always support her. Maria is very happy to have such cooperative children, and while they weren’t able to study to become professionals, they are very hard working, which is very important to Maria. She sells desserts (cakes, swiss rolls, toffee-coated cakes, etc.) in different locations and enjoys an extensive clientele. Now in order to meet the many orders placed by her clients, she is asking for a loan. Furthermore, she hopes to acquire a kiosk to sell her desserts in one location, as opposed to continuing to be a street vendor.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more desserts to sell, as well as to build a kiosk

loans.name: Corépa 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous les femmes du Gie Corépa 2 de l'écovillage Palmarin (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) remercient Kiva de leur avoir fait confiance. Cependant, elles reviennent auprès de Kiva solliciter un renouvellement de prêt d'un montant de 700 000 F qui leur permettra de continuer leurs activités de teinture. Avec le prêt, elles vont acheter beaucoup de  tissus pour agrandir leur stock, du matériel pour la teinture. Avec ces tissus, elles vont coudre des habits qui seront mis en vente dans les établissements touristes de l'écovillage et ensuite exportés vers la capitale "Dakar" pour une plus rapide liquidation du produit.
texts.en:
The women of the Corépa 2 Group in Palmarin ecovillage (http://www.sem-fund.org/palmarinfr.php) would like to thank Kiva for having faith in them. They are, however, calling on Kiva again to request a new loan of 700,000 F ($1,500) to allow them to keep their dyeing businesses going. With this loan, they will buy dyeing materials and lots of fabric to increase their stock. They will use this fabric to make clothes that will be sold in tourist outlets in the ecovillage and also sent off to Dakar, the capital of Senegal, for a fast sale.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics to dye and sell

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es: Emerita tiene 61 años, se dedica a la venta de bebidas (cervezas y gaseosas), es madre de 7 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes y la incentivan a seguir adelante.  Para Emerita lo más importante es seguir adelante, ya que su negocio de una u otra forma la hace sentir una persona útil. Ella siempre se ha identificado como una mujer activa, por lo que se dedicaba a la venta de distintos productos desde muy joven, ahora se siente muy feliz al tener un negocio propio.  Para que éste surja como ella espera, le hace falta de capital, dinero que se invertirá en la implementación de su negocio y sobre todo, en la ampliación del mismo. Con su apoyo, Emerita  podrá concretar su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Emerita is 61 years old and works selling beverages (beer and soda). She is the mother of 7 children, all of whom are independent and are an incentive for her to keep moving forward. For Emerita the most important thing is to keep moving forward, and her business is a way that she can feel like a useful person. She has always thought of herself as an active person which is why she has sold various products since she was very young. Now she feels happy to have her own business. For this to end up as she hopes, she needs capital, money which she will invest in the development of her business and, above all, expansion of the business. With your support, Emerita will be able to put her plans into action in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and development of her business selling soda and beer

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: A. Kodjo est né le 05/09/1955 à Atakpamé et vit actuellement avec sa femme ménagère et leurs sept 07 enfants dans le quartier Gbadago à Lomé. C'est un commercant de matériaux de construction qui ne dispose plus de moyens financiers pour continuer ses activités. Dans le souci de relancer son commerce et satisfaire un grand nombre de clients, il sollicite ce crédit pour faire des commandes importantes et réaliser de bénéfices importants qui lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. Kodjo was born on September 5, 1955 in Atakpamé and currently lives with his wife and their seven children in the Gbadago neighborhood of Lomé. He is a building material tradesman but no longer has the financial means to continue his business. In the hope of relaunching his business and satisfying a large number of customers, he is requesting this loan so he can place some large orders and make a good profit. This will enable him to provide for his family’s needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell building materials

loans.name: Victor Balissam

texts.fr: Né en 1980 à Lomé, Victor Balissam B. est un célibataire sans enfant demeurant quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Revendeur de sandwichs, il sollicite ce crédit pour ouvrir un cafétéria sous forme de restaurant. Pour se faire il doit acheter un refrigirateur, cuisinière, gaz etc. Ce financement lui permettra  d'amélioer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Lomé, Victor Balissam B. is single with no children and lives in the Hédzranawoé area of Lomé. He sells sandwiches and seeks this loan to open a cafeteria in the style of a restaurant. In order to do this, he needs to buy a refrigerator, a stove, gas, etc. This loan will allow him to enhance his income.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a cafeteria

loans.name: El-Pidio Komla

texts.fr:
Mr  D. E. El-Pidio Komla  est un jeune célibataire sans emploi né à Lomé le  18 Décembre 1984. Après ses études universitaires, il exerça comme stagiaire dans une société
de commerce de la place pour une période limitée et après il se retrouve au chômage. Cette situation l’a obligé à se lancer dans de petits commerces tels que la vente de manuels scolaires usagers et d’articles divers au bord des rues. Ce petit commerce lui a permit d’avoir une clientèle conséquente et en même temps une hausse de la demande.
	
Pour répondre aux besoins de ses clients, il sollicite un financement pour ouvrir une petite librairie et constituer un stock important en manuels scolaires neufs et usagers et en divers fournitures et articles scolaires. Ce financement lui permettra de relever ses revenus et son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Mr. El-Pidio Komla D. E. was born in Lomé on December 18, 1984 and is a young single man without a steady job. This has forced him into small local trades such as selling used school textbooks and miscellaneous items by the side of the road. This local trade has brought him a lot of customers as well as created an increase in demand. To meet the needs of his customers, he is requesting financing to open a small bookstore and stock up on new and used textbooks and various school supplies. This financing will enable him to increase his income and raise his standard of living.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio inició el negocio, ya que había oportunidad de crecer económicamente en este giro y tener que generar buenos ingresos para mantener a su familia. Comenzó su negocio hace 10 años con una camioneta vieja, vendiendo frutas y verduras en pocas colonias, después fue progresando y cambio de camioneta, poco a poco fue progresando y ahora tienen un local donde establecer su negocio sin dejar de visitar las colonias.

El necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local donde se va a poner de fijo con empleada seguir en su camioneta.
texts.en:
Ignacio started this business because it was a good opportunity to grow financially and to improve his family´s living standards. He started 10 years ago, selling fruits and vegetables out of an old truck to customers in surrounding areas. Slowly, he was able to purchase a better vehicle and secure a location where he could still sell his products and visit his customers. He needs a loan in the amount of US$500, which will be paid back within 6 months, to remodel his business location, hire a permanent employee and continue driving to his clients' neighborhoods.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel business location

loans.name: Jose Manuel Roberto

texts.es:
José Manuel hace diez años es ganadero, inició su negocio ante la falta de capital para seguir con el ganado fue entonces que lo invitaron a asociarse en una carnicería hace 2 años y el acepto, pero ahora como le ha ido bien desea independizarse y establecer su propio negocio.

El necesita un préstamo por US $825 que pagara en 6 meses para acondicionar el local donde se independizara y comprar una sierra para cortar carne. Con tu apoyo lograra su meta.
texts.en:
Jose Manuel was involved with cattle raising for 10 years. Later, he decided to try another way of business since the income generated with cattle raising was not enough. That led him to accept an invitation, 2 years ago, to join a friend at a butcher shop. Nowadays, however, he has seen that the butcher shop has done well and decided to go on his own by establishing a shop for himself. He needs US $825 that will be paid back in 6 months. It will be used to provide a cooling system for the shop and to purchase an electric knife to chop up the meat.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cooling system and an electric knife.

loans.name: Dulce Lorena

texts.es:
Dulce inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, comenzó hace cinco años ayudando a su papa en la carnicería y posteriormente su padre se la dejo para continuar ella el negocio y sea ayudara para la manutención de su niña, ya que su esposo trabaja como obrero y ellos deseaban darle mejor calidad de vida a su pequeña de 5 años.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mas surtido su negocio. Con tu apoyo Dulce seguirá progresando.
texts.en:
Dulce started her business to help her husband with the living expenses. Five years ago, she started helping her father at the butcher shop. Later, he deiced that it was better for her to be in charge of the shop so she could support her 5-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker and both of them want to provide a better quality of life to her. She needs a loan in the amount of US $350, which will be paid back within 6 months, to purchase merchandise and help her business succeed. With your support she will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Guadaluoe

texts.es:
María inició el negocio para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos, ya que se había divorciado, y necesitaba tener ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus hijos que en ese entonces eran pequeños. Comenzó su negocio al verse sin dinero y sin apoyo por parte de su ex-marido, se vio en la necesidad de buscar la forma de tener ingresos económicos para ella y sus 3 hijos, por lo que su madre tenia un terreno a las orillas de carretera y decidió construir un local y hacer regaderas para los tráileres que pasan buscando bañarse, que comer y descansar un rato, y desde hace 12 años se a dedicado al negocio para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos los cuales cuentan en edades 12, 15 y 18 años, y que actualmente la apoyan en el negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $675 que pagara en 6 meses para y realizar algunas mejoras al negocio.
texts.en:
María founded her business to be able to take care of her three children, seeing she was divorced from her husband and needed income to support her children who were then quite young. She started her business after finding herself without any money or support from her ex-husband. María realized she needed to find some form of income for herself and her three children. Her mother owned a plot of land near the highway, so María decided to create a small business with showers for the truck drivers who need to take a shower, find something to eat and rest. She has run this business for the last 12 years to support her three children -- ages 12, 15, and 18 -- who now help her out with the business. María needs a loan of US $675, which she will pay back in six months, to make improvements to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina inició el negocio para ayudar a la economía familiar, siempre ha apoyado a su marido que es albañil, pintor, de todo un poco, y hace 8 años empezó a hacer aseos a casas, y desde hace 6 se dedica a la venta por catalogo con una amplia gama de artículos, como colchas, zapatos, ropa, vajillas y cosméticos y gracias a esto ha logrado progresar y ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar un carrito- exhibidor para llevar sus productos y poderlos mostrar a sus clientas y tianguis. Con tu apoyo Cristina saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Cristina started the business to help the family’s financial situation. She has always supported her husband, who is in construction, painting, and a little of everything. Eight years ago, she started cleaning houses. For 6 years now she has sold a wide variety of items, such as bedspreads, shoes, clothing, crockery, and cosmetics, by catalog. She has managed to make progress and offer her two children a better quality of life.

She needs a loan of $500.00 USD, to be repaid in six months, to buy a little display cart to transport her products and showcase them to her customers and at outdoor markets.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a small display cart.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase a lot of products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Marcela's Group
loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Proposito Group

texts.en: "Mujeres con Proposito" is a group of 15 women looking to receive their first loans. All members of this group are living in extreme poverty, and decided to try and do something about it. This loan they receive is going to go towards starting their own small businesses which they hope to grow. Romona is the chosen group representative, and she was chosen by this group because they felt she was ready for this role, and is a person of great diligence and leadership. She is the mother of four children, and sees this as a chance to provide for those children. She plans on opening a small clothing store and someday dreams of having a large store and her own vehicle. On behalf of Romona, the group, and Esperanza International------ Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: These women would like to improve their families' lives by starting their own small businesses.

loans.name: Centrobank Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Centrobank esta ubicado en el centro de Huancavelica, se encuentra muy cerca del parque Santa Ana, el malecón Santa Rosa y el Río Ichu. Sus actividades con comerciales, agricultura y ganadería.

Angela H., tiene 1 hijo pequeño a quien a tenido muy joven, desde hace 3 meses vende chalinas, gorros, guantes, pues tiene que mantener a su hijo, solicita un préstamo para incrementar material para su negocio,. Angela sueña con ser profesional y tener una tiendecita.

Roheni Galli, es conviviente tiene un bebe de 3 meses, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos en la puerta de su casa, a veces vende dulces, al quedar embarazada sus padres la votaron de su casas, desde ese entonces aprendió lo que es trabajar, con su préstamo quiere comprar una parrilla para vender sus anticuchos.

Elvia Z., es casada, tiene 2 hijos, se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, con los prestamos que ha recibido ha ido incrementando su negocio, ahora vende chalinas, gorras y quiere comprar mas mercadería para poder tener mas ingresos y ahorrar.
texts.en:
The communal bank Centrobank is located in the center of Huancavelica, very close to Santa Ana Park, the Santa Rosa promenade, and the Ichu River. Their activities are as merchants, farmers, and raising livestock.

Angela H. has a small son, who she had when she was very young. For three months she has been selling shawls, caps and gloves, as she must support her son. She seeks a loan to increase the inventory for her business. She dreams of being a professional and having a little store.

Roheni Galli lives is partnered and has a 3-month old baby. She dedicates herself to the sale of anticuchos (beef kabobs), and sometimes sells candy. When she became pregnant, her parents threw her out of their house and since then she has learned what it is to work. With her loan, she would like to buy a grill to use in selling her anticuchos.

Elvia Z. is married and has two children. She dedicates herself to raising cuyes (guinea pigs). With previous loans, she has grown her business. Now, she sells shawls and caps and would like to buy more merchandise to increase her income and be able to save.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The communal bank Centrobank needs 6,000.00 new soles so that its 13 members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Bokk Diom Group

texts.fr:
Thiaroye sur mer est une commune où sévit encore la pauvreté. La population est très volontaire et lutte par tous ses moyens pour sortir de cette situation peut enviable dû à l’inflation et au sous emploi. C’est dans ce contexte que le groupement Bokk Diom s'est levé pour prendre en charge son sort et travailler pour l’amélioration durement. L’opportunité que nous offre  Kiva est à ne pas rater car répondant parfaitement avec ce que nous cherchons, le groupement Bokk Diom compte saisir cette opportunité et travailler de façon saine. L’objectif de  ce prêt s’inscrit dans le désir des membres de lutter de façon résolu contre la pauvreté dans la localité et de promouvoir ses membres au plan socio économique. 
Bokk  Diom compte faire du commerce divers allant du commerce de tissus aux produits céréaliers aux légumes, aux poissons frais, aux fruits, aux détergeants et la couture.
Chaque membre développe une activité qu’elle compte améliorer et renforcer.
texts.en:
Thiaroye-sur-Mer is a city where poverty still rages. The population there is very voluntary and fight with every available means to get out of this unenviable situation caused by inflation and underemployment. It is in this context that the Bokk Diom group formed itself, aiming at working to durably improve things. The opportunity that's being offered by Kiva should not be missed, because it corresponds perfectly to what the group is seeking. The Bokk Diom group intends to take this opportunity and work soundly. The aim of this loan comes within the scope of the group members' desire to resolutely fight poverty within the city, and to promote their social and economic status. Bokk Diom intends to run various businesses, selling products ranging from fabrics to cereals and vegetables, fresh fish, fruits, detergents, and sewing. Each member has her own business that she plans to bolster and strengthen.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fabrics, cereals, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Por La Paz Group

texts.en: "Mujeres Unidas por la Paz" ("Women United for Peace) is a group made up of 10 women looking to receive their first loans. All members want to start their own small business and start generating income. All members come from a very poor area in Puerta Plata, Domincan Republic. Geraldina is the chosen group representative and is excited about the task she faces. She says she like to take leadership roles, and her group was glad to make her the representative. She is a hardworking mother of three children, and wants to start her own business for the sake of her children. She plans on selling clothing in her area, and hopes to expand it over time with new loans. She dreams of having her own thriving business and being able to provide a good life for her loved ones. This whole group is ready to change their future! On behalf of Geraldina, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International-------- We thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: These women would like to create and improve their own businesses to improve their families' lives.

loans.name: Benjamin Mario

texts.es: EL SEÑOR BENJAMIN ES INGENIERO DE UNA EMPRESA MUY SÓLIDA; ES UNA PERSONA MUY TRABAJADORA, DESDE MUY CHICO SUPO DE RESPONSABILIDADES Y AHORA A SU FAMILIA LE QUIERE BRINDAR UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA, POR LO TANTO SOLICITA ESTE CREDITO CON LA FINALIDAD DE REPARAR SU TECHO YA QUE CON TANTA LLUVIA SE HA IDO DETERIORANDO.
texts.en:
Benjamin is an engineer at a very solid enterprise. He is a hard-working person who, from a young age, has known about having responsibilities and now he wants to provide a better quality of life for his family. For this reason, he is seeking this loan with the aim of making roof repairs as a great quantity of rain has caused it to become deteriorated.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make roof repairs.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA GEORGINA TRABAJA PARA UN BANCO COMO PROMOTORA, ELLA ES MADRE SOLTERA DE 3 HIJOS Y LUCHA POR DARLES UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONOMICA, POR LO TANTO ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA AMPLIACION DE SU VIVIENDA Y ASI TENER MAYOR COMODIDAD PARA ELLA Y SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Georgina works for a bank as a promoter. She is a single mother of three children and struggles to provide them with some economic stability. For this reason, Georgina is requesting a loan to expand her home and provide a more comforable space for her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of an additional room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling underwear.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo T. est détentrice d’un bar à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agée de 51 ans, Adzo est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Sa bonne gérance lui a permis de réaliser de bons chiffres d’affaires au cours de l’année précédente. Elle désire avec ce second crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en passant des commandes de casiers de boissons afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Adzo T. keeps bar in Danyi, a town situated approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. 51-years-old, Adzo is married and the mother of six children. Over the course of the last year, her good management enabled her to earn a decent profit. To better meet customer demand, with her second loan Adzo wishes to expand her business by ordering drinks by the case.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail beverage manager

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock a small grocery store

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Anani K. est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est revendeurs d’appareils portables et accessoires à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. L’utilisation d’appareils haute gamme étant devenu la mode, la clientèle devient de plus en plus exigeante. Pour répondre à tous ces besoins, Anani souhaite acheter des appareils ainsi que leurs accessoires. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Anani K. is 45 years old, married and the father of four children. He sells cell phones and accessories in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Now that top-of-the-range phones are so popular, customers are becoming increasingly demanding. In order to meet all the demand, Anani would like to purchase cell phones as well as their accessories. He is counting on this opportunity to help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cell phones and their accessories for resale

loans.name: Wakilou

texts.fr: Wakilou T. est âgé propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 32 ans, wakilou est marié et père de 2 enfants. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans et demeure sa principale source de revenus. Pour accroître son commerce, Wakilou désire alimenter sa boutique. Les gains qui seront issus de son activité lui permettront de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Wakilou T. is the owner of a grocery store in Danyi, a village located about 175 m from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Wakilou is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He has been in commerce for three years, and it remains his principal source of income. To grow his business, he would like to put money into his store. The profits derived from his business will enable him to meet the needs of his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for reselling

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: These women would like to create and improve their small businesses to provide better lives for their families.

loans.name: Niño Lachocc Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Niño Lachocc esta ubicado en L. Comunidad D. Yananco en el distrito D. Huancavelica, departamento del mismo nombre. Rodeado D. árboles porque el cementerio al lado D. Seminario mayor, el Río Ichu, un bello paisaje. L. actividad principal D. L. comunidad es L. agricultura, L. ganadería y el comercio.

Maximiliana C., es casada, tiene 4 hijos, se inició vendiendo lana D. oveja a Huancatex, después vendió kerosene con un pequeño capital que logro ahorrar. L. mayor dificultad que tuvo fue superar L. separación D. su esposo. En su bancomunal aprendió a compartir y a tener familiaridad con las socias, adquirió experiencia al recibir las capacitaciones. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado desea incrementar sus productos D. Omnilife que venD. ahora paralelamente con L. venta D. kerosene.

Dina R., es casada, tiene 3 hijos, empezó vendiendo lencería en las ferias, como tiene hijos pequeños no pueD. vender todo los días, aprovecha las campañas escolares, naviD.ñas y otras. Sus prestamos les permiten invertir en su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos. El sueño D. Dina es darle lo mejor a sus hijos, tener una tienda y ser mayorista.

Francisca R., tiene 2 hijos, inició su negocio con L. venta D. ropa, viajaba a Lima a traer mercadería para vender en las ferias dominicales, vendía casaca y productos D. belleza. Con el préstamo voy a estar mejor porque podré invertir en mi negocio y tendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The "Niño Lachocc" Community Bank is located in the Yananco region, in Huancavelica district and state. The bank is surrounded by the trees of the cemetery next to the seminary, the Ichu River and a beautiful landscape. The region's main economic activities are agriculture, ranching and traD.. Maximiliana C. is married and has four children. She started out selling sheep's wool to Huancatex. Later she sold kerosene using a little money she had saved. Her greatest challenge was getting over the separation with her husband. In her community bank she leanred how to share and be familiar with the partners. She acquired experience through training. Maximiliana would like to use the requested loan to increase the Omnilife products she now sells along with kerosene. Dina R. is married and has three children. She began selling lingerie at fairs. Seeing she has small children, Dina isn't able to make sales every day. She takes advantage of school, Christmas and other holidays. Her loans allow her to invest in her business and generate greater revenue. Dina's dream is to proviD. the best to her children, open a shop, and be a wholesaler. Francisca R. has two children. She started her business with clothes sales. She traveled to Lima to bring back merchandise to sell at the Sunday fairs. She sold jackets and beauty products. She will be better off with the loan because she will be able to invest in her business and will earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in 10 partners' businesses

loans.name: Arissou

texts.fr: Arissou T. est âgé 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. Il réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Arissou est revendeur de CD audio et vidéo. Il souhaite avec ce crédit alimenter sa boutique en achetant des cartons de CD et aussi des lecteurs afin de satisfaire les demandes de la clientèle. Les profits que généreront ses vents lui permettront de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Arissou T., age 30, is married and the father of one child. He lives in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Arissou sells audio and video CDs. With this loan, he wishes to bolster the stock of his shop by purchasing boxes of CDs, as well as CD players, in order to better meet customer demand. The profit he will make out of his sales will enable him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of CDs as well as CD players

loans.name: Mamah

texts.fr: Mamah A. est exerce l’activité de boucherie à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 35 ans, Mamah est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il souhaite avec ce crédit, le deuxième de FECECAV, acheter des bœufs, des boucs, des béliers pour l’abattage et aussi disposer d’un troupeau de moutons
texts.en:
Mamah A. is a butcher in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Mamah, age 35, is married and the father of 4 children. With this loan, the second with FECECAV, he wishes to buy beefs, goats, and sheep for slaughter, and also to have a sheep flock to maintain.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beefs, goats, and sheep for slaughter, and also to have a sheep flock to maintain

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr: Mensah A. est âgé de 32 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est un acheteur des produits café cacao auprès des cultivateurs et les revend aux exportateurs internationaux. Il exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Etant donné que les fournisseurs exigent des règlements au comptant, Mensah espère par ce crédit satisfaire leurs exigences et tirer profits puisque les ventes seront augmenées conséquence de l’augmentation des achats.
texts.en:
Mensah A. is 32 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He is a buyer of coffee and cocoa products from growers, and he resells them to international exporters. He has been doing this work for three years in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Given that the suppliers are demanding payment in cash, Mensah hopes to use this loan to meet their demands and to derive a profit, since sales will increase due to the increase in purchases.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of coffee and cocoa for resale

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
La Sra. Raquel tiene ya más de 10 años con su negocio de publicidad por las callas de Nuevo Laredo esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene una hija que está estudiando la universidad en la carrera de ciencias en la comunicación (Conductora de radio o televisión y periodismo).

Al negocio de la Sra. Raquel le está haciendo falta un nuevo equipo de publicidad más moderno y que tenga más potencia de sonido.

Para así poder anunciar mejor los productos de sus clientes que solicitan del perifoneo por las colonias.

Raquel a tenido ya un crédito con Fvp el cual lo pago puntualmente ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $500.00 por medio de Kiva para comprar un equipo de sonido nuevo.
texts.en:
Raquel has more than 10 years experience at her publicity business. The business is her family's sole source of income, seeing Raquel is a single mother and has a daughter who is studying at university in communications (radio or television broadcasting and journalism). Raquel's business needs a new, modern megaphone speaker system with more amplification power. Raquel has had one loan with FVP, which she paid back on time. She is requesting a loan of US $500 from Kiva to purchase new sound equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new megaphone speaker system

loans.name: Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculo Group

texts.en: "Mujeres Rompiendo Obstaculos" ("Women Beating Obstacles") is a group of 14 women and 1 man. All members are excited about receiving their first loan, and are ready to start changing their lives and futures. This first loan they are requesting is around $150 US for each person and they plan to start businesses ranging from clothing stores to small restaurants. Germania is the chosen representative of this group, and she was chosen due to her hard-work ethic and diligence. She has been single for 22 years now, and has three children she has to take care of. She wants to start her own business to take care of her kids and loved ones more than for herself. She says she is excited about this opportunity and ready to take this step, and so is the rest of the group! On behalf of Germania, the group, and Esperanza International------ Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: This group of people want to create and improve their small businesses to provide better lives for their families.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan inició su negocio por herencia familiar, ya que todos han sido agricultores, ante el deseo de tener ingresos para mantener a su familia y preservar las tierras de sus padres fue que siendo muy joven y siguiendo los pasos de sus padres quien le enseño el amor a la tierra que lo vio nacer, el ha continuado con ahincó, sembrando la tierra y con sus frutos manteniendo dignamente a su familia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $175 que pagara en 1 mes para comprar herbicidas que le permitan fumigar sus cosechas. Con tu apoyo Juan seguirá adelante.
texts.en:
Juan got started out in his business through family inheritance, seeing he comes from a family of farmers. Wanting to earn an income to support his family and keep his parents' land in the family, Juan decided at a young age to follow in the footsteps of his family, who taught him appreciation for the land. He eagerly has continued planting his crops and, with his fruits, providing a decent life for his family. Juan needs a US $175 loan -- which he will pay back in one month -- to buy herbicides that will allow him to fumigate his crops. With your help, Juan will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of herbicides

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio inició el negocio ante su apremiante necesidad económica lo llevo a emplearse de alarife ya que requería de ingresos para mantener a su familia. Comenzó siendo ayudante de su de su primo hace aproximadamente 8 años, después decidió independizarse y empezó a realizar trabajos de mantenimiento residencial de manera personal y le resulto, con apoyo de los microcréditos que ha solicitado y liquidado tiene su negocio propio que le permite mantener dignamente a su familia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material de trabajo, con tu apoyo el seguirá progresando
texts.en:
Sergio started his business because he urgently needed income. This led him to find work as a bricklayer, seeing he needed income to take care of his family. He started out working as an assistant for his cousin about 8 years ago. Later he decided to go independent and began to take on his own residential maintenance jobs. This worked out well. Because of the support of the micro-loans he has requested and paid back in the past, Sergio now has his own business, which allows him to provide a decent life for his family. Sergio needs a loan of US $425 -- which he will pay back in 6 months -- to purchase work materials. With your support he will be able to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of work materials

loans.name: Yolanda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yolanda inició el negocio porque la liquidaron en la empresa en donde trabajaba, necesitaba tener ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos ya adquiridos. Comenzó su negocio hace poco más de un año, con la liquidación de su anterior trabajo, compro un carro y se puso a trabajar como taxista.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para pagar las placas ya que actualmente se las rentan, y la frecuencia de la base en donde tiene trabajando el taxi y así poder ser propietaria de todo. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Yolanda started her business because she was laid off in the company where she was working and needed to have income to cover her commitments. She began her business a little over a year ago; with the settlement money from her previous work, she bought a car and went to work as a taxi driver.

She needs a loan of US$425 that she will pay in 6 months. With this loan she will pay for the licenses that right now she is renting, and for the base frequency where the taxi has been working, and in this way she will be able to be the owner of everything. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her taxi licenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home repairs and improvements.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Doña Estela tiene 37 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Reconciliación, casada y con una hija de 13 años de edad, que esta estudiando la secundaria, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como responsable de bodega, el negocio de la Sra. Estela es la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace seis años  inicio con dinero propio que le ayudaba su esposo, lo cual hasta ahora le ha ido bien en las ventas pues ya tiene su clientela pero desea tener mas productos para crecer mas, con la solicitud del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción y construir un cuarto para estar mas cómoda con su familia ya que su casa es pequeña. A largo plazo es incrementar las ventas y captar más clientela  y ayudar a su hija con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Estela is 37 years old and lives in a neighborhood in the capital city of Managua called Villa Reconciliación. She is married and has one daughter who is 13 years old and studying in secondary school. Her husband works for a business as a store manager. Estela’s business involves the sale of clothing and cosmetics, an enterprise she started six years ago with her own savings. Until now, things have gone well with regard to sales given she now has a steady customer base. However, she would like to expand her inventory so she can grow the business further. With this request for a loan she would like to buy construction materials to build another room in their small house so the family could live more comfortably. Her long-term goals include increasing her sales and capturing more customers, as well as to help her daughter complete her education.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a new room for her house.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.es:
Edgardo tiene una hijo de de 5 años; quien actualmente se encuentra hospitalizado debido a que padece de leucemia. El inició el negocio para seguir estudiando y sacar adelante a su hijo, el cual constantemente requiere hospitalización, medicina y cuidado, debido a que es papa soltero no tenia quien le ayudara a cuidarlo, decidió emprender un negocio, que le permitiera cuidar a su hijo y fue esa la causa de que empezara a trabajar, consiguió una carreta y empezó a elaborar y vender hot- dogs y tortas trabajando primero solo los fines de semana y después e empezó a instalar todos los días afuera de las maquiladoras y gasolineras.

El necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para poder remodelar la carreta ya que ocupa pintura además de que cuenta con muy poco mobiliario y muchos de sus clientes batallan cuando están comiendo, así que con este prestamos podrá adquirir nuevas mesas acompañadas de sus sillas y podrá brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Edgardo has a 5 year-old son who is presently hospitalized as he has leukemia. Edgardo started his business in order to continue his studies and give his son a good start in life as he constantly needs hospitalization, medicine, and care. As a single father he had nobody to help him take care of his son so he decided to start a business that would allow him to look after him and that was the reason he began to work, got a wagon and started to make and sell hot-dogs and sandwiches, at first on week-ends and afterwards daily in front of assembly plants and gas stations.

Edgardo needs a loan of $425 to be repaid in 6 months to remodel the wagon, as it needs paint and has very few furnishings, making it difficult for clients to eat, but with the loan he will buy new tables and chairs thus being able to offer more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodel wagon used for business.

loans.name: Celia Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Celia habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Villa Reconciliación, tiene 45 años de edad y su esposo es agente policial, le tiene tres hijos de 9,21 y 23 años de edad, dos de ellos estudian y el mayor trabaja. Doña Celia tiene una pulpería con cinco años de experiencias,  su negocio lo inicio con liquidación de su trabajo anterior pues trabajaba en la alcaldía de Managua, todo su capital lo invertio en la venta lo cual fue bueno ya que tiene algo propio negocio  de subsistir las ventas son buena y a veces pocas los repartidores de productos abecés le  dejan la mercadería al crédito para el día siguiente, que es cuando no tiene todo el capital para pagar al momento, con este negocio  también puede ver por su familia, estando en la casa. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de insumos diarios y productos variados para ofertar a sus clientes. A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda. Y dar estudios a sus hijos
texts.en:
Celia lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in the capital city of Managua. She is 45 years old, and her husband is a police agent. They have three children ages 9, 21 and 23. Two of her kids are still in school, while the oldest is now working. Celia has five years of experience running her grocery store, a business she started after losing her previous job at the Managua mayor’s office. All her capital was invested into the sale, which was good since now she has something of her own for support. Sales are good, and sometimes the persons who deliver her products let her have the merchandise on credit for the next day but she doesn’t have the capital at this time to pay. With this business, she can also see to caring for her family. Her request for this loan is to invest in her enterprise, buying a variety of daily use products to offer to her customers. Her long-term aim is to make improvements to the family’s home and provide an education for her children.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need products to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Esfuerzate Y Sed Valiente Group

texts.en: "Esfuerzate y Sed Valiente" is a group of 10 women coming from an extremely poor area. All the women in this group have to fight to get through each day. That is why they came together as a group and are seeking a loan to try and better their lives. They all want to take this loan and start their very own small business, and start generating income. They know this is the first step to bettering their situation. Elsa G. is the representative of this group of 10, and is excited at the chance to lead all her friends into a better life. She is a very hardworking mother and wants nothing more than to better the lives of her children. She plans on starting a small business making and selling food in her area. She hopes to one day expand and have her own restaurant, and make enough money to provide her children with a comfortable life. She and the rest of the group are ready to take the first step to a better life! On behalf of Elsa, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: These women would like to create and improve their small businesses in order to provide a better life for their families.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en: Eliana N. C. lives with her husband and four children (aged, 14, 9, 4, 6 months) in Ayacucho. She is part of the community bank, LLamkasum, "let's work together" in Quechua. Every two weeks Eliana travels to the rainforest to purchase cooca beans, coffee and peanuts; she spends 2 weeks in the selva and then returns to sell the products for 4 days. She plans to invest her loan of 1050 soles into her business by paying rent, purchasing more goods and paying for bus tickets to and from the rainforest. With her savings, she hopes that her business will continue to grow; she'd like to buy a computer and be able to help with her children's education, so they will become professionals.

loans.use: Eliana would like to purchasing more goods and paying for bus tickets to and from the rainforest.

loans.name: Kely

texts.es: Kely A. M. is 21 years old and is in the community bank, Llamkasum, which means “let’s work together” in Quechua. For the last 10 years, with help from her family, she has working in a car spare parts store. She will invest her loan of 2,100 soles into her business and her education. She is currently attending Universidad Alas Peruanas in Ayacucho. She has been studying for 2 years and will finish her Hospitality degree in 3 years. Her goal is to continue and complete her education at the University and open her own business which would include a hotel and restaurant.
texts.en:
Kely A. M. is 21 years old and is in the community bank, Llamkasum, which means "let's work together" in Quechua. For the last 10 years, with help from her family, she has working in a car spare parts store. She will invest her loan of 2,100 soles into her business and her education. She is currently attending Universidad Alas Peruanas in Ayacucho. She has been studying for 2 years and will finish her Hospitality degree in 3 years. Her goal is to continue and complete her education at the University and open her own business which would include a hotel and restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest her loan of 2,100 soles into her business and her education

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotros somos el Grupo EMANUEL estamos ubicados en el Barrio Los Arcos de la ciudad de Danli, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos, somos muy unidos como si fueramos familiares.
el grupo se conforma de esta manera:)
Juan Elias G.; soy el coordinador de mi grupo, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajeros (Taxi No.81) cuento con muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad. soy casado tengo una hija la que esta cursando primaria, gracias a los ingresos que recibo del taxi puedo cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito comprar unos repuestos para arreglar mi vehiculo ya que es mi unica fuente de trabajo.  
Norma Iris C.: ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, actividad que realiza hace 3 años, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella puede contribuir a los gastos del hogar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dos de ellos estan estudiando, uno esta en secundaria y el otro esta en la universidad. 
Karla Suyapa T.: ella se dedica a la venta de chicharrones y chicharras las que distribuye en el mercado municipal, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 2 y el otro de 4 años de edad,  
actualmente todos necesitamos una inversion en nuestras fuentes de trabajo es por tal razon que estamos solicitando un credito para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios y por consiguiente mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the EMANUEL Group, located in the Los Arcos neighborhood in the city of Danli. We know each other very well, and have always worked together. We are very united, as if we were related.

The group is comprised as follows:

Juan Elias G.. I am the coordinator of my group. My principal activity is passenger transportation (Taxi #81), and I have many years of experience with this type of occupation. I am married, and have a daughter in primary school. Thanks to the income which I receive from my taxi service, I can support my family’s household expenses. Currently, I need to buy some parts to repair my vehicle given that it is my only means of work.

Norma Iris C.: she is a merchant who dedicates herself to selling common household goods. She has a small grocery store which is located in her house. This is an activity which she has conducted for three years, and which provides the income to pay for her family’s living expenses. She has three children, two of whom are still in school – one in secondary school and one at the university.

Karla Suyapa T.: She is dedicated to the sale of chicharrones and chicharras (pork rinds) which she sells at the municipal market. She is married and has two children ages two and four.

Currently, we all need an infusion of capital to invest in our enterprises. This is the reason we are soliciting a loan, so we can get ahead with our expenses and concurrently improve our standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for vehicle repairs and products to supply grocery store.

loans.name: Erlinda Juana

texts.en: Erlinda Juana A. Huamán lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their two children, aged 13 and 4. She is a member of the community bank, LLamkasum, which means "let's work together" in Quechua, the local language. You will be able to find Erlinda cooking at her house and selling food. With the help of her 13 year old daughter, she cooks everyday and sells to her customers. She will invest her loan of 1050 soles in her business by paying the rent on her house, purchasing pork, chicken, bread, corn and oil. She is currently saving to buy her own land, help her children with their education and eventually, she would like to buy a moto taxi for additional income.

loans.use: Erlinda will purchase pork, chicken, bread, corn and oil to make food to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Paulette

texts.en: Lidia D. L. Crúz V. is a member of FINCA Perú's community bank, AnabelL.. She lives and works in Aacucho with her husband and two sons, aged 23 & 13. Her eldest son lives in Lima and is studying musical acoustics. Not only is Lydia an independent distributor of DeBelle cosmetics, she also prepares food for weekly and biweekly events including baptisms and weddings. She will invest her loan of 1000 soles into her business by purchasing more cosmetics to use as samples, bread, pork, corn, oil, and other foods she needs to prepare for the events she caters. She is currently saving to educate her children and to continue increasing her business. With the hard work she does in both of her businesses, her true dream is to continue moving forward and "sentir realizado," feel fulfilled, and have a sense of security instead of having to rely on her husband.

loans.use: Lidia would like to purchase more cosmetics to sell, and the ingredients she needs to prepare food for the events she caters.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela R. V. is a member of the community bank, Anabella. She lives in Ayacucho, Peru, with her two children (aged 21 and 20). Both of her children are studying at the local university, while her husband lives in Spain. She is an independent distributor of DeBelle cosmetics. Carmela also helps her friend, Lydia, when she has catering events.

Carmela will invest her loan of 1000 soles into her cosmetics business by purchasing nail polish, blush, eye-liners, lipsticks and lotions, so she will always have fresh samples to sell to her clients. With her savings, she would like to keep moving forward and be able to be her own woman, without the need to rely on her husband. She also has been saving to help her children stay in school and finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase nail polish, blush, eye-liners, lipsticks and lotions for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia T. Gómez is 36 years old and lives in Ayacucho with her husband and 5 year old son. Aurelia is a member of community bank, Musuq Rumi. She travels two times a month, by 10-hour bus ride, to Lima to gather goods for her grocery business. Her loan of 1000 soles will be invested into her business to purchase sodas, crackers, chocolates and corn. The savings she is currently accumulating will be used for the purchase of her own home, to send her son to school and in case of a medical or health emergency in the family. Aurelia dreams of having a larger store and of having her son be successful.

loans.use: To purchase sodas, crackers, chocolates and corn for her grocery business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.en:
Alejandrina H. D. F. is a member of community bank, Musuq Rumi. She lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their three children. Her youngest son is currently studying engineering systems at the local university.

Currently, Alejandrina is running a business insiD. an office building where she sells coffee and breakfast to the people who work in the office. She plans to invest her loan of 1000 soles into her business by purchasing chocolates, sodas, juices, sugar, eggs and salt. She dreams of moving from Ayacucho and investing in more stores. She is saving to help her children with their education and for other necessities for her home.

loans.use: To purchase chocolates, sodas, juices, sugar, eggs and salt for her store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia F. R. is a member of community bank, El Roble, which means "oak tree." She lives in Ayacucho with her partner and three children, 21, 17 & 15. She sells and sews clothing including traditional slips worn under women's skirts. She also sells cheese at the local fairs on Sundays. She will invest her loan of $1500 into the purchase of thread, materials, lace, needles and cheese. She is saving to purchase a laptop and dreams of being able to send her children to school to become professionals.

loans.use: Eugenia would like to purchase thread, materials, lace and needles for her sewing business.

loans.name: Carmen Susana

texts.en: Carmen Susana H. G. lives with her husband and their two children in Ayacucho. Carmen is a member of the community bank, El Roble. She has her own store in Ayacucho where she sells groceries and has eight computers with internet. She will invest her loan of 1250 soles into her business by purchasing another computer, milk, oil, candies and sugar. With her savings, she plans to buy a motorized car to make additional income.

loans.use: To purchase another computer, milk, oil, candies and sugar for her store

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.

Beatriz es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Beatriz tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en el barrio tradicional de Santa Ana, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, chupetes que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, Además Beatriz vende comida típica los días sábados y domingos, También Beatriz trabaja como ayudante en una chicharronería, durante su ausencia su mama e hijo atienden en su tienda.

Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz y azúcar. Los sueños de Beatriz son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una buena casa, mejorar su local y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Anabella community bank.

Beatriz is a single mother, she is 48 years old and she has 2 children. Beatriz runs a convenience store from her home located in the Tradicional region of Santa Ana. There, she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, and home-made candy. She runs this business with the help of her mother. Beatriz also sells traditional foods on Saturdays and Sundays. Beatriz also works as a helper in a food store, and in her absence, her mother and son manage the store.

Beatriz requires a loan in the amount of 1500 soles. The funds will be invested into the purchase of milk, rice and sugar. The dreams that Beatriz holds is to see her children as professionals, to have a good home, and to improve her store and expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beatriz requires a loan amounting to 1500 soles to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Es socia del Banco Comunal El Roble.

Juana es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 1 hija vive con ella, Juana vive en la ciudad de Palmapampa en la selva ayacuchana, Juana tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende ropa variada, para grandes y pequeños, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho y a veces en la ciudad de Lima dependiendo del capital que tenga. Además Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de cacao y lo vende en el mismo lugar.

Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, polos, camisas. Los sueños de Juana son tener capital propio, una tienda amplia, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the community bank El Roble. Juana is married and is 48 years old. She has 5 children, of whom 1 live with her. Juana lives in the city of Palmapampa, in the jungle. Juana has a store in her home where she sells various clothing, for big and little people. She gets her products in the city of Ayachucho, and sometimes in the city of Lima, depending on the capital that she has. Also, Juana and her husband work in growing cacao and she sells it in the same place. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of pants, polo shirts, and blouses. Juana’s dreams are to have her own capital, a big store, and to educate her children so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will invest in the purchase of pants, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia Es socia del Banco Comunal Alegría Huamanga. Eugenia es madre soltera, tiene 59 años y 1 hijo, Eugenia es jubilada de la universidad, Eugenia tiene un consultorio de parasicología en donde brinda servicios de oraciones, curaciones, lectura de cartas, Eugenia es vidente, su consultorio esta ubicado cerca del centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Eugenia también vende productos naturales por catálogos sus ventas son al contado y en algunas oportunidades al crédito.

Eugenia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas naturales y reparación de su casa. Los sueños de Eugenia son tener un local propio, curar a las personas necesitadas y tener un molino.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the communal bank “Alegría Huamanga”.

Eugenia is the 59-year old single mother of one son, and retired from the university. Eugenia has a parapsychology office where she provides services such as orations, healing treatments, and card readings. Eugenia is clairvoyant, and her office is located in the center of the city of Ayacucho. Eugenia also sells natural products by catalog. Her sales are in cash and, at times, on credit.

Eugenia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles to invest into the purchase of natural remedies and home repairs.

Eugenia’s dreams include being able to have her own location, to cure those persons who are ailing, and also to have a mill/grinder.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eugenia needs a loan of 3,000.00 soles to invest in the purchase of natural remedies and for home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casada y con dos hijos de 16 y 20 años de edad, el de 16 está estudiando la secundaria y el de 20 años trabaja y estudia para ayudar a sus padres, su esposo es cadete de taxi. Las ventas de doña Maria son cosméticos y también es costurera desde hace nueve años, inició sólo con la costura pues tiene bastantes clientes ya que su trabajo es bien fino, pero debido a la poca costura que a veces tiene, por que no todos los meses son bueno,  se vió en la necesidad de vender cosméticos ya que son productos que las mujeres usan a diario, pues vende al crédito y al contado. Con la solicitud que está haciendo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos Zermat y comprar juegos de joyas Romannel, así como telas para sus costura. A largo plazo es comprar otra máquina de costura marca Overlok para mejorar las costuras así como seguir invirtiendo en cosméticos, también desea poder brindarle estudios a su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is married with two children, 16 and 20 years old. One is studying in high school, and the 20 year old works and studies, and as well helps his parents. Her husband is a taxi driver. Maria sells cosmetics, and she has been a seamstress for nine years. She started her business only with sewing work and has a good clientele because her work is very detailed. But because at times she has little sewing work, not all months are good. Because of this she saw the need to sell cosmetics, since they are products that women use every day. She sells on credit and with cash, and many times the products are ordered, so it has not been a difficult task to have clientele because part of her clients are from her sewing business. The loan request she is making is to be used to invest in the business, in the purchase of Zermat products and Romanel sets in order to offer and sell more, as well as for fabric for the sewing business. A goal over the long term is to buy other overlock sewing machines to improve her sewing and as well to continue investing in cosmetics, and to be able to provide schooling to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar Zermat cosmetics and Romanel clothing

loans.name: Luisa Veronica

texts.es:
La Sra. Luisa,  habita en un barrio  que se llama Pantasma, tiene 25 años de edad, con un hijo de 7 años  y es madre soltera, pues le ha tocado trabajar para sacar a delante a su hijo, lo tiene estudiando la primaria en el instituto del barrio lo cual desea que sea un niño de buenas costumbre ya que también su mama le ayuda a vérselo.   Sus ventas son tortillas y cafetín ambulante lo hace desde hace cinco años, pues inicio con ayuda y dinero que le presto su mama para que se ayudara a iniciar en el comercio y así pudiera ayudarse con su hijo. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar productos para el negocio y también, quiere vender comida y así poder captar más clientes.
A largo plazo es mejorar la infraestructura de donde trabaja, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y ayudar a su hijo en la educación.
texts.en:
Luisa lives in a neighborhood called Pantasma. She is 25 years old and has a 7 year old son. She is a single mother so she has had to work to bring up her son. He is studying in primary school at the local school, and she wants him to be a well behaved boy and his mother helps him to see good manners. She sells tortillas and coffee around the area and she has been doing this for 5 years. She started with the help and money that her mother lent her so that she could start the business and help her son. She would like a loan to buy products for the business as well, she wants to sell food to attract more clients. In the long term she wants to improve the infrastructure where she works to bring a better service to her clients and to help her son's education.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy maize, and products to sell food/compra de Maiz, y productos para vender comida

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es una mujer emprendedora que ha sacado adelante a sus 5 hijos, inició el negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos debido que el padre los abandonos por que no podía encontrar trabajo. Ella comenzó el negocio hace 5 años vendiendo tacos de canasta y a través del tiempo logro poner un negocio sobre la carretera que poco a poco ha hecho crecer y ha logrado salir adelante.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $425 que pagara en 6 meses para dar mantenimiento eléctrico a su negocio por que el local que adquirió requiere mantenimiento. Con tu apoyo Ella continuara con su negocio.
texts.en:
Concepcion is a very enterprising woman who has brought up her 5 kids. She started her business as she needed to support her kids as their Dad abandoned them as he couldn't find a job. She started selling tacos 5 years ago and as time has gone on she has been able to put her business on the main road which has meant that it has grown and she has moved forward.

She needs a loan of $425 which she will repay over a period of 6 months which will supply electricity to her business as the store she has needed maintenance work. With your help she will continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for her store/dar mantenimineto a su local

loans.name: Maria Ysabel

texts.en: María Ysabel R. Cebrían is a member of the community bank, Llamkasum, which means "let's work together" in Quechua, the local language. María lives in Ayacucho with her husband and two children, 14 & 13 years old. With help from her children and her husband, María runs her own grocery store. With her loan of 1050 soles, María will invest in her store by purchasing wines, toys, milk, sugar and other groceries. With the savings she accumulates she hopes to open her own mini market (she is currently renting the space for her store) and to continue growing her current store.

loans.use: María will invest in her store by purchasing wines, toys, milk, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María C. Huamán is a member of community bank, Anabella at FINCA Perú. She sells groceries at fairs and on the street 3 times a day.

She plans to invest her loan of 1000 soles into purchasing corn, drinks, sugar, ham and noodles. She plans to continue saving and use earnings to help educate her son and to continue improving her grocery business.
texts.en:
María C. Huamán is a member of community bank, Anabella at FINCA Perú. She sells groceries at fairs and on the street 3 times a day.

She plans to invest her loan of 1000 soles into purchasing corn, drinks, sugar, ham and noodles. She plans to continue saving and use earnings to help educate her son and to continue improving her grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She plans to invest her loan of 1000 soles into purchasing corn, drinks, sugar, ham and noodles.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.en: María Raquel L. is a member of community bank, Anabella, at FINCA Perú. In addition to being an accountant, María also runs her own small grocery store where she works everyday. She plans to invest her loan of 1500 soles into her business to purchase corn, beer and sugar. She is currently saving to purchase Christmas presents, continue increasing her capital and to fill up her store. Her goal is to be able to help her children get an education.

loans.use: Maria plans to purchase corn, beer and sugar.

loans.name: Sheila Mariela

texts.es:
Sheila Mariela Auccapuclla V. is 21 years old, has a 2 year old daughter and is a member of the community bank, Anabella. Her mother, also a member of FINCA Perú, introduced her to the opportunity of microfinance two years ago. She is currently studying Political Sciences and Human Rights at the local University: Universidad Alas Peruanas. She has 2 more years of practicum and will complete her degree within 2 years. She also sells clothes by order.

She plans to invest her loan of 2500 soles into her education as well as to purchase more shirts, skirts, pants and jeans to sell. She is currently saving so she can finish up her studies, and dreams of opening her own grocery store.
texts.en: Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She plans to invest her loan of 2500 soles into her education as well as to purchase more shirts, skirts, pants and jeans to sell.

loans.name: Martha Yolanda

texts.es:
Martha inició el negocio por la falta de trabajo y por que nadie le ayudaba con los gastos de sus hijos y de la casa, ya que se encuentra separada de su marido, por lo cual decidio invertir algo de dinero en una tienda de abarrotes que poco a poco ha hecho progresar y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar vitrinas y estantes para exhibir su mercancia. Con tu ayuda ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Martha started her business because she was out of work and because nobody was helping her with the expenses from her children and household as she is now separated from her husband. For this reason, she decided to invest some money in a grocery shop that, little by little, has progressed and has allowed her to get her family ahead.

She needs a loan of $500 that she will repay in 6 months to buy glass cases and shelves to show her merchandise. With your help she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Glass Cases and Shelves

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA EVANGELINA ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO EN EDAD DE KINDER Y LA OTRA PEQUEÑITA DE MESES, ELLA TRABAJA EN UN NEGOCIO EN EL AREA DE VENTAS; ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRARLE A SU H IJO LOS UTILES ESCOLARES Y ASI LOGRANDO QUE TENGA UN MEJOR DESEMPEÑO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina is a single mother of two children. One of them is a preschooler and the other is just a few months old. She works a business os sales. She is asking for this loan to buy her children school supplies so that he may have a better chance of succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her son

loans.name: Nilda
