Later, with the money that her husband gave her, she bought raw materials and started to make her own merchandise, which she did using a rented machine. She is very grateful to ADIM as 3 years ago they financed the purchase of a sewing machine and she now uses it to make typical clothing which she sells in the Masaya county market. She lives with her husband and 2 children; her kids go to school and her husband does agricultural tasks. She dreams of having a big workshop with 3 sewing machines and one of her own, as her products are very much in demand.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: Comenzó vendiendo frutas en el mercado de Masaya  con su mamá, en la actualidad ella ya tiene su negocio propio, debido a que esta actividad se ejerce solo por la mañana; ella buscó otra alternativa para ofertar por la tarde como es la venta de elotes y yoltamales, los cuales ella elabora y oferta en su comarca. Manifiesta que los créditos de adim le han ayudado mucho por que tiene capital para trabajar. Se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora, es madre de 3 niños, los que asisten al colegio de primaria. Con mucho esfuerzo logró construir un cuarto cerca de la casa de su mamá. Su mayor ilusión es de construir su propia casa para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
She started selling fruit in the Masaya market with her Mum and now she has her own business. As she only does this during the mornings she looked for another activity to do in the afternoons, like selling sweetcorn on the cob and 'yoltamales' (a sweetcorn dish made with milk that is cooked then solidified), which she makes and sells in her region. She states that the credits she has received from ADIM have helped her a lot as she now has capital to work. She is a very industrious woman, she has 3 kids who are in primary school. It was with a lot of effort that she managed to build a room near the house for her mother. Her dream is to build her own house to have better living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Esta clienta tiene mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de costura, tiene 5 años en este negocio, comenzó solo con  una maquina de coser y una ayudante, debido a que tiene un mercado grande que abastecer, su marido la apoyó  con la  compra  de una maquina.  En la actualidad tiene 3 maquinas y 2 trabajadoras,  las que elaboran vestidos de niña y trajes de dama. Con los créditos y con las capacitaciones de adim logra administrar bien su negocio, lo que la hace sentirse realizada como mujer y microempresaria Vive con su esposo y dos niños que asisten al colegio de primaria, tiene casa propia y su mayor ilusión es poder remodelar su casa de habitación y separar el taller.
texts.en:
This client has a lot of sewing experience. She has had her business for 5 years and she started with only one sewing machine and an assistant. As she had a large market to supply for, her husband supported her by buying a sewing machine. Now she has 3 machines and 2 staff who make girl's dresses and women's clothing. With the credit and training from ADIM she managed to administrate her business which makes her feel that she has proved herself as a woman and microentrepreneur. She lives with her husband and 2 kids who are in primary school. She has her own home and her dream is to remodel the house and separate the workshop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo

loans.name: Georgina Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Georgina inició su negocio con venta de refresco, pan y café, ha recibido capacitaciones en desarrollo empresarial y créditos de adim, lo que le ha permitido administrar bien el negocio  incrementando el inventario; en la actualidad cuenta con una pulpería siendo una de las más grandes del barrio. Georgina manifiesta que para progresar es necesario ahorrar, así se puede tener un nuevo crédito y progresar. En la próxima navidad quiere aprovechar las oportunidades ampliando su oferta con nuevos productos. Uno de sus mayores deseos es poder ampliar y mejorar su casa, para tal propósito pretende utilizar las ganancias del préstamo, esta ahorrando para que al final de año invertir en su casa
texts.en:
Georgina started her business selling refreshments, bread and coffee.She has received training in business development and administration which has helped her administrate her business, building her inventory; currently, she has one of the largest grocery stores in the neighborhood. Georgina says that to progress one needs to save and that's how one can obtain another credit and progress. Next Christmas she'd like to take advantage of opportunities by expanding her offerings to include new products. One of her greatest desires is to expand and improve her house. To this end, she hopes to use the income generated from the use of the loan. She is saving money now in order to invest it in house renovations at the end of the year.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Nidia Del Rosario

texts.es: Esta señora aprendió costura desde hace 15 años en un taller de la vecindad, luego cuando contrajo nupcias su esposo le ayudó con la compra de una maquina de coser y empezó ha trabajar en su casa elaborando cotonas bordadas y trajes de damas y caballeros, los que comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, por su alta calidad en la costura tiene buena demanda de sus productos, para poder abastecer a su clientela compró otra máquina y contrató una ayudante. Su marido trabaja en una panadería, el le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Ella tiene 3 hijos, los que asisten a la escuela, también tiene su casa propia y piensa realizarle algunas mejoras para esta navidad.
texts.en:
This lady learned to sew fifteen years ago in a neighbourhood workshop: later when she married her husband helped her to purchase a sewing machine and she began to work in her house making embroidered smocks and women and men's outfits, which she sells in the Masaya market. Due to the high quality of her sewing, there is a high demand for her products, so in order to supply all her customers she bought another machine and hired an assistant. Her husband works in a bakery and helps with the household expenses. She has three children, who all attend school, she also owns her own house and is thinking of making some improvements to it for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Doña Maria comenzó el destace de cerdo y lo hacia una vez a la semana, actualmente destaza dos cerdos a la semana y los fines de semana vende nacatamales, ella comercializa en su casa de habitación, su esposo la ayuda para sacar adelante el negocio  en el futuro piensa poner una crianza de cerdos, y para esto cuenta con la ayuda de los créditos de Adim. Tiene 3 hijos, los que asisten a clases y su esposo también trabaja en labores de agricultura, esta familia tiene su propia casa, están ahorrando para comprarse un TV y regalárselos en navidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria began butchering pigs once a week. At present, she butchers two pigs a week, and on the weekends, she sells nacatamales. She markets her products in her home. Her husband helps her to go forward in her business. In the future, she thinks about breeding pigs, and for this, she is counting on loans from Adim. She has 3 children, who are studying, and her husband also works in farm labor. This family has their own house. They are saving to buy a TV and give it to their children for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha H. is 39 years old and lives in Prek Preah Sdach Commune, Battambang Province. She works as a civil servant for the agricultural ministry, while her husband, Mr. Chhaya Rut, 40, is a soldier. Their income combines to approximately US$8 per day. Sokha has three children, all of whom are young students and stay at home, and she is responsible for their children's school fees and the family's expenses. To generate another source income, Sokha needs a loan to grow a vegetable crop to sell, such as green beans, corn, and pumpkin. Hence, she would like to request a loan of US$300 from Kiva to purchase seeds to grow and spend for growing activities. :

Sokha was selected to be a small group leader of three members as following: Mrs. Thy H. is a used cloths seller. She requested a loan of US$100 to purchase more used cloths to sell. Mrs. Ly C. raises pigs. She requested a loan of US$150 to purchase pig foods to fatten her pigs to sell.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses so they can provide a better life for their families.

loans.name: Jazmín De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Esta Señora inició con la venta de calzado, con la ayuda de su esposo comenzó un taller de elaboración de sandalias, las que comercializa en el norte de nuestro país, donde tiene clientela fija que le encarga su producto. Tiene 4 hijos, que al igual que su esposo le ayudan en el taller, actualmente no tiene maquina de zapatería, por esto alquila una, pero su mayor sueño es comprar una maquina para bajar sus costos y poder ofertar un mejor precio. Ella como madre y empresaria se siente realizada, por que tiene su fuente de ingresos. Piensa obtener más créditos para comprar la máquina de coser y remodelar su casa para dejar mas amplio el taller.
texts.en:
This woman began selling shoes. With the help of her husband, she started a sandal-making workshop. She markets her products in the North of the country, where she has fixed clients that order her product. She has 4 children, who, like her husband, help her in the workshop. At present, she doesn’t have a shoemaking machine, so she rents one. Her biggest dream is to buy a machine so that she can lower her costs and can offer a better price. As a mother and businesswomen, she feels fulfilled, because she has her source of income. She thinks about getting more loans to buy a sewing machine and to remodel her house to make the workshop more extensive.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Maria Verónica

texts.es: Esta señora  desde temprana edad se dedica a trabajar en calzado, ella se mantiene al frente del taller y  su esposo se encarga de la comercialización del calzado que oferta en el mercado municipal de Masaya. El taller cuenta con 6 trabajadores a tiempo completo. Tiene dos hijos que asisten a clases, ella a demás de atender el taller atiende los quehaceres de la casa  Ella espera  que adim le pueda otorgar  créditos mayores que le permitan adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima ya que cuenta con mucha clientela. Su mayor sueño es de  mejorar su nivel de vida, remodelar su casa y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
From an early age, this woman worked on shoes. She maintains the front of the workshop, and her husband is in charge of marketing the shoes that are sold in the city market in Masaya. The workshop has 6 full-time workers. She has two children that are studying. In addition to taking care of the workshop, she also takes care of the housework. She hopes that Adim can offer her bigger loans that will allow her to buy more raw materials, since her has many clients. Her biggest dream is to improve her level in life, remodel her house, and give a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Sroan

texts.en: Mrs. Sroan I., 37, is a farmer who grows rice in Kampong Svay Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She grows rice twice a year in the dry season, and her husband, Mr. Team Mei, 42, is a fisherman as well as a construction worker. Sroan has five children, all of whom are single and young. One of them is a construction worker in Phnom Penh City, who also helps to support the family's daily expenses. She always cares about her rice crops because it is the main income in her family. Due to her farmland being infertile, she needs a loan of 500,000 Riel (US$125) to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop to increase yield and the rest to pay for seeds.

loans.use: Sroan would like to purchase fertilizer to use for her rice crop to increase yield.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en: Mrs. Hor C. is married with three children who live in Kampong Svay Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She fishes with her husband in a local lake in her area which supports them with enough fish for her family. C. always wakes up early in the morning to go fish and is back home in the late evening. She sells the fish that she catches in the lake to customers from her house. Because fishing is the main income in the family, C. needs a loan of 600,000 to purchase more fishing tools such as nets and traps for expanding her fish catching.

loans.use: Hor would like to purchase more fishing tools such as nets and traps for expanding fish catching.

loans.name: Mrs. Ry Phon's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank consists of eleven people who all live in Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province and Mrs. Ry P. is the village bank president who was selected by the members. She is a healer who cures patients in the local village. Since she now has a lot of patients, she does not have enough money to purchase more medicine for her patients so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Sout, is a cow breeder who raises three cows. Mrs. Ry P. is 55 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Mrs. Lan Y. does not come to take a loan but her husband is so he is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: These people would like to improve their small businesses, such as by purchasing more medicine to cure patients.

loans.name: Mr. Ey Sam Ort's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people in Da Village in Kampong Chhnang Province form the village bank and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Ey S. O. is the village bank president and he is a fisherman in the local lake. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase more fishnets to catch more fish. His wife, Mrs. Nhil S. Oeurn, is a farmer who owns a hectare to cultivate rice to earn for a living. Mr. Ey S. O. is 46 years old and the father of five childR., one of whom is employed in a garment factory, while the others help their parents' business. Mr. Ey S. O. hopes he can make more income to improve his living condition with this new loan.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: These people would like to improve their small businesses, such as by purchasing more nets to catch more fish.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath P. grows crops including fruits and vegetables to sell in the market in Kantreang Commune, Siem Reap Province. Her husband, Mr. Lep Pong, 64, sells chopped wood by transporting it to customer's homes. Sambath grew the fruit trees and vegetables in her farmland next to their home. She has four children, all of whom are married and left home to live independently. Sambath lives only with her husband so she needs to work hard to generate income to support their living. Her crop yields are the main income in her family, so to increase them, she needs a loan of US$100 to purchase fertilizer to use for her crops to increase their yields.

loans.use: Sambath would like to purchase fertilizer to use for her fruit and vegetable crops to increase their yields.

loans.name: Mrs. Seng Phalla Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng P. is the group leader of four who all live in D. Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a cake seller door-to-door. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients to make the delicious cakes for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Sieng Horn, has a plot of land where he can cultivate rice to earn a living. Mrs. Seng P. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or stuD. because he is three years old.

Two members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Seng would like to buy more ingredients for her bakery and the other entrepreneurs would like to create and improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Mrs. Hou Channa's Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank loan, which is located in Au Da Village in Kampong Cham Province, consists of eight members and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hou C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local schoO.. She owns a small lake where she raises fish. Since she now has a lot of fish, she does not have enough money to buy enough food to feed them so she decided to ask for a loan to deal with this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nak Pheak, is a construction worker who can earn less than $2 a day. Aside from this business, he is a breeder who raises four pigs.

loans.use: Hou would like to buy more food to feed her fish to sell and the rest of the group would like to improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Mrs. Pon Than's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank, which consists of thirty-one members, is located in Au Da Village in Kampong Cham Province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Pon T. is the village bank president and she is a pig and cow breeder. Since the fist business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. PhE. ThE., is a construction foreman who can make little income to support his famiL.. Mrs. T. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to wO. or study because that child is five.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainL. end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: These people would like to create and improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Putu Darmiasih

texts.id: Walaupun hanya sebagai ibu rumah tangga, Darmiasih tetap berkeinginan membantu suami dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Karena hasil suami yang didapat dari bertani tidak mencukupi  biaya sehari hari. Untuk mewujudkan rencananya itu, Darmiasih bergabung dengan program ternak babi yang masa pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Saat ini Darmini hanya memiliki 1 ekor anak babi. Dengan modal  pinjaman yang didapatnya, Darmini berencana membeli 1 ekor induk babi dan pakannya. Darmini merencanakan untuk menjual anak babi yang akan lahir dari induk yang akan dibelinya. Darmini berharap usaha ini akan menunjang biaya hidup dengan 3 orang anak.
texts.en:
Even though she is only a home maker, Darmiasih intends to help her husband is supporting the household, because his daily income is insufficient for their daily need. She intends to get a loan to buy more pigs, currently she only has 1 piglet. Hopefully with this capital, she will be able to buy a pig that will produce her piglets that she can sell in the market. Darmiasih hopes that with this she can support her 3 children.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli induk babi dan pakan

loans.name: Agung Ayu Sumarni

texts.id: Sumarni memiliki 2 orang anak yang masih kecil. Suami Sumarni seorang petani. Sumarni tergabung dalam program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari yang masa pinjamannya selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pada akhir periode. Modal yang di dapat dari Dinari dipakai untuk memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Sumarni memperoleh pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- Modal yang dikeluarkan untuk membeli bibit babi sebesar Rp.600.000,- Untuk membuat kandang menghabiskan Rp. 2.000.000,- dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan selama 5 bulan. Setiap hari setelah selesai mengerjakan pekerjaan rumah, Sumarni segera merawat babinya. Pertama yang dilakukan membersihkan kandangnya setelah itu memandikan baru terakhir memberi makan. Sumarni memberi makan 2 kali setiap pagi dan sore hari. Adapun campuran pakannya : dedak padi, dedak gandum dan konsentrat. Sumarni optimis, dengan bimbingan dokter hewan dari Dinari usahanya akan sukses.
texts.en:
Sumarni has 2 kids, her husband is a farmer. Her husband joined the pig farming program. The capital provided will be use to farm two pigs. From Rp. 5.000.000, Rp.600.000 will be use to buy 2 piglets, Rp. 2.000.000 will be use to make the pig sty, and the remainder will be use to buy pig feedings for the next 5 months. Everyday she will feed her piglets twice a day. She is optimistic that with a guidance of a vet from Dinari Foundation, her effort will bring success.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi, membuat kandang dan membeli pakan

loans.name: Sayu Ketut Meling

texts.id: Sayu Ketut Meling disamping seorang ibu rumah tangga juga memiliki kesibukan memelihara 1 induk babi yang saat ini sedang mengandung. Sayu Ketut Meling tergabung dengan program ternak babi selama 6 bulan dan pembayaran pinjaman pada akhir periode. Modal yang didapat dari DINARI Rp.5.000.000,- dipakai untuk membeli 1 induk lagi dan modal pakan persiapan anak  babinya yang akan lahir. Dengan perawatan dan juga ketelatenannya sekarang babinya sudah hampir melahirkan dan memerlukan pakan yang banyak. Sayu Ketut Meling juga rajin memberikan daun hijau seperti daun pisang sebagai makanan selingan. 1 bulan lagi induk babi ini akan melahirkan. Anak babi yang lahir akan dijual. Biasanya induk babinya melahirkan 8 – 12 ekor anak babi. Sayu  Ketut Meling sudah berhitung, jika induk babinya melahirkan 10 ekor anak. 3 bulan pemeliharaan, 1 ekor anak babi harganya Rp. 450.000 X 10 = Rp. 4.500.000.- Biaya pakan selama 3 bulan Rp. 3.000.000,-. Keuntungan bersihnya Rp.1.500.000,-. Dengan memiliki 2 induk, Sayu Ketut Meling yakin usahanya akan sukses sehingga kehidupannya bisa sejahtera dan bisa mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.
texts.en:
Besides being a home maker, Sayu also currently is involve in the pig farming program. With the Rp. 2.000.000 capital provided, she intend to buy another pig and make another pig sty for piglets. Currently her pig is pregnant and Sayu feeds her extra food during this period. In a months time the pig will produce 8-12 piglets which will be sold in the market. From her calculation she reckons that if her pig produce 10 piglets, each piglet can be sold for Rp. 450.000 X 10 = Rp. 4.500.000. Feeds for 3 months Rp. 3.000.000, her net income will be Rp.1.500.000. With 2 pigs, Sayu is sure that she will be successful and will be able to pay back the loan on time.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli induk babi dan pakan

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira Salihagić was born in 1960 and comes from Bijeljina. She is divorced and lives with her son (he is employed) and her daughter who is in secondary school. She divorced a few years ago and now she is ready to take things into her own hands.

Emira is employed now; she doesn`t earn much, but enough for the beginning. She works as a butcher and she keeps poultry in season. She has her faithful customers for chicken meat and now she is able to sell it in the butcher's shop where she works.

Emira is requesting her first loan through WWI in the amount of 1200 KM to buy poultry and chicken feed. She hopes that she will earn enough for new beginning for her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry and chickenfeed

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Sarni

texts.id:
Dengan kandang yang sederhana, Ni Nyoman Sarni dengan semangat membantu  suaminya dengan cara memelihara babi .Sarni bisa memberi tambahan untuk kebutuhan keluarga. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, Ni Nyoman Sarni tergabung dalam program ternak babi dari Yayasan Dinari Modal Yang dimiliki sebanyak Rp.5.000.000,- dengan modal ini Ni Nyoman Sarni bisa mengembangkan usaha ternaknya. Modal Rp.1000.000,-digunakan untuk beli bibit sebanyak 2 ekor dan Rp. 3000.000,- untuk membeli pakan selama 6 bulan. Babi yang dipelihara ini akan dijual untuk babi guling.
Dalam 3 bulan bisa mendapat untung 1000.000,-karena dalam 3 bulan babi sudah bisa dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh digunakan untuk membiayai anak-anaknya sekolah dan sebagian untuk keperluan rumah tangganya.Ni Nyoman Sarni tidak sendiri dalam memelihara babinya. Dia dibantu  anaknya yang duduk dibangku SMA. Dengan semnagat Ni Nyoman Sarni menekuni usaha ini, karena sudah bisa dirasakan keuntungannya.
texts.en:
Sarni is helps her husband by rearing pigs, she participated in the pig farming program. From the Rp.5.000.000 capital, Sarni intends to use Rp.1000.000 to buy 2 piglets, and Rp. 3000.000 to buy pig feedings for 6 months. In 3 months time she will profit 1000.000 from selling the pigs. With this she intends to raise her children and support her family. Her children helps her in rearing the pigs as well. Sarni puts a lot of effort in doing this, because she knows she will be successful in this.

Translated from Indonesian by Bernard Lim, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Membeli anak babi dan pakan

loans.name: Nermina

texts.en:
Nermina Stajić is 28 years old and comes from Bijeljina. She is married and her husband has a seasonal job. They have a 5-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter. Nermina works in a butcher's shop and besides that she has a garden at home.

Nermina made an agreement with the owner of the butcher's shop to sell chicken meat that she produces in the butcher's shop where she works. She was already busy with raising poultry as her seasonal work and now she wants to do it again. That is the reason why she has requested a loan through WWI in the amount of 1200 KM.

Nermina will use this amount to buy chickens and chickenfeed. She hopes to earn enough to support her family when her husband doesn`t have work.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chickenfeed

loans.name: Ni Komang Sutari

texts.id:
Even with no children to support, Sutari still needs to work hard for her retirement. Sutari participated in the pig farming program. From the capital of Rp.5.000.000, she bought 2 piglets, Rp. 3000.000 used to to buy pig feedings, and Rp.1000.000 to repair the pig sty. She lives with her husband Gede Natra at their own home. Her husband also help her with rearing the pigs. The profit from this pig farming, will be used to sustain their daily life, and increase their number of pigs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Bernard Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun sudah tidak menanggung anak, Ni Komang Sutari tetap berusaha untuk kelanjutan hidupnya. Ni Komang Sutari bergabung dengan program ternak babi selama 6 bulan dan masa pengembalian pinjaman pada akhir periode. Dengan modal pinjaman Rp.5.000.000,- Ni Komang Sutari membeli bibit babi sebanyak 2 ekor karena bibit sudah besar. Kandang yang dimiliki untuk memelihara babinya sangat sederhana, terbuat dari dinding bambu dan lantai semen. Selain membeli bibit babi, uang sejumlah Rp. 3000.000,- digunakan untuk membeli pakan. Sisa yang Rp.1000.000 untuk perbaiki kandang. Kadang - kadang pemberian pakan babi diselingi dengan makanan tradisional seperti: batang pisang, daun lantoro dan kangkung. Rumah yang dihuni sekarang bersama suaminya, Gede Natra, adalah rumah milik sendiri. Suami Sutari juga sering membantu istrinya memberi makan babinya. Semua keuntungan yang didapat digunakan untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan juga untuk pengembangan usaha babinya.

loans.use: Membeli anak babi, pakan dan memperbaiki kandang

loans.name: Wema Hauozi Group

texts.en:
Rehema has owned a shop in Zanzibar for three years. She is 30 years old, divorced, and has two children. Her children are 14 and 7 years old. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $130 each month. She is hoping that this loan will help her to increase her profit so that she is better able to support her family.

Rehema has four sub-group members with whom she will be sharing the loan. They also own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma recently opened a shop selling perfumes in Zanzibar.  She is married with two children, aged 21 and 14.  She works every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $18.  She would like to take out this loan to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more perfumes for her business

loans.name: Seum

texts.en: Seum S., 26, is a good housewife living in Kampong Cham with two of her children and her husband. Her husband has a business selling firewood to earn a profit of US$3 each day. Inflation makes it difficult, especially for poor people, to support their family. The price of rice and fertilizers has doubled in the past year while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the ADB reported lately. Mrs. Seum would like to take out a loan of US$800. She will use US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport fish and US$200 to repair their house.

loans.use: Seum would like to purchase a motorbike and repair her house.

loans.name: Teung

texts.en: Teung L., 43, is married and lives with her five children in the Kampong Cham province. She work selling vegetables in the morning and soup in the evening and she makes about US$2.50 each day, while her husband works selling roasted eggs, making US$2.50 each day as well. Teung has requested a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike and a grill cart (that can cook the eggs) that can attach with the motorbike. This will allow them to travel and serve more customers.

loans.use: Teung would like to purchase a motorbike with a grill cart to expand her family business.

loans.name: Raimundo Vicente

texts.pt:
Raimundo Vicente M. é natural de Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem , casado maritalmente e pai de 6 filhos com idades entre 18 anos o mais velho e 1 anos o mais novo. 4 vão a escola. Para alem da sua família sustenta a sua mãe enviando comida periodicamente.

Raimundo estudou até 5ªclasse e continuou por ter perdido muito cedo o seu pai e a sua mãe era camponesa não conseguia pagar as despesas escolares. Devido a Guerra de destabilização entre a frelimo e Renamo teve que abandonar a sua terra natal para viver na cidade de Maputo na companhia dos seus pais e com o fim desta os pais voltaram e ele preferiu permanecer cá em Maputo.

Raimundo é agricultor desde 1996, vai a machambas ( terras Cultivadas) as 5:30h e volta as 18:00h situação de esta estar a 10 km da casa e não tem transporte publico que circula nesta zona.   

Este para Raimundo é o 2º empréstimo, o primeiro foi no valor de 10000,00mt que destinou na compra de insumos agrícolas e pagou antes do tempo por que a produção foi. Assim com este empréstimos pretende adquirir insumos para aumentar a sua área de produção.
texts.en:
Raimundo Vicente M. is from the city of Chibuto, a province of Gaza located in the southern end of Mozambique. He is married and has 6 children -- their ages range from 1 to 18 years old. 4 of them are in school. Besides his family he also supports his mother by sending her food every month. Raimundo went to school up until only the 5th grade because his father passed away and his mother's income as a farm laborer was not enough to pay for education expenses. Due to the turmoil created by the Frelimo/Renamo war, he had to leave his hometown and move to Maputo with his parents. When the conflict ended they returned to Chibuto but he decided to stay. Raimundo works as a farmer since 1996; he starts his shift at the "machambas" (smallholdings) at 5:30am and ends them at 6:00pm. Everyday he has to face the struggle of not having access to public transportation to go back home (10 kilometers away) after his shift is over. This will be Raimundo's second loan request. The first one was in the amount of 10000,00mt and it was used to purchase agricultural supplies. He paid it off before the loan's term date because production was satisfactory. With this loan he intends to purchase more supplies to further expand his land's productive area.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina has had a shop in Zanzibar for six years. She sells dresses and the local fabric called "kanga." Kanga are large rectangular pieces of fabric that are decorated with brightly-colored patterns and an inscription of a local adage in Swahili. Tanzanians use kanga for many purposes, such as clothing, table cloths, towels and sofa covers. Women also use kanga as slings in which to carry their small children on their backs.

Zaina is 29 years old, married, and has four children. She currently earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She will use this loan to purchase more kanga and dress-making materials so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Henriques Mundjeya

texts.pt:
Henriques Mundjeya Miambo é natural da província de Nampula ao norte de Moçambique, tem 33 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com 3 anos de idade. Para alem da sua família sustenta um irmão que vive com ele.

Henriques mudou se da cidade de Nampula aos 14 anos para cidade de Quelimane, província da zambézia ao centro de Moçambique onde permaneceu durante 5 anos e foi sozinho, dai mudou se para província do Maputo no distrito de Boane. 

Henriques fez o ensino superior, neste momento trabalha como educador a 6 anos, com um horário das 9:30 até 15:30h e aprendeu na escola a 6 anos, este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e ja teve noutras instituições bancária BIM no valor de 15600,00mt que usou para compra de material de construção para arranque das obras.
texts.en:
Henriques Mundjeya Miambo is from the province of Nampula, located in the southern part of Mozambique. He is 33 years old, married and has a 3-year-old son. Besides his family he also supports a brother that lives with him. Henriques moved out of Nampula when he was 14 years old and relocated to Quelimane, in Mozambique's central province of Zambéia, where he resided for 5 years by himself. Later, he moved to Maputo, a district of Boane. Henriques completed his college education and he has been teaching for 6 years. His daily shift is from 9;30am until 3:30pm. This will be his first loan request through Hluvuku. Previously, he was awarded loans issued by other banking institutions, such as BIM, totalizing 15600,00mt. This money was used to purchase the initial material necessary for the construction project.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase construction materials

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa lives in the area of Burj Al Barajneh in Suburban Beirut. A mother of four, she sells cosmetic products on a door-to-door basis. Pursuing this business since 2004, Wafaa has been able to improve her living standards by buying furniture for her home and providing her children with a better education. Today, two of her children are now married. She plans to borrow $1,000 to buy more products and continue on selling her products to her neighbors and friends.

loans.use: Wafaa would like to buy more inventory of cosmetics to continue her door-to-door sales business.

loans.name: Jitihada Group

texts.en:
Azala has had a business in Zanzibar selling food for four years. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, ages 6 and 12. She works at her shop every day from 8:00am to 6:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $45. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to buy more food products to sell for a greater profit.  
Azala will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Zawadi Y.. She also owns a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: Azala would like to expand her food-selling business and Zawadi would like to improve her small business.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao H., 33, is the mother of three young children and lives with her husband and older mother at home. She is a garment factory worker making around US$4 each day, while her husband is a barber. On average, he makes US$2.5 per day. Currently, her husband just gets the commission from one hair cut because he does not have his own shop. To earn more money Mao H. would like to take out a loan to build a booth and purchase more barber tools for her husband to run his own business. (Mao's older mother is pictured as Mao and her husband was not available for picture).

loans.use: Mao would like to help her husband set up his own barber shop.

loans.name: Khin

texts.en:
Khin S., 21, is a professional who decorates handicrafts while living at home in the Phnom Penh. Since 2003, she has been using beads and other materials to make flowers on women's clothes to earn a living and typically makes US$5 each day. Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear them during the Water Festival, P'chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7–10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive. Most of the people prefer handmade than machine made. She said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she started doing this business because she was not married yet.

Khin's husband is a pig breeder making around US$6 each day. The high prices of rice, fertilizers, meat and feed for animals had made his family work very hard to support the family. He said the purchase price of rice dust, soybean and other stuff for pigs are double what he used to pay, so when he sells the pigs it is not balanced with the cost of raising them. This couple hopes the government will soon take action on inflation. Khin S. would like to take out a loan of US$1200 to expand the livestock and grow rice. She believes the investment would bring her more profit.

loans.use: Khin and her husband would like to expand their livestock and grow rice.

loans.name: Aoum

texts.en: Aoum S., 58, is one of the grocery vendors in her village and makes around US$2.50 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, making chairs, tables, cabinets, etc. On average, he makes US$2.50 each day as well. Aoum lives with three of her eight children in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Five of her children are married and no longer live at home, while one is employed and two stay at home. Aside from selling groceries, Aoum has farmland for growing rice. She has requested a loan of US$1000 to add groceries to her inventory, to purchase fertilisers and to hire a tractor to plow her farmland.

loans.use: To add groceries to her inventory, to purchase fertilisers and to hire a tractor to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Uch S., 48, is a widow who lives with four of her seven children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has a business selling groceries to the people in the village to earn a living and is able to make US$2.3 a day. She is aided by two of her children who work in construction. Every month she always receives about US$40 from them to help support the family. Uch S. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to add to her grocery's inventory and grow rice.

loans.use: Uch would like to add to her grocery store's inventory and grow rice.

loans.name: Mwaidi

texts.en: Mwaidi has had a business selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She is 27 years old, divorced, and has two children, ages 2 and 6.  She owns a shop selling food where she works every day from 5:00am to 6:00pm. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan increases her profit and expands her business.

loans.use: Mwaidi would like to expand her food-selling business
